loans.name: Olabisi

texts.en: Olabisi enjoys running her small business, in which she sells drinks and pepper soup to local customers. She has been in this business for the past eight years, and would like to expand by opening a second shop where she can sell more drinks and pepper soup. Olabisi is 30 years old, married and has three children. She has been a faithful LAPO Microfinance client for the last three years, and is applying for a loan to buy more drinks to sell to her customers and spices to make her soup. She appreciates the kind gesture shown to her by Kiva and LAPO Microfinance, and wishes to thank you for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more drinks and spices to use to make pepper soup

loans.name: Ester B.

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings) from Tanzania! This is 48-year-old Ester K. from Mbeya. She is a widow with two children, 26 and 28. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents cannot take care of them. Ester has been running a doughnut business since 2000. She prepares doughnuts or sweet round bread and sells them as snacks along the street.

Ester works at the business for 1-4 hours per day, 5 days per week and is assisted by her house girl. Ester currently earns about 30 USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to pay school fees for her children. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Ester thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility.

Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Nozira

texts.ru:
Муминджонова Нозира 1950 года рождения, таджичка,образование среднее.Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Постоянное ее место работы, вот уже 15 лет, это овощной рынок города Истаравшана. Она торгует фруктами, в основном арбузами. И в этом ей помогает ее внучка - Фарзонаи Хасан.
Просит помощи у КИВА. Ей нужно 1600 сомони для реализации и товарооборота.
 Муж Нозиры работает охранником, а сама Нозира дополнительно получает пенсию, но реализация фруктов на рынке является основным источником доходов для семьи Муминджоновых.
texts.en:
Born in 1950, Nozira M. is married and has three children. She has a secondary education. The vegetable market in the city of Istaravshan has been her permanent place of work for the last 15 years. Nozira sells fruits, mainly watermelons. Her granddaughter, Farzonai Khasan, helps her with the business. Nozira reached out to Kiva for help. She needs a sum of 1600 somoni for sales and product turnover. Nozira’s husband works as a security guard, and Nozira also receives an additional income from her pension. However, the fruit sales business provides the primary income for the family.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase product turnover

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es: CarmeL. tiene 37 años, vive con sus hijos en su casa propia. DesD. niña se ha dedicado a las tareas del campo, ya que proviene D. una familia D. agricultores, y como aun vive en su pueblo natal, L. herencia D. sus padres, sus tierras, es lo que tiene para generarse los ingresos económicos para sostener a su familia. Cada día se levanta muy temprano para cuidar D. sus animales, lo cuales venderá en L. feria ganadera D. su localidad, aprovechando a su vez, para L. venta D. guano. Cuando llega L. época D. cosecha, venD. directamente sus productos en el mercado y D. esa manera se generara mayores ganancias, sus hijos varones L. ayudan en las tareas más duras como las D. cargar los sacos para transportarlos. Para más adelante, CarmeL. quiere incrementar L. cantidad D. ovejas y toretes que tiene, ya que con estos, pueD. producir más guano para vender. Este es su préstamo número 14 con MFP, elL. es una D. las integrantes más antiguas D. su banco comunal, y L. que siempre promueve L. unidad, es por ello que renueva el compromiso D. seguir adelante por el bienestar común D. su grupo. El dinero que CarmeL. está solicitando es para L. compra D. ovejas, y D. esa manera, aumentar L. cantidad D. animales que tiene.
texts.en:
CarmeL. is 37 years old and lives with her children in her own house. She comes from a family of farmers and has worked the land since she was a child. She still lives in the town where she was born and has the land she inherited from her parents. She uses it to earn an income and support her family. She gets up early every day to take care of her animals, which she will sell, along with manure, at livestock markets in the area. At harvest time, she sells her products by direct sale in the market, thereby earning more profit. Her male children help her with the harder tasks like lifting and moving sacks. In the future, CarmeL. wants to have more sheep and young bulls so they produce more manure to sell. This is her 14th loan with MFP. She is one of the longest standing members of her communal bank, and the one that always works towards collaboration. That is why she is renewing her commitment to continue for the well being of her group. CarmeL. requests money to purchase sheep so she can have more animals.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more sheep

loans.name: Nhoek

texts.en:
Mrs. K., age 33, has been married for many years. She has been a silk weaver for 19 years, a skill she learned from her grandmother. She has three children who attend school. All of them assist her with weaving silk when they are free from their studies.

Mrs. K. sells her finished products to a middleman who resells them at the market in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. The villagers also hire Mrs. K. to spin silk, and she earns extra income from these jobs. In addition, her husband owns a car and uses it to pick up passers-by for income.

Mrs. K. hopes to earn more profits, so she is requesting a loan to buy mango in bulk from farmers and then sell the mango retail in the market for a profit. She will also use 40% of loan to repair a broken car.

loans.use: To buy mango in bulk from farmers

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria has a grinding machine that she uses to grind pepper, tomatoes and beans. She also sells provisions. Maria’s diversification of business comes as a result of her determination to lift her family up out of poverty and to increase her profitability. Maria is 50 years old and married with 5 children. She is requesting the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thank you

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase stocks of cloth in bulk.

loans.name: Mr. Peng Leang Heng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty people living in Kampong Trea Village in Kandal Province comprise this village bank loan group. They will use the loan for various purposes. 

Mr. Peng Leang H. is the 42-year-old village bank president. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land on which he grows vegetables. He faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy vegetable seeds. Thus, he has decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. He hopes to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Tin Tub, is a hard-working woman. This couple has three children who attend the local school. Mrs. H. Leang Hort, the group guarantor, appears in the picture with the group members.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seed

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
“Time is gold” is a quotation that Vicenta applies in her life. She is 44 years old and married to Fernando, who is a farmer. Together, they have three children. Farming is the main source of income to their family. In order to provide for the growing needs of their family, Vicenta and her husband decided to start a hog raising business.

Vicenta would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 8,000.00. She will use the loan for the maintenance of her hogs and to buy enough feed for their growth. She is also planning to purchase new piglets for additional income. She is very patient in raising the hogs because she knows that raising them is a big help in meeting her family's needs in a sustainable manner. Vicenta believes that by utilizing her time wisely in her business, she will become successful in her business endeavor.

loans.use: additional capital to support hog raising

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La señora Elsa es socia del  Banco Comunal “Manuela de Hoy II”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Camicachi de el distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 47 años de edad, estado civil casada y madre de 6 hijos, la sra. Elsa estudio secundaria completa, ella  vive en la comunidad de Rosacani.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el mismo que lo utilizo en la compra de ganado menor. 

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1700.00 Nuevos soles, para invertirlo en la compra ganado menor ovino y chancho, los cuales luego de mejorarlos los venderá en las ferias de la zona.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan  las facilidades en los pagos.
texts.en:
Sra. Elsa is a member of the Manuela de Hoy II Community Bank which is located in the Camicachi community in the key district in the El Collao province, Puno Department. Elsa is 47 years old, married and a mother of 6 children. She completed studies through high school and lives in the community of Rosacani. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 2 years, and her original loan was for 300 nuevos soles which she used to buy small livestock. Currently Elsa requests a loan for $525 to invest in the purchase of sheep and pigs, which she will then improve and sell in the fairs in the area. Her wish is to continue working, and she likes the payment facilities.

Translated from Spanish by Amy Schapiro, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of sheep and pigs

loans.name: Oyunbat

texts.en:
Oyunbat is 52 years old and lives with his wife, his youngest daughter, and a grandchild in Bayankhongor province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. A father of four, Oyunbat has raised and supported all of his children through university; his youngest is currently a student.

Oyunbat operates a metal-crafting business in his town. He produces a variety of chimney and metal goods. Before starting his metal-craft business, he worked as a professional dancer for over twenty years. However, after injuring his back he took up work as a grocery retail trader from 1997 until 2007.

Oyunbat started his metal-craft business in 2007 and has grown it into a stable operation in a short time. For the future, he hopes to expand the business by hiring assistants as the work has become hard on his back. He also dreams of one day owning his own retail space.

Oyunbat is requesting a 600,000 tugrug loan in order to purchase tools and supplies for his metal-craft business.

loans.use: To purchase tools and supplies for his metal shop

loans.name: Phang

texts.en: Phang C. is a 51-year-old farmer who lives in Kampong Chhnang Province. Phang C. is married to Mr. Sophal, age 42, who works with her in the farming business, and he appears in the picture. This couple has been planting rice two months ago but their rice is not growing well because it is lacking fertilizer. Thus, Phang C. would like a loan to buy fertilizer to fatten her crop yield.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to fatten her crop yield

loans.name: Melita

texts.es:
Melita es una socia dinámica y trabajadora, vive en el caserío de Señor de los Milagros que se encuentra ubicado en la carretera de Torna, en el distrito de Campo Verde región de Ucayali, tiene 50 años de edad y es madre de siete hijos, todos mayores de edad. Melita se dedica a la agricultura pues tiene parcelas (areas de cultivo) de yuca, frutas y arroz, actividad que lo realiza con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Mi Señor de los Milagros” desde hace un año, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles lo invirtió en la elaboración de carbón para luego venderlo.
Actualmente necesita un crédito de 1000 soles que será utilizado en la compra de madera para elaborar carbón y vender en el mercado de la localidad. La meta de Melita es tener una bodega bien surtida de productos.
texts.en:
Melita has been a dynamic, hardworking member of the “Mi Señor de los Milagros” communal bank for the past year. She lives in the Señor de los Milagros hamlet which is located off the Torna highway in the Campo Verde region of Ucayali. She is 50 years old and the mother of 7 children, all of whom are adults. Melita is a farmer and she has parcels of land where she cultivates yucca, fruits and rice together with her husband. Her first 300 sol loan was used in the making of charcoal for sale. Currently she is requesting 1000 soles to buy firewood which will be used to make charcoal for sale at the local market. Melita's goal is to have a well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood to turn into charcoal.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 42-year-old married mother of six children, all of whom are still in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the town of Kade in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Kade is a commercial town, but the majority of the inhabitants practice farming as a hobby or as a major occupation along with other trading activities. 

Janet sells maize and other food. She buys the goods from nearby communities. Janet sells at the local market and treks to markets farther away. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so she can expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Flor De Valle Alto Group

texts.es:
Flor de Valle Alto, un grupo de 11 integrantes fraternales y alegres, se reunen en el Centro Focal Villa Adela cada dos semanas, liderizadas por su mesa directiva, así Aurora A. es la Presidenta, Trini Mabel Suñagua es la Tesorera y Luz Angela G. es la Secretaria de Actas, todas elaboran su reglamento interno para trabajar durante este primer ciclo.
La mayoría de las integrantes tienen el negocio de  venta de comida y ellas necesitan el préstamo para comprar víveres, otras se dedican a tejer mantas y  necesitan comprar lana, por último algunas venden ropa, fruta y jugos y  requieren del préstamo para comprar mercadería.
Todas estan motivadas a hacer crecer sus negocios, sobre rodo por esta época de fin de año, donde el movimiento económico crece.
texts.en:
The Flor de Valle Alto (Flower of High Valley) is a group of 11 cheerful and fraternal members that meet at the Villa Adela communal bank every two weeks. Led by their governing body presided over by Aurora Aruqipa, Trini Mabel Suñagua, Treasurer, and Luz Angela G., Recording Secretary, they develop their by-laws under which they will work during this first cycle. Most of the members of this group sell prepared meals and they need the funding to buy groceries. Others are blanket weavers and need to buy wool. Lastly, some sell clothing, fruit, and juices and need funding to buy merchandise. All are motivated to see their businesses grow, above all during this end-of-year season, when economic activity is greater.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food items.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, uno de 19 años de edad y dos gemelos de 6 años. Vive en el distrito de Cayaltí, ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace seis meses se dedica a la venta por catálogo de café elaborado, todos los días recorre la ciudad de Cayaltí y sus caseríos ofreciendo su producto. Ella nos cuenta que esta iniciativa nació debido a que su esposo trabaja como chofer de transporte público y los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para solventar los ingresos familiares.

Su esfuerzo diario está teniendo resultados y sus clientes están aumentando. Rosa desea adquirir su propio sotck de café y poder garantizar una atención inmediata a sus clientes pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar su objetivo por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Su más grande es ver a su hijo mayor estudiando una carrera profesional con la que pueda asegurarse un futuro próspero. Ella es una mujer amable, carismática y muy entregada a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42 years old, she is married with three children, a 19 years old one and two 6 years old twins. She lives in Cayaltí district, one hour away from the town of Chiclayo.

Since six months ago she sells manufactured coffee by catalog. Every day she covers Cayaltí town and the surrounding hamlets offering her product. She tells us that this initiative was born because her husband works as a public transport driver and his income is not enough to cover the expenses of the family.

Her daily effort is bearing fruit and the number of her clients is increasing. Rosa wishes to purchase her own stock of coffee and to be able to guarantee her clients her immediate attention but she lacks the necessary capital to achieve her goal, so she finds herself for the first time in the position of having to ask a credit of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa [Edpyme Alternative].

Her greatest wish is to see her older son study a professional degree with which he can be assured of a prosperous future. She is a kind woman, charismatic, and very dedicated to her work.

Translated from Spanish by Cecilia Piris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of coffee by catalog to expand her business

loans.name: 14 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
Claudia C. de 28 años vende refrescos en la puerta de su casa, Vety H. de 27 años  vende comida en su domicilio hace 7 años, así como ellas, las demás integrantes de 14 de diciembre  que pertenecen al  Centro Focal German Busch venden  juguetes, plásticos y costura de chamarras.
Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería, productos y materia prima y mejorar la calidad de sus productos, así como la atención a sus clientes ya que están concientes de que existe mucha competencia en el mercado.
texts.en:
Claudia C. is 28 years old. She sells soft drinks from the door of her house. Vety H. is 27 years old. She has sold food from her home for seven years. Like them, the members of 14 de Diciembre that belong to the German Busch Center sell toys, plastic products and sew jackets. They all need the loan to purchase merchandise, products and raw materials. Also, to improve the quality of their products as well as customer service since they are aware that there is a lot of competition in the marketplace.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF INGREDIENTS AND MERCHANDISE

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en:
Tetyana is single. She runs a small business selling women’s clothing items in the central market of her hometown of Korolyovo. Tetyana doesn’t face fierce competition, which gives her business a chance to grow and flourish. She started this venture two years ago. Presently, Tetyana has 40,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her profit amounts to 3,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Tetyana is seeking a 5,000 Grivnya loan to diversify her assorted merchandise. She always has high demand for this type of inventory. Tetyana is hoping to see her business expand and remain sustainable in the future.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Mauro

texts.es: Don Mauro de 58 años de edad es casado, tiene 5 hijos el mayor de 30 años, otro de 29 años, otro de 27, otro de 23 los cuales trabajan, y la menor Eneyda de 16 años que estudia 3er año de secundaria, su esposa Socorro se encarga del cuido de la casa. Don Mauro trabaja para el Complejo Judicial de Juigalpa como vigilante desde hace 14 años. Esta solicitando su 7mo credito para repellar la casa y reforzar  los pilares que son de madera y se estan dañando, los cuales quiere reparar haciendolos de hierro y brindar mas seguridad a la casa y a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Mauro is 58 years old, is married, and has five children. His oldest is 30 years old, the next is 29, the next is 27, and the next is 23; all of these four work. The youngest is Eneyda who is 16 years old and is in her third year of high school. His wife, Socorro, manages the household. Don Mauro has been working as a guard at the Courthouse of Juigalpa for 14 years. He is seeking his seventh loan to repair his house and to reinforce its wooden pillars that are rotting. He would like to rebuild the pillars out of iron in order to provide more security to the house and to his family.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair his house and reinforce its pillars

loans.name: Confianza Y Desarrollo 2 Group

texts.en:
Hector is the coordinator of his group, Confianza y Desarrollo (Confidence and Development), and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Dominican and Haitian (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in the areas surrounding San Pedro De Macoris, an agricultural area once booming with the sugar industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. He makes his home here in a simple structure as a single father with three kids.

Hector is excited to be taking out his sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loans and grown his business. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business selling dulce de coco, a sort of candy covered concoction of ground coconut and milk, which he sells from his motorcycle. He will invest by purchasing the necessary ingredients of milk, coconut and sugar, he also has his eye out for a suitable machine to grind the coconuts with. He will use the profits to invest in his family by purchasing school supplies for his children and in his home by purchasing a new roof. His long term goal is to see his children finish high school and go to the university to be professionals. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Milk, Sugar and Coconut

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 29 year old businessman. He runs Space net communications where he sells mobile phones and mobile accessories. His business is located in a busy part of Nairobi and his customers are walk-in customers. He has requested for a loan of Kes. 50,000 to add stock of mobile phones and accessories. He says that through Faulu Kenya, his financial status has changed.  In addition to that, his social life has also improved.  He hopes to have his own house and car in the future.  He sees himself opening multiple outlets for selling his products.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Eseza

texts.en: Eseza N. is a 39 year old married woman with three children between 4 and 17 years of age.  All her children go to school. Eseza rents a two room house where she is staying with eight people. There is electricity but no piped water at home. Eseza takes care of additional family members.  The family gets two meals a day.  Eseza sells cosmetics in Bwaise. She resides and works in semi urban area on the outskirts of Kampala and works seven days a week.  She receives 20 customers a day. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping.  The major challenges she faces in her business are monthly rent, medication costs, feeding the family and increasing prices of cosmetics. Eseza has been in this business for eight years and with MCDT for eight years now servicing her eleventh loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more cosmetics and a hair dryer. Eseza is hopeful of seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business structure and her own home.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics and a hair dryer

loans.name: Tunde

texts.en: Tunde sells building materials at retail prices to his customers. He has been in this business for a long time, and he uses his experience in business to attract and retain more customers. He hopes to expand his business. He is 37 years old and married with three children. His wife has a beauty salon, and she also supports her husband in meeting the basic needs of their family. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 80,000 NGN in order to purchase more building materials to sell. He thanks all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase used electronics

loans.name: Sultan's Group

texts.en:
Sultan, a resident of Borewala (famous for its shrines) Pakistan, is the wife of M. I. and owns a small two-room house they have lived in for over 30 years.  A very caring and active lady, Sultan manages the household chores while her husband runs a grocery shop in the main market of Borewala, a highly competitive environment requiring him to keep a good stock of groceries to maintain his customers. 

Sultan is therefore requesting her second loan from Asasah so that M. can purchase groceries in bulk to remain competitive.

loans.use: To purchase groceries for grocery shop

loans.name: Alma Nubia

texts.es: Alma Nubia tiene 50 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos que trabajan por cuenta propia. Ella se dedica al servicio taxi urbano. Por lo que ella lo alquila para que puedan trabajarlo de esta manera ella brinda trabajo a la persona que lo solicite, siendo este el único medio ingreso que tiene para sobrevivir, hace más de 13 años que tiene este negocio. El crédito será destinado para compra de repuestos para el automóvil, llantas, frenos entre otras cosas. ella desea tener un nuevo vehículo para darlo a trabajar.
texts.en:
Alma Nubia is 50 years old. She has two children who work independently. She devotes herself to urban taxi service. She rents the taxi in order to be able to have it working. This way she provides work for the person who asks for it. This is the only income she has to survive on. She has had this business for over 13 years. The loan will be to buy replacement parts for the automobile. She will buy tires and brakes, among other things. She wishes to have a new vehicle in order to put it to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Angela Rosa

texts.es:
Ángela I. vive en La Villa Nueva de San Gregorio de Portoviejo, hermoso cantón de la provincia de Manabí, ella es auxiliar de enfermería, en el hospital provincial,  también  distribuye agua, para ella lo importante es trabajar y tener buenos ingresos, su esposo  trabaja de chofer en un transporte escolar, la señora Ángela para tener más ingresos  vende ropa en especial interiores en el hospital a sus compañeras y amigas del trabajo, para surtir su negocio compra en Guayaquil la mercadería y cada vez que tiene pedidos viaja.

La señora Ángela  en el hospital labora 6 horas diarias, el resto del tiempo lo dedica a sus otros negocios, Ángela deja a crédito a sus clientes.

 El crédito lo va a invertir en  mercadería, también se dedica a la venta de productos Avon, es distribuidora en Manabí, la empresa le envía desde Quito y ella lo distribuye  a los clientes.

El sueño de doña Ángela es que todos sus hijos trabajen y que no les falte nada, tiene 52 años de edad y de casada 29 años, tiene  tres hijos y su casa es propia.
texts.en:
Angela I. lives in La Villa Nueva de San Gregorio de Portoviejo, a beautiful county in the province of Manabi. She is a nursing assistant in a provincial hospital and also distributes water. For her, the most important thing is to work and make a good living. Her husband works as a chauffeur in school transportation. In order to earn more money, she sells clothing to her colleagues at the hospital and to her friends at work. To supply her business, she buys merchandise from Guayaquil and every time she has an order, she must travel to pick it up. In the hospital, Ms. Angela works six hours daily. The rest of the time she works at her other businesses. She also gives credit to her customers. She plans to invest her loan in merchandise and also to the sale of Avon products because she is a distributor in Manabi. The company sends her the products from Quito and she distributes them to the clients. Ms. Angela's dream is that all of her children work and never lack anything. She is 52 years old and has been married for 29 years. She has three children and her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase blouses, pants, pyjamas, and underwear.

loans.name: Olga Leticia

texts.es:
La señora Olga Leticia R. tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la venta de teléfonos celulares.
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio ya que desea vender accesorios y equipos más modernos pero en este momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión y esta solicitando su cooperación para que su negocio tenga mas inventario. Ya que es la fuente de ingreso para su familia y tiene dos hijos que actual mente están estudiando desea lo mejor para ellos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga Leticia R. has worked selling cellular phones for more than 5 years. She is asking for a loan to invest in her business since she is desiring to sell accessories and more modern equipment and currently does not have the money to invest. She is asking for your cooperation so that her business can have more inventory. She provides for her family financially and desires the best for her two children who are currently studying.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in business

loans.name: Mrs. Aem But Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has seven people who live in Veal Prei village in Takeo province. Mrs. Aem B. is a village bank president who was born in 1952, selected by the other members will use portion of their loan for varied ways. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family moreover she is also a weaver. Since her weaving is going well she wants to expand. So to improve her face business, Mrs. Aem B. is seeking for a loan to buy more silk. She is widow who lives with two children, and three grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy more silk

loans.name: Musuuri Ole

texts.en:
Musuuri Ole N. is 24 years old .He a single young man who is focused on farming. He does sheep rearing which he has been doing for the last five years. His target is to buy young rams during the dry season when they are not very costly, then place them in his farm which he has fenced purposely for grazing. After the rainy season when the rams have fattened, he sells them at a higher price and earns some profit.

He learned about KADET from marketing awareness done by KADET staff in his area. This will be his first loan which he is planning to use to buy more sheep for fattening to sell latter at a profit. With the anticipated profit he intends to acquire a bigger piece of land and fence it for grazing.

His future dream is that he will become a large-scale farmer in sheep rearing. He is a hardworking man and very determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: buy sheep to fatten and sell later

loans.name: Benroeo

texts.en: Benroeo J. makes a living selling cooking oil, beans and dried fish at a local market, and is applying for a loan to buy tomatoes and onions to sell to her customers. She is 34 years old and married to a farmer. They have three children, all of whom attend school. With the extra profits made possible by this loan, Benroeo hopes to be able to build her own shop.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes and onions to sell to her customers

loans.name: Amidatou

texts.fr:
Madame  Amidatou T. est  une divorcée de 24 ans et mère  de 2 enfants qui  vit chez son père dans une grande famille traditionnelle au  quartier Darsalam de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Amidatou a abandonné l’école en classe de 9 ème année fondamentale (système éducatif Malien) pour se marier. Elle a appris la couture auprès de sa mère, après avoir passé plusieurs années d’apprentissage. 
Depuis maintenant 16 ans elle exerce pour elle même. Son atelier, situé au marché de Médine, est facile d’accès ce qui constitue une des raisons de l’affluence de sa clientèle. 
Elle jouit d’une grande réputation et notoriété car ses œuvres : oreillers et habits confectionnés sont très appréciés et prisés à Ségou. 
Dans le dessein de faire face à la demande clientèle de plus en plus grande, elle  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est à son 1er prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter une nouvelle machine CORNA  sur place à Ségou. 
Madame  Amidatou T. vend ses articles confectionnés (souvent sur commande) au comptant  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet de gérer son quotidien.  
Son ambition est d’agrandir son atelier, de former beaucoup de personnes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Amidatou T., a 24-year-old divorcee and mother of two children, lives with her father in a large traditional family in the neighborhood of Darsalam, in Ségou (fourth administrative district of the Republic of Mali). Amidatou quit school in 9th grade elementary (under Mali’s education system) to get married. She learned sewing from her mother and spent several years in apprenticeship. She has been working on her own for 16 years. Her workshop at the Médine market is easily accessible, which is one of the reasons for the high customer traffic. She enjoys great reputation and notoriety as her pillows and clothes are in high demand in Ségou. In order to better serve her increasing client base, she turned to the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution. This is her first individual loan, which she intends to use to buy a new CORNA sewing machine in Ségou. Amidatou sells the clothes that she makes (often on order) for cash to a clientele consisting of both men and women. With this loan, she hopes to earn a monthly profit of 100,000FCFA. This will enable her to manage her daily life. Her goal is to expand her workshop and train numerous employees.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a Corna sewing machine

loans.name: Davaajantsan

texts.en: Davaajantsan T., 28 years old, lives with his wife and son in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Hovd province in western Mongolia.  His wife works as a nurse for a hospital, while his son attends a local kindergarten.  Davaajantsan used to operate a taxi service but then he bought a new truck from his earnings and started a transportation business which he ran from 2005 to 2009. He currently operates a car repair business in his yard. An astute and business-minded man, Davaajantsan is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan in order to purchase some repair parts, tools and paint for his car repair center

loans.use: To purchase some repair parts and tools

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
El Señor Luis Alberto M. C. tiene 37 años, el vive en concubinato  y es padre de 5 hijos a los cuales ayuda y apoya en su educación, él desde muy joven tubo su familia a las cual sustenta con diferentes trabajos a los cuales el se dedica, el es pescador, agricultor y él también trabaja como moto taxista  en el sindicato “EL SAYUBU” en la localidad de Puerto Villarroel en el trópico de Cochabamba,  en el cual esta hace mas de 10 años como socio activo, el servicio que brinda es rentable por la alta cantidad de personas que solicitan este servicio por la facilidad,  rapidez y eficiencia. El sindicato cuenta con paradas y turnos para cada afiliado, en diferentes puntos de la localidad de Ivirgarzama donde las personas acuden para solicitar dicho servicio.

Es la primera vez que el cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de una nueva motocicleta, debido a que la que tiene actualmente ya cumplió su ciclo de trabajo y de esta forma poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.

 Cabe señalar que el Luis Alberto M. C. se apersono a CIDRE a solicitar su préstamo luego de que sus compañeros de trabajo le comentaron de las buenas condiciones crediticias con las que trabaja nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Luis Alberto M. C., age 37, is in a common-law marriage.  He has five children who he helps and supports in their education.  Since he was young he had to support his family with different jobs.  He is a fisherman, a farmer, and a  “moto taxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) driver for the El Sayubu syndicate. 

He drives his taxi in Cochabamba’s Trópico area in Puerto Villaroel.  He has been an active member of the syndicate for over ten years.  The taxi service is profitable because many people use it for its ease, speed, and efficiency. The union has stops and shifts for each member at different points in the town of Ivirgarzama, where people use the taxi service.

This is his first loan with our institution.  He will use the loan to buy a new motorcycle.  His motorcycle has finished its useful life.  With the new one he will be able to provide better service to his customers.  This will allow him to improve his income, which will consequentially improve his quality of life.

Luis Alberto M. C. came in person to CIDRE's offices to ask for a loan after his coworkers told him of the institution's good credit conditions.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Helenita

texts.en:
Helenita O. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old. Helenita is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Helenita owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling coconuts and also making and selling charcoal in the local community. Helenita has been in business for over four years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Helenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Helenita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Helenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima M. is a widow  who lives in Marabahay, Brgy. Rio Tuba, Bataraza, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures:   hog raising, general store and food vending. 

Geronima joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Geronima has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15000 helped her increase her monthly income to PHP 11000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her eighth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 17000, which she intends to use to buy piglets to raise so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Geronima M. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To buy pigletts

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 60 años, es madre soltera, vive en casa alquilada en compañía de su hijo. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana; después de una hora en carro, acude al cafetín del instituto de energía Nuclear, donde Hilda, se dedica al negocio de venta de café, sándwich, queques,  galletas y gaseosas. Sus clientes gustan de su trato amable y la buena atención que les brinda, es por eso que siempre esta lleno de compradores. En  su negocio se siente muy contenta, por las rentas que le genera su negocio, permitiéndole pagar a su ayudante, quien le es muy útil en su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es que se relaciona con mucha gente, con los que conversa mucho y se mantiene muy ocupada. En adelante, quiere comprarse una vitrina, donde pueda exhibir sus postres. Es su 11avo crédito con MFP, y ya sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesta hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un a socia muy alegre y responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará diversidad de golosinas y gaseosas para implementar su cafetín.
texts.en:
Hilda is 60 years old.  She is a single mother and lives in a rental house with her son.  Every day, very early in the morning, after one hour in the car, she arrives at the café at the Instituto de Engergia Nuclear (Institute for Nuclear Energy) where she works selling coffee, sandwiches, cakes, cookies and soda.  Her customers like her friendly service and so her café is always full.  She feels very happy with her business because of the money it makes which allows her to pay an assistant.  Her assistant is very helpful in the business.  What she most likes about the work is that she gets to interact with a lot of people.  She chats a lot to her customers and is kept very busy.  In the future, she would like to buy a display case where she can display her desserts.

This is Hilda's 11th loan from MFP and she knows that she has to make her repayments punctually.  She is ready to do this.  She is a very happy and responsible member of her community bank.  She will use this loan to buy a variety of candies and soda to keep her café going.

loans.use: To buy a variety of candies and soda to keep her business going

loans.name: Dios Nos Ama Group

texts.es: Buenas ideas D. negocio y mucha dedicación es lo que caracteriza a este grupo comunal llamado Dios nos Ama conformado por 7 mujeres empeñosas por salir adelante. Conformado hace 4 meses demuestran tener los ánimos indicados para surgir, tal es a si el caso D. una D. las integrante L. señora María Santillán D. 33 años D. edad madre soltera D. 3 hijos, los cuales son su motor D. vida. ElL. por las mañanas atienD. los quehaceres D. L. casa y por las tardes se dedica a L. venta D. anticuchos (una comida típica del país), el cual es el medio D. ingresos económicos y único sustento en su hogar. Con el esfuerzo D. L. venta D. anticuchos a podido salir adelante y darles una educación  a sus hijos el cual siguen en el colegio también ha podido comprarse un terreno en el cual piensa construir su  casa más adelante. Con el reciente préstamo piensa invertir en mejorar el inmueble donD. realiza L. venta D.  anticuchos. Al igual que L. señora María Santillán cada integrante D. L. alcancía comunal Dios nos Ama tiene una historia en particular pero si en algo coinciden es en el entusiasmo y el deseo por salir adelante para el bien D. ellas y D. sus familias.
texts.en:
Good business ideas and a lot of commitment are what characterizes this community bank called 'Dios nos Ama' (God Loves Us).  The group has 7 female members who are determined to get ahead in life.  The group was founded four months ago and the women have shown that they have the necessary drive to succeed.

One of the group's members is 33 year-old María Santillán.  She is a single mother and has three children who are the driving force in her life.  Every morning she takes care of her housework and in the afternoon she sells 'anticuchos' (a type of kebab - a traditional food in this country).  This is how she makes money and it is the only source of financial support for her household.

Through her hard work selling 'anticuchos', María has been able to get ahead in life and give her children an education (they are in high school).  She has also been able to buy a plot of land on which she plans to build a house in the future.  She plans to invest her loan in improving the building from which she sells her 'anticuchos'.  Just like María Santillán, each member of the 'Dios nos Ama' community bank has their own story to tell but what they have in common is their enthusiasm and their desire to get ahead for the good of themselves and their families.

loans.use: To invest in improving the building from which she sells her 'anticuchos' (kebabs)

loans.name: Cruz Maria

texts.es:
Cruz de 43 años, es una mujer trabajadora que le ha gustado siempre tener su propio dinero por eso decidió tener la profesión que su mama le enseño cuando ella era pequeña. 

Viviendo en una zona en el Paraíso de Guayaquil (zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y las casas están ubicadas en montañas) ha estado trabajando sola todos los días haciendo costura y confeccionando ropa por los pedidos que les hacen los clientes. Confeccionando pantalones, vestidos, blusas a sus clientes ha incrementado su negocio. 

Para continuar con su taller de confección y costura de ropa ella quiere comprar con el préstamo telas y otra parte invertirla en el negocio de su esposo y así generar más ingresos para su familia. En el futuro quiere tener un taller de costura bien surtido.
texts.en:
Cruz is 43 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who has always liked having her own money.  For this reason, she decided to work in the profession that her mom taught her when she was little.

Cruz lives in an area called Paraíso de Guayaquil (a peri-urban area with dirt roads, whose houses are in the mountains).  She works alone every day sewing and making clothes to fill orders that her customers make.  She makes pants, dresses and blouses for her customers and has increased her business.

To continue with her dressmaking workshop, she would like to use some of her loan money to buy fabric and invest the rest in her husband's business so that they can make more income for their family.  In the future, she would like to have a well-equipped dressmaking workshop.

loans.use: To buy fabric

loans.name: Saream

texts.en:
Mrs. Saream O., 25 years old, and her husband, Mr. Tina Vong, 30 years old, have been married since 2003 and have two sons. They live in a small village along National Road Number One about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Mrs. Saream O. and her husband sell mangoes. They buy mangoes under contract from fellow villagers and transport them to sell in Phnom Penh market.

The couple does not have enough capital to buy pesticide to protect the mangoes from insects. So Saream is asking for a loan of $600 for her capital.

loans.use: To purchase mangoes and buy pesticide to prevent insect damage

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 55-year-old Kadiatu K.. She is married and has five children aged 13, 15, 19, 22 and 25 years. She has three additional dependents who live with her because she wants to educate them and have them help in her business. In 1980, Kadiatu established her cooking utensils (assorted items) business. She began her business because she wanted to promote herself and her family. Working 6 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about 500,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Kadiatu has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires a new loan in order to increase her business stock and make more profits to help support her home. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. In the future, Kadiatu K. plans to help her husband build a house and educate her children to university level, travel to a neighboring country for more goods and open a wholesale shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic utensils for her business

loans.name: Jaqueline Azucena

texts.es: La señora Jaqueline Azucena, ella había solicitado un financiamiento anteriormente pues fue de gran ayuda. Por lo que su actividad económica es la venta de ropa, ya que deseaba incrementar las ventas de sus productos y por sobre todas las cosas desea diversificar y no vender solamente un producto. Jaqueline nos cuenta, que gracias a los esfuerzos y al apoyo que siempre le han brindado. Actualmente solicita este financiamiento para la compra de materia prima.  Ella sueña siempre tener una tienda grande ubicada en el mercado, que brinde estabilidad económica a ella, su mama y su familia en general.
texts.en: Jaqueline Azucena had requested a loan before, which was a great help. Her business is clothing sales, and she wanted to increase her product sales and, above all, she wants to diversify and not just sell one product. Jaqueline thanks us for the work and support with have always given her. She is now requesting this loan to purchase basic items. She always dreams of having a big store located in the market, which would give her financial stability, for herself, her mom, and her family in general.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widowed woman with six children, all adults now. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Fatuma has operated a business selling cashew nuts for the past fifteen years. She sells at the market to her neighbors and market dwellers. Fatuma faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. Fatuma plans to use the 30,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of cashew nuts for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her livelihood.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of cashew nuts

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Maria de 59 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio ya que desde joven comenzó con su gabinete de belleza. 

Quiere seguir trabajando para asegurar su futuro  por eso ahora trabaja desde muy temprano. Quiere comprar con el préstamo herramientas para su gabinete de belleza. Ya que cada corte de cabello lo cobrar a partir de $ 2.00. En el futuro quiere que toda su familia este bien saludable y que su negocio siga prosperando.
texts.en:
María, 59, is a hard working woman with lots of hope in her business; she started a beauty salon when she was young.

She wants to continue working to assure her future; this is why she starts working very early.  She wants to use the loan to buy tools for her beauty salon; her haircuts start at $2.00.  

She hopes her family will be very healthy in the future and that her business continues to prosper.

loans.use: Work tools.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros A. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 45 and married with six school-aged children. To make a living, Milagros owns a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Milagros has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Milagros joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from ASKI and is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP to purchase additional food. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Milagros from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make food to sell

loans.name: Sochenda's Group

texts.en:
The six members who make up this group loan will use their portions of the loan for different purposes that can improve their families' standard of living. They have selected Mrs. Sochenda to become the group leader. 

Mrs. Sochenda was born in 1959. She is a widow with two children, one of whom is a seamstress in garment factory. The other is studying in local public school. 

She is a chicken breeder and a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land where she can grow rice. She sells a part of the rice and mills another part and then sells it. The rest of the rice she uses to support her family. 

Since her business is getting on well, she wants to expand. So to achieve this purpose, Mrs. Sochenda is seeking a loan to buy more rice for milling and selling and also to buy more chickens.

loans.use: to buy more rice for milling and to buy more chickens

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Leónidas es vecino de la comunidad de Ostional en Guanacaste, el es una persona muy trabajadora y ama la agricultura.
El se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos durante toda su vida,  y  en este momento necesita un préstamo de ₡250 000 (doscientos cincuenta mil colones) para la compra de abonos y sobre de herramientas necesarias para sembrar sus  cosechas.  El está muy motivado por que los precios han mejorado bastante. Asegura que a final de este ano tendrá más recursos económicos para disfrutar con su familia.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito  Apoyo Comunal Ostional,  una de las 110 Empresa socias de EDESA en  Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Leónidas is from the Ostional community in Guanacaste.  He is a very hard working person who loves agriculture.

He has been dedicated to raising basic grains all his life and at the moment he needs a loan of ₡250,000 to buy fertilizer and tools that he needs to plant his crops.  He is very motivated because prices have greatly improved and he is certain that by the end of this year he will have more financial resources to enjoy with his family.

He is part of the “Empresa de Crédito Apoyo Comunal Ostional,” one of the 110 EDESA social businesses in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy farm tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys O. es una mujer muy trabajadora y creativa que tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 19 a 41 años de edad, ella es viuda y vive en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias, ciudad costera al norte de Colombia, donde tiene un negocio llamado “Artesanías Gladis”.  
En 1981 cuando llegó a Cartagena en su propia casa empezó a elaborar las artesanías y venderlas a personas muy cercanas,  ella tenía un local  comercial en el centro de la ciudad  pero sus propietarios  vendieron la infraestructura y debió cerrarlo, como Gladys es persistente  se dedicó  a la pedagogía enseñando su arte y posteriormente organizó ferias artesanales y volvió a ubicarse y a conseguir su clientela;  su meta es darle mayor publicidad a su negocio para que pueda promocionarlo  nuevamente y lograr un crecimiento importante que le genera mayores ingresos .   Gladys  vive en un barrio tradicional y turístico provisto de inmensas casas coloniales,  aledaño a la Bahía de Cartagena y a un sector comercial en crecimiento que se encuentra muy  cercano al puerto de la ciudad. Sus clientes principales están ubicados en los barrios Manga, Pie de la Popa y en Bocagrande. Sus pasivos están representados en cuentas por pagar a proveedores y su negocio permanentemente está bien surtido; en la actualidad está aplicando a su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprará insumos para elaborar artesanías que no tiene en existencia y sobre un pedido, y además pagará a sus proveedores para ganarse un importante descuento que le servirá para reinvertirlo, mientras Magaly construye su sueño trabaja persistentemente con una rentabilidad no menor del 32% , que  gradualmente se propone incrementar conquistando nuevos clientes de sus hermosos productos.
texts.en:
Gladys O. is a very hard-working and creative woman.  She has four children ranging from 19 to 41 years old.  She is a widow, and she lives in the city of Cartagena de Indias.  This city is on the northern coast of Colombia, and that is where she has her business, “Artesanías Gladis” (Gladis’ Handicrafts).

When she came to Cartagena in 1981 she started making handicrafts in her own home.  She sold them to people nearby.  She had a business site in the center of the city, but the owners sold the place.  She had to close her business.

As Gladys is persistent, she devoted herself to teaching her art.  Later she organized handicraft fairs.  She established her business again and got customers.  Her goal is to get more publicity for her business so that she is able to promote it again.  That way she will achieve important growth that will generate greater income.

Gladys lives in a traditional tourist neighborhood with immense colonial houses.  It borders upon the Cartagena Bay and a growing commercial sector, which is very close to the city harbor.  Her main customers are located in the Manga, Pie de la Popa, and the Bocagrande neighborhoods.  

Her liabilities are the accounts to be paid to her providers.  Her business is always well stocked.  She is now applying for her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use it to buy supplies to make handicrafts that she does not have and are on order.  She will also pay her providers in order to get an important discount, which she will use to reinvest.

While she builds her dream she persistently has a profitability of no less that 32%.  She gradually intends to increase that amount by winning new customers for her beautiful products.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make handicrafts that she does not have and are on order, and to pay her providers to get an important discount.

loans.name: Elvin Antonio

texts.es:
Elvin, 33 años de edad, soltero, es originario de la comunidad El Coyolito, ubicada en La Concordia municipio de Jinotega, de oficio agricultor. 
Elvin dice que el primer préstamo que le otorgaron le fue de gran ayuda pues logro sacar adelante su siembra de tomate, logro comprar los insumos necesarios para la siembra, pagar mano de obra, combustible, también pudo terminar de cosechar media manzana de chiltoma, aunque el precio de estos productos estuvieron un poco bajo en el mercado esto no lo desanimo si no que al contrario se animo mas a seguir cultivando hortalizas.  
El solicita el préstamo para sembrar 2 manzanas de repollo, en esta nueva siembra su papa lo va ayudar a cultivar. El espera vender esta siembra de repollo a un precio justo con el que pueda obtener buenas ganancias, le permita cubrir costos de producción y seguir invirtiendo en la cosecha de hortalizas. Quiere aumentar sus terrenos de siembras de 1 manzana dos manzanas de cultivos de repollo en la medida de lo posible para sus planes futuros.
texts.en:
Elvin, 33, is single and from the community of El Coyolito located in La Concordia in Jinotega.  He’s a farmer.

Elvin says that the first loan he was granted was of great help to him because he was able to successfully complete his tomato harvest.  He managed to buy the necessary supplies for the planting, to hire labor, buy fuel and was also able to finish harvesting half a manzana (Central American unit of area) of peppers.  Even though prices for these products were a bit low in the market, he was not discouraged.  On the contrary, he was encouraged to continue planting vegetables.

He is asking for a loan to plant two manzanas of cabbage.  His father will help him with this new crop.  He hopes to sell the cabbages at a fair price that will produce good profits that will allow him to cover production costs and to continue to invest in vegetable farming.  He wants to increase his field’s size from one manzana to two manzanas of cabbage as much as possible for the future.

loans.use: to plant cabbage.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en: Marissa, 27 years old, is married, and blessed with one child. She has been operating a retail store for almost seven years and earns a monthly income of PHP 7,000. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 from ASKI to purchase soap, shampoo, canned goods, cooking ingredients and soft drinks to sell. She hopes that generous lenders will continue to give her financial assistance, to improve and develop her business and she hopes that lenders will continue assisting her in the business so that she can further improve it and support her family with enough basic necessities.

loans.use: to purchase soap, shampoo, canned goods, cooking ingredients and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Arus

texts.en:
Arus is engaged in farming. She keeps cattle and pigs. Arus is married and lives with her husband, their child and husband’s parents. 

The couple is planning to expand their family, and to insure a stable future for the children and the grownups, Arus would like to increase her income through expanding the business. With this loan, Arus will buy more livestock.

loans.use: to buy more livestock to expand her business.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.en: Pascaline, a 24-year-old single woman with no children, sells new clothes, purchasing her products from Kampala in neighbouring Uganda and reselling them at home at slightly higher prices. This business has so far enabled her to renovate her house and help support some of her relatives. Pascaline is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to make additional profits with which she plans to open up a hair salon.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Milagro De Dios Group

texts.es: Este banco comunal se llama Milagro De Dios está conformado por 8 emprendedores que se dedican a diferentes rubros entre estos se encuentran venta de recarga, elaboración de tortillas, costurera, elaboración de tortillas, venta de recarga, costurera, destace de cerdos y venta de cuajada y helados. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comunidad del roble. Reyna es la coordinadora del grupo y se dedica a brindar el servicio de costura es una mujer muy emprendedora. Se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 7 años comenta que desde sus inicios en el negocio le ha ido muy bien, por lo que además conserva la misma clientela el negocio se encuentra ubicado en su vivienda en donde la mayoría de sus clientes conocen sus prendas. El financiamiento es para la compra de tela, tijeras, hilos, alfileres, y otros.
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is “Milagro de Dios” (God’s Miracle).  It is comprised of eight enterprising people who devote themselves to different types of work.  They can be found selling recharges, making tortillas, dressmaking, butchering pigs, and selling curd and ice cream.  All of them are in the Roble community.

Reyna is the coordinator of the group.  She is a seamstress and a very enterprising woman.  She has been doing this work for seven years.  She says that from the start the business has gone very well for her.  Also, she maintains the same customers.  The business is located in her house.  Most of her customers know her garments.

The loan is to buy fabric, scissors, thread, pins, and other items.

loans.use: to buy fabric, scissors, thread, pins, and other items.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 60 years old,  married woman with 3 children. She lives in Surallah, South Cotabato with her family.

Monina and her husband are both farmers. They primarily grow rice crops to sell. Monina also raises pigs in their backyard. She works hard to help provide for the needs 0f the family and send to send their kids to school.

Monina has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds. She hopes to be able to sustain her childrens' education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Kuña Arandu Group

texts.es:
El Comité D. Mujeres D. nombre Kuña Arandu, se conformó en  el año 2009, gracias a  la una D. las miembros, quien se acerco a la oficina D. la Fundación Paraguaya para informarse del programa, y contacto con la asesora para la formación D. un nuevo grupo y  logró juntar a 16 mujeres en sus inicios pero actualmente son 21 integrantes quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto con mucho esfuerzo y esmero ya en el séptimo ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
La Señora Carolina se dedica a la confección D. ropas, gracias a este trabajo ella ha logrado obtener los ingresos necesarios para la manutención D. la casa. Comenta que está llena D. trabajo, ya que muchas personas se acercan a ella a llevarle muchos encargos. Uno D. sus sueños es poder agrandar su taller y tener más máquinas D. costura con lo que podrá atender más trabajos D. los clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. telas, agujas hilos y demás, los cuales son materiales esenciales para su trabajo. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Arandu” Women’s Committee was formed in 2009 thanks to one of the members who came by the Fundación Paraguaya office to find out about the program and contacted an advisor to form a new group.  She gathered together 16 women at the beginning but currently there are 21 members who are working very comfortably and very hard and very dedicated in a cooperative, mutually supportive way in their seventh cycle within the program.

Carolina is a dressmaker.  Thanks to this occupation she’s been able to obtain income necessary to support her household.  She comments that she has a lot of work since many people come to her and place many orders.  One of her dreams is to enlarge her workshop and to have more sewing machines to meet customers demand.

She’s asking for the loan to buy fabric, needles, thread and others which are the essential materials needed for her work.  She thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity it gives her.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, needles and others.

loans.name: Bashiraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashiraan is married and her husband is involved in making & selling bread. He makes bread in a tandoor (a kind of oven made with mud and burns with fire in it). Bashiraan also supports her husband in his business. Both Bashiraan and her husband have divided working hours between them and operate their business in this way. Bashiraan is also a very good housewife and performs her routine tasks very well. She has given birth to six children. One of her children works while the others stay at home. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of their business of making bread. With the loan, they will buy flour and wood in a larger quantity to make bread and increase their profits. Bashiraan hopes that an investment will bring positive changes to their business and make them more profits.
 
Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Bashiraan.

loans.use: To buy flour and firewood

loans.name: Kayunga Market Women's Group A

texts.en:
Many people like Cate enjoy munching away on fresh fruit and vegetables. Cate figured selling something she herself is partial to would be a worthwhile and an enjoyable venture. It was 20 years ago when she took root in this business. She plies her trade in Kayunga. What's her secret and what unravels her longevity?

Cate says when all is said and done, only hard work, determination and perseverance have kept her business afloat. She says she began her involvement in this trade with no experience but casting her mind back, she says the fact that many people consumed fresh fruit and vegetables back in the day came in really handy.

Cate took stock of the fact that her business would benefit more if she started planting her own fruits and vegetables. She embarked on fruit and vegetable farming some years later and to a greater magnitude, it has lent countenance to her business transactions. Cate sells fresh pumpkins, sweet bananas, onions, tomatoes, apples, oranges, etc. Monthly she says her sales profits add up to Uganda shillings 200,000.

Cate reckons she will at length be able to earn more once she gets this loan. Cate says she is to use her Kiva loan to purchase more high value pumpkin, tomato and pineapple seeds to replant. She says if she starts harvesting on  a bigger scale, her odds of further financial success are in the ascendant.

loans.use: to purchase more high value pumpkin, tomato and pineapple seeds to replant.

loans.name: Mawar Merah 3 Group

texts.en: Anita has been selling nasi uduk (an Indonesian rice dish) since 2006. She is 37 years old and married with two children. The older one, eight years old, is in the third grade. The youngest one, five years old, doesn't go to school yet. She runs her business from her house. Up to now, the business has been growing well and more customers have been coming. From this business, she can help supplement her husband's income and contribute to buying items for daily needs. With this loan, Anita wants to expand her menu by adding fresh juice. In the future, she wants to open a kiosk or general store. For her family, she hopes she and her husband can send their children to school through college. Anita is in the middle, wearing a yellow shirt.

loans.use: to pay for fresh fruits to produce juice for sale

loans.name: Margueritte

texts.en: Margueritte is 49 years old and married to a businessman. She has 5 children, aged 20 – 29. She owns a bar which she has been running for 20 years. Margueritte would like a loan to increase her inventory at the bar. She will use the profits to renovate the house and create a savings for her future.

loans.use: To buy more beers for sale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 54-year-old married man with four children and he owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been dealing in electronics for twelve years. He started with UGX 200,000 and now has UGX 3,000,000 as his working capital. His hardship is limited capital and his vision is to have an electrical and mechanical workshop, buying land and educating his children. Samuel needs the loan to buy electrical materials to sell.

loans.use: to buy electrical materials to sell.

loans.name: Rocio Antonia

texts.es:
Rocio es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene  29  años de edad, está casada y tiene un hijo, la señora estudió educación secundaria.

Desde hace once años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que incrementó al capital de su negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1500.00 nuevo soles, comprará víveres como arroz, azúcar, fideos, papa y otros insumos para la preparación de alimentos, en el negocio le ayuda su esposo.

La señora desea tener un local propio para su restaurante y tener su casa propia.  Lo que le gusta de su Banco Comunal es la puntualidad, la responsabilidad y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Rocio, 29, is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima community bank in Juli, a district in the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno.  She is married and has one son. 

Rocio has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for eleven years.  She used her first loan for S/.300.00 new soles to support her food-sales business.  

She is applying for a S/.1500.00 new soles loan now that she will use to buy supplies like rice, sugar, pasta and potatoes, as well as the other ingredients that she needs to make the meals she sells.  Rocio's husband helps her with the business.

Rocio would like to have her own restaurant one day and own a house of her own.  What she most likes about the community bank is that it provides timely loans with reasonable conditions.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her food-sales business.

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush, lives in the city of Vanadzor with her retired mother.  She is educated in the field of economics. 

For many years, she has imported and sold clothes and crockery from Yerevan and neighboring countries.  Her shop is located in Vanadzor.  Siranush’s niece helps her with the business.

With her previous Kiva loans, Siranush was able to increase her shop’s assortment of items, sales and profits.  Siranush has never delayed her repayments.

Siranush is now seeking a loan of 1,000,000 AMD from Kiva lenders to buy a variety of winter outerwear to resell.

loans.use: to buy a variety of winter outerwear to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Tatiana Maybeth

texts.es:
Tatiana tiene 20 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene una hija, vive con el esposo y con la hija de 2 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los ríos.
La VRC JERUSALEN, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto El caimito, Perteneciente a la Parroquia Puerto Pechiche Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores Agrícolas de ciclo Corto siembra de maíz, arroz, frejol Gandul.
Tatiana se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos. Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en Ventanas.
Solicita el crédito para la agricultura y poder comprar semillas, abonos agrícolas, fertilizantes.
Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá comprar insumos. El sueño es poder tener una casa, no se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta dedicarse más a la hija.


Con el crédito anterior invirtio en la agricultura, la situación de la familia ha mejorado, los ingresos han sido más notorios porque puede aportar en el beneficio de la familia.
texts.en:
Tatiana is 20 years old and is in a common-law marriage from which she has one daughter.  She lives with her husband and 2-year-old daughter in the Ventanas Canton in the Los Ríos province.

The Jerusalen communal bank is located in the El Caimito district, which is part of the Puerto Pechice parish in Pueblo Viejo Canton.  This bank focuses on agricultural work with a short-cycle, with members growing corn, rice and pigeon peas.

Tatiana works doing domestic domestic chores.  She makes her purchases and sales in Ventanas.

She is requesting the loan for farming so that she can purchase seeds, agricultural manure, and fertilizers.

With the help of the loan, she will be able to purchase supplies.  Her dream is to be able to have a house.  She hasn't experienced any kind of problems with her work. 

In her free time she likes to spend time with her daughter.

She invested her earlier loan in farming.  Her family situation has improved, and her income has become more significant because she has been able to contribute to her family's well-being.

loans.use: with her farming so she can buy seeds, agricultural manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fish to sell for her business.

Alona has been in this business for seven years. She also earns income from her sari-sari store.

Alona has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business and send her child to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of fish to sell.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El señor Fernando  es un joven trabajador con deseos de ser alguien en la vida y tener una familia un negocio y ayudar a su localidad.
El se dedica a la vente de  chiles secos y semillas para chiles, maíz  y lecha, el nos comenta que también trabaja de albañil y en el campo chapaonando y  siembra de árboles.
El pidió el préstamo para comprar  más semillas  y chiles para la siembra ya que es un buen negocio dejan buenas ganancias  y  aprendes cosas nuevas de él.
Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para seguir  creciendo y mejorar su vida y la su madre.
texts.en:
Señor Fernando is a hard-working young man who wants to be somebody in life.  He also wants to have a family and  a business and to help his town.  He sells dried chilies, chili seeds, corn and milk for a living.  He tells us that he also works as a bricklayer and in the field planting trees and weeding around them.  He is requesting a loan to buy more chilies and seeds for planting as this is a good business that brings in a good income and he is learning a lot from it.  

He is grateful to Fundación for the support that they have given him to continue growing and improve his life and that of his mother.

loans.use: purchase chilies and chili seeds for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, and iron rebar.

loans.name: Joel

texts.es:
Joel de 35 años, soltero, vive en una colonia periférica de San Pedro Sula junto a sus dos hijas de tres y cinco años de edad.
Desde muy pequeño aprendió a confeccionar ropa junto a su padre, quien le enseño un medio de ganarse la vida,  tiene aproximadamente siete años de trabajar en su propio negocio independiente y brinda el servicio de confección de ropa de vestir como camisas, pantalones y pantalones cortos para hombres. Además realiza otra actividad de reparación de zapatos. A la sastrería le dedica todo el día y todos los días de la semana. Esta solicitando su primer préstamo a ODEF, para comprar materia prima como telas, hilos, agujas y otros materiales para la confección de ropa. Tiene como meta brindar un mejor servicio para aumentar sus ingresos y lograr que sus hijas estudien y tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Joel is 35 years old and single.  He lives in one of San Pedro Sula’s outlying neighborhood with his two daughters, ages three and five.
