He learned how to make clothes from his father, who taught him a way of making a living, when he was very young. He has been working in his own independent business for approximately seven years.  He makes clothes like shirts, pants, and shorts for men.

He also has another business activity, repairing shoes.  He works all day every day of the week making clothes.

He is requesting his first loan from ODEF.  He will use it to buy raw material like fabric, thread, needles, and other materials for making clothes.  His goal is to provide better service in order to increase his income, to enroll his daughters in school, and to give them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other items for making clothes.

location.town: Colonia Cerrito Lindo, San Pedro Sula

loans.name: Madeleine Justina

texts.es:
Madeleine es una mujer de 42 años, vive en la ciudad de Ica con su esposo y sus dos hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que junto con su esposo dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Madeleine no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Educación, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pescado Frito para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Madeleine trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de choclos y zapallos, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a sus clientes.
Madeleine se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad de choclos y zapallos, los cuales le servirán de mucho para abastecer su negocio y atender a más clientes, así pues Madeleine seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Madeleine is a 42-year-old woman. She lives in the city of Ica with her husband and their two children, whom she loves and who are her principal cause in life. 

She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic woman who, with her husband, dedicates all her effort to getting their family ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and the need she had to work at a very young age, Madeleine was unable to study for a professional degree in Education.

In her free time, she likes to watch movies and on some occasions she cooks a delicious fried fish meal to share with her family.

Madeleine works in her small business selling corn and pumpkins on her own initiative and with much effort and dedication. She works every day for approximately 10 hours and believes it is going well for her due to her good prices and the friendly treatment she offers her clients. 

Madeleine is very thankful to the Kiva lenders since, thanks to the help they offer, she will be able to buy a larger quantity of corn and pumpkins, which will help her to supply her business and attend to more clients. 

In this way, Madeleine will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of having her own home.

loans.use: to buy corn and pumpkins

loans.name: Durga Group

texts.en:
Shrimati Purnnami, the featured member of Durga Self Help Group, is a permanent resident of the village Bhaludongri of Nuapada district of Odisha, India. She hails from a Schedule Tribe (ST) family. Schedule Tribe people in India are considered to be one of the most underdeveloped community. The majority people of them are socially, educationally and economically deprived. 

Shrimati Purnnami, the confident lady standing with raised hand in the photo, hails from this background. She is a married lady of 27 years having a daughter of 8 years and a son of 6 years. She resides in a small house with her husband and children. 

Shrimati Purnnami is basically a farmer. She and her husband do various types of cultivation in their land. They cultivate mainly vegetables, ground nuts and onion in the field. She has also a dug well in the plot from where she uses the water for cultivation. Shrimati Purnnami uses the traditional water lifting system and irrigates her land, which is very time taking and difficult work. In spite of her interest to cover the entire area for cultivation, she could not do this due to this factor. 

The income which she earns from the above business is not sufficient to maintain her family and invest for the cultivation work. Therefore, she wants to expand her business by taking a loan. So she motivated nine other women from her village and formed the SHG (self-help group) named Durga, contacted Mahashakti Foundation and took a loan of 120,000 INR. Shrimati Purnnami has taken 12,000 INR from that, and she will utilize the present loan to buy a water pump; ground nut, onion and vegetable seeds; fertilizer; and pesticides for her farm. She expects that this investment will save her time and energy to obtain a good return. Shrimati Purnnami dreams to construct a house and of a better education of her son. She hopes to give her family a bright future through her hard work.

Among the other nine members, seven members are doing vegetable cultivation and two members are doing animal trading businesses. They are also very much hopeful to increase their income by investing the present loan in a proper manner for better livelihoods.

loans.use: to pay for a water pump; ground nut, onion and vegetable seeds; fertilizer; and pesticides for her farm.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.en: Isabel is a student at the Agricultural Institute of Boane in rural, southern Mozambique.  In this program, she has been given the opportunity to be an extension worker, so she can earn some income to also help provide for her family.  She will visit farmers in the region and bring them important materials like chemicals and fertilizers, and she will provide advice on how to improve their crops.  The more farmers she can visit each week, the more she can earn.  With a bicycle, she expects to double her visits to farmers and double her weekly income.  Isabel is the oldest of four children, and so her income provides for her family.

loans.use: to buy a quality bicycle to increase the number of farmers that this Agriculture Student and Extension worker can visit.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba  is a 46 years old, married woman. Her husband(also shown in the photo) has been actively running a ‘Tandoor’ in his locality for many years. A tandoor (clay oven) is used for cooking chapattis and naan especially in Pakistan. He cooks chapattis and naan with flour, salt and oil then sells them to the people of his community. He also takes orders from nearby hotels and makes enough money to have a decent life.  For the improvement of her husband's business Habiba  has applied for a Murabaha loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase more sacks of flour and packs of salt and oil. She dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of flour and packs of salt and oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Alice would like to buy more seedlings to plant on her land

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
For Zoya, selling sporting goods has been a family business. She and her husband have successfully operated two sales kiosks for nearly eleven years, one located in a market and another at a nearby shopping center, that offer a variety of sports related clothing and equipment. Zoya and her husband have sought to create an atmosphere that encourages customers to come back to their stores. One of the ways they have tried to accomplish this is to consistently replenish their stock with newer products. Their current net profit amounts to around $400 per month. Zoya is an entrepreneur who is full of life. Her ability to accomplish her goals makes her a solid client with Nadiya Ukraine. Her entrepreneurial spirit and good relationship with customers has helped place the business in a favorable position to grow. Ensuring growth for the business will allow her to see her daughter receive a college education upon her graduation from high school this year. Zoya has requested $1200 in order to purchase spring items such as shorts and t-shirts and some additional sports equipment. She and her husband want to be prepared for what they hope will be another busy and profitable sports season in the Ukraine.

Бізнес з продажу спорттоварів, яким займається Зоя, давно став сімейним. На протязі останніх 11 років вони з чоловіком володіють двома кіосками: один з них знаходиться на ринку, інший – в торговому центрі. Торгують вони спортивним одягом та супровідними товарами. Зоя доклала багато зусиль для того, щоб створити привітну атмосферу, яка спонукає покупців повертатися до її кіоску знову й знов. Цьому сприяв також й широкий асортимент товарів, який можна знайти в їхньому кіоску. Зараз її щомісячний чистий прибуток складає приблизно 400 доларів. Зоя – дуже життєрадісна жінка. Її здатність досягати своїх цілей допомогла їй зарекомендувати себе як відповідального клієнта в роботі з „Надією України”. Заповзятливість та привітність у роботі з покупцями дають їй певну перевагу серед інших торговців на ринку. Подальше розширення її бізнесу сприятиме отриманню стабільного прибутку, що, в свою чергу, допоможе Зої заплатити за навчання її доньки в університеті цього року. Зоя просить про позику в 1200 доларів для того, щоб закупити весняні товари, а саме, шорти, футболки та додатковий спортивний інвентар. Вона хоче придбати усе необхідне для того, щоб підготуватися до ще одного прибуткового спортивного сезону в Україні.

loans.use: Buy sports equipment and seasonal clothes

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Mrs. Patience I. is one of LAPO's group leaders.  She is 40 years old, and a trained seller of wood.  She is energetic, zealous and optimistic in all her dealings.  She is requesting a loan of $650 to improve her business

loans.use: To buy more wood to sell

loans.name: Abdumubin

texts.ru:
Abdumubin is a young man who never feels down and always looks to the future. When he was little and in school he took his father’s bulls and cows out to pasture. Huge bulls and cows listened to the little boy. While the herd grazed Abdumubin did his homework and read books. In the evening he brought the herd home. That is why he developed a love of animals from childhood. According to his father, since childhood Abdumubin wanted to build a farm that fed livestock. He is also a butcher.

Today, Abdumubin has his own family – a wife and 3 children. The youngest is not yet one. Abdumubin lives with his family in his parents’ home, since he is the youngest child in the family. The dream of his childhood – the feeding of livestock has become his sole source of income. Sometimes he earns extra income by working as a taxi driver using his old car. During this time his wife and father look after the livestock at home. To expand his livestock Abdumubin turned to MLF MicroInvest and after getting a loan of $950 purchased four small bulls. The loan assisted him in earning extra profits. Abdumubin keeps all records of the business – revenues, cost and profits – in a special notebook. Profits from feeding livestock are good right now, because upkeep is cheaper in the summer. Abdumubin will use the new loan to continue his business.

Translated from Russian by Sabina H., Kiva Volunteer.

Абдумубин молодой человек, никогда не унывающий, стремящийся только вперед. Еще маленьким когда он учился в школе он выводил пастись на поле коров и быков своего отца. Огромные быки и коровы слушались маленького мальчика Пока стадо паслось он готовил домашние задание школы и читал книжки. Вечером гнал стадо домой. Поэтому любовь к домашним животным была у Абдумубина с детства. По словам его отца он с детства мечтал построить ферму по откорму крупного рогатого скота. Также у него есть профессия мясничества. Сейчас у Абдумубина своя семья – жена и трое детей. Маленькому сыну нету еще и года. Живет со своей семьей в родительском доме, так он младший сын в семье. Мечта его детства – откорм скота стало для Абдумубина единственным источником семейного дохода. Еще иногда он подрабатывает таксистом на своем стареньком автомобиле. В это время его жена и отец ухаживают за скотом дома. Для увеличения количества скота Абдумубин обратился в Микроинвест и получив займ в размере $950 купил четырех маленьких бычков. Полученный займ способствовал получению дополнительной прибыли. Все записи по бизнесу – приход, расходы и прибыль ведет в особой тетради. Прибыль от откорма скота сейчас хорошая, так как его содержание обходится дешевле в летнее время. Абдумубин хочет получить новый займ, чтобы продолжить свою деятельность.

loans.use: for the further expansion of business

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad, 34 years old, is married with one child and owns a small grocery shop in Bourj Barajneh, in the suburbs of Beirut. Ahmad has owned the place for the past 5 years and has already taken two loans from Al Majmoua to expand his business. This time, Ahmad needs USD $1,200 to buy inventory as he wants to improve the quality and diversity of the products available in his shop.

loans.use: To buy inventory for his grocery shop

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Before 2002, Mrs. Tran Thi H.’s life was extremely difficult. She has many children, but she earned her living solely from a couple acres of rice-field. In August 2002, Mr.s H. joined TYM Fund. With her initial loan of 60USD, she buy and raise pigs. Years after years, she has becomes more confident with her ability to manage the loan. With her experience and self confidence, Mrs. H. is applying for a loan of 750USD. She wants to use this money to buy pigs, soybean to make tofu and mash to make wine. She just bought a machine to make tofu, so her production has increased significantly (On average, she sells 30 to 50 kilogram tofu per day). Mrs. H. uses by-products from making wine to feed her pigs. Every year she sells 4 litters of pigs (which weigh about 2 to 3 tons). Her husband is a farmer. He often helps her with her job, so she can have time to participate in her cluster activities as well as other hamlet and commune activities in general. Everybody in her commune trusts and respects her. Mrs. H. was appointed one of TYM’s best entrepreneurs in 2006. She hopes to continue to be member of TYM Fund, so that she can have bigger loan to expand her business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Phuong Nguyen, Kiva Volunteer.

Trước năm 2002, điều kiện gia đình chị Trần Thị Hậu gặp nhiều khó khăn, nhà đông con, ngoài làm mấy sào ruộng ra gia đình chị cũng không biết làm gì thêm nên cuộc sống đã khó khăn lại càng khó khăn hơn. Tháng 8 năm 2002 chị xin tham gia vào Quỹ Tình thương. Với vốn vay ban đầu là 1 triệu đồng chị chỉ dùng đầu tư chăn nuôi nhỏ. Qua nhiều năm tham gia chị đã tự tin vào khả năng sử dụng vốn, cộng với kinh nghiệm của bản thân đến nay chị đã mạnh dạn xin vay mức vốn 750 USD. Vốn vay được chị và gia đình đầu tư vào làm đậu phụ, nấu rượu và chăn nuôi. Từ việc phải làm thủ công, gia đình chị đã đầu tư mua máy làm đậu nên sản phẩm của chị làm ra cũng tăng lên (mỗi ngày bình quân chị bán được 30 đến 50 cân đậu phụ). Việc nấu rượu giúp chị tận dụng nguồn thức ăn dư thừa để chăn nuôi lợn. Mỗi năm chị cho xuất chuồng 4 lứa lợn (khoảng 2 đến 3 tấn). Chồng chị tuy là một nông dân nhưng rất am hiểu và tạo điều kiện giúp đỡ vợ nên ngoài công việc gia đình, chị luôn luôn tích cực tham gia sinh hoạt của cụm và hoạt động chung của thôn, xã được các thành viên tin tưởng. Tổng kết năm 2006 chị được bình chọn là một trong những thành viên làm kinh tế giỏi. Nguyện vọng của chị là tham gia Quỹ lâu dài để vay vốn lớn hơn phát triển kinh tế.

loans.use: Buy pigs, mash and soybeans

loans.name: Sebastiana's Group

texts.es:
Sebastiana is 64 years old, has 4 children and is a widow, while Edward is 30 years old, has 2 children and is separated. They have been associates of the Enthusiasts Communal Bank for 4 years and 1 year, respectively.

Sebastiana buys cereals in the fairs and sells them at the Marshal Cáceres Market . She says that she became a widow when her children were small, and, as she could not work her lands alone, she came to live in Ayacucho.

On the other hand, Edward is a driver for public transportation and also he has his nursery of grafts and vegetables. Previously Edward had a car which he used to proviD. transportation for a school in the city, but this failed because of family problems.

They need loans of 600 Peruvian soles each (total of 1,200) that will be invested in the purchase of corn, bean, barley, wheat, seeds and a part for food processing for health.

Sebastián and Edward tell us that at their Communal Bank they are distracted from their troubles: they forget for a moment their problems, they get to know more people and they also save.

Sebastiana and Edward’s dreams are to build a house, to open a store and to buy a car so that Edward can once more proviD. school transportation.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Sebastiana tiene 64 años, 4 hijos y es viuda, mientras que Edward tiene 30 años, 2 hijos y es separado. Ambos son socios del Banco Comunal Las Entusiastas desD. hace 4 años y 1 año, respectivamente.

Sebastiana compra cereales en las ferias y venD. en un puesto del Mercado Mariscal Cáceres. ElL. cuenta que quedó viuda cuando sus hijos eran pequeños, y como no podía trabajar soL. sus tierras se vino a vivir a Ayacucho.

Por otro lado Edward es conductor D. una unidad D. transporte público y también tiene su vivero D. injertos y hortalizas. Anteriormente Edward tenía su carro con el cual hacía movilidad escolar en un colegio D. L. ciudad, pero fracasó por problemas familiares.

Ellos necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, cada uno (total D. 1,200) que serán invertidos en L. compra D. maíz, fréjol, cebada, trigo, semillas y una parte para el tratamiento D. su salud.

Sebastián y Edward nos cuenan que en su Banco Comunal ellos se distraen y olvidan por un momento sus problemas, conocen más personas y también ahorran.

Los sueños D. Sebastiana y Edward son construir su casa, abrir una tienda y comprar su carro para volver hacer movilidad escolar.

loans.use: Purchase of  corn, bean, barley, wheat, seeds and a part for food processing for health.

loans.name: Ewere

texts.en: L. is into the sale of building (construction) materials. He is single and 35 years old. He is a LAPO client and a resident of Edo State. He is asking for the loan $375 to buy more building materials to sell. He learned his business for 5 years and has been in business since 2005.

loans.use: To buy more building materials to sell

loans.name: Namuwaya Central A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Annet N.. She is currently in the business of poultry and is requesting a loan to buy poultry feed and boost business. Annet is 22 years old and is single. Each week, Annet makes approximately UGX 12000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a new house. Annet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 300000 in order to bought more chicks and the loan was paid back on time.

Annet is joined in her small group by Saijalia N., Mariam N., Irene S., and Ruth N.. All of them have bakery businesses and want to use the loan to add capital and expand them.

loans.use: To add to poultry business and boost it

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 26 year old Patricia K.. She is single and has no children.

In 2005, Patricia established a hardware business. She now requires a loan to purchase additional stock in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

About SELFINA
SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock in bulk for her hardware store

loans.name: La Paz Group

texts.es:
The Community Bank “La Paz,” or Peace, is a bank that began recently with 24 members. The members are from the community of Yanama in the district of Carmen Alto, which is 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. The great majority of this group is maD. up of people who migrated from the different provinces of the district onto these lands.

The members are engaged in different businesses, such as the sale of groceries, clothes, cheeses, foods, fruits, firewood, drinks and small animals.

The members need different amounts of loans; some of the amounts are 300 soles or 600 soles, adding up a total of 12,000 soles of loans in the Community Bank.

The loans will be used for the purchase of rice, noodles, oil, sugar, beer, soft drinks, eucalyptus trees, animals, cheeses, polos, sweaters, fruits and firewood.

The dreams of the members are that their businesses prosper, they have a good house and their children have a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Helen C. Smith, Kiva Volunteer.

El Banco Comunal “La Paz” es un banco que recién inicia con 24 socios. Los socios son provenientes D. la comunidad D. Yanama, distrito D. Carmen Alto, que esta a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Esta comunidad esta integrado en gran mayoría por personas que migraron D. diferentes provincias del departamento y que invadieron estas tierras.

Los socios realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes, ropa, quesos, comidas, frutas, leña, bebidas, animales menores.

Los socios necesitan diferentes montos D. préstamos, algunos montos son D. 300 soles, 600 soles, haciendo un total D. 12,000 soles D. préstamos en el Banco Comunal.

Los préstamos lo invertirán en la compra D. arroz, fideo, aceite, azúcar, cerveza, gaseosas, árboles D. eucalipto, animales, quesos, polos, chompas, frutas y leña.

Los sueños D. los socios es que sus negocios prosperen, tener una buena casa y que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.

loans.use: The loans will be used to buy rice, noodles, oil, sugar, beer, soft drinks, eucalyptus trees, animals, cheeses, polos, sweaters, fruits and firewood.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina is a woman who has always fought to protect the well-being of her 4 children. Since she was very young she has worked in various lines of business. She continues to work presently in the capacity of vending sweets kept in a display cabinet located in the door of the municipal building of Huancayo, supplying candies to the personnel who work there. She would like to increase her capital with the objective of increasing her supplies and her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva volunteer.

Marcelina, es una mujer luchadora que siempre ha velado por el bienestar de sus 4 hijos. Desde muy joven se ha dedicado al trabajo realizando varios negocios y también lo sigue haciendo ahora ofertando dulces en una vitrina ubicada en la puerta del local municipal de su zona y ofrece sus dulces al personal que trabaja en este espacio al por mayor. Desea incrementar su capital a fin de incrementar sus ofertas y ganancias.

loans.use: To offer a greater number of candies.

loans.name: Maria Ernestina

texts.es:
Maria Ernetina began started her business nine years ago selling dried meat and a variety of meat-filled products due to the scarcity of jobs at the time. Her husband, a bricklayer, had to leave for the US to work as his income was not sufficient to support his wife and three daughters.

Maria’s sales has increased and to meet the additional demand she requires a loan of $975, repayable over six months, to purchase more ingredients and a larger table to be able to serve her customers.

With your help, Maria will succeed in getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Maria Ernestina emprendio el negocio hace 9 años debido a la escazes de trabajo que habia en ese momento, su esposo tuvo que dejar la ciudad para buscar trabajo en Estados Unidos ya que el sueldo de albañil que tenia no alcanzaba para mantener a sus 3 niñas y a su esposa, fue asi que Maria inicio la venta de carne seca entre sus vecinas para mas adelante meter la carne machaca entre la variedad de los productos.

Ahora solicita un credito por US $975 que pagara en 6 meses para incrementar las ventas ya que en estos meses es cuando se tiene mas pedidos de carne y tiene que comprar mas mercancia asi como una mesa rectangular mas grande para poder atender bien a sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Maria saldra adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients and a table

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
I need to install a more secure gate in front of my house since the one I have is made of wood and mesh, and it's very easy to open. I would like to give my family more security, and I need to make this change since we have had various mishaps. We have lived in this house for some time, and I would like to make this change so it looks better and so my family will be safer. This is a priority for me so my family will be ok while I am out working. I am requesting a loan of $600 so I can install the gate. Thank you in advance.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

Tengo la necesidad de colocar un portón mas firme en mi casa ya que con el que cuento es de maya y madera, es muy fácil de abrir y para dar mayor seguridad a mi familia requiero este cambio pues hemos tenido varios percances, tenemos ya tiempo viviendo en esta casa y me gustaría darle este cambio para dar mejor vista y mas seguridad a mi hogar como ya lo mencione, pues para mi es prioridad que mi familia se encuentre bien mientras yo este trabajando fuera. Solicito la cantidad de $600.00 dlls. Para poder colocar el portón, de ante mano gracias.

loans.use: To install a gate in front of his house.

loans.name: Sayora

texts.en: R. Sayora is 38 years old, married and the loving mother of three children. Sayora’s husband is currently unemployed, so her business is the main source of income for her family. Sayora runs a grocery store where she is sells detergents, sweets, juices, soft drinks and other food items. She has been in this business for three years. The inventory she has for sale is high quality and carefully selected, and Sayora takes good care of all of her customers, which explains why so many of them return to buy groceries again. Sayora is seeking to keep her business growing by applying for a loan of $750 for 12 months. She will use the loan to increase the number of items she has for sale. One of her dreams is that her children can get ahead through eduction, and for this she is willing to make great sacrifices, particularly to send them to university. We believe the current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Sayora reach all of her aspirations.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Matlubakhon

texts.en:
Matlubakhon A. is 42 years old. She is married with 4 children. Matlubakhon was laid off from her previous job and had to find a stable source of income so she could provide for her family. That is how she ended up as an entrepreneur.

Presently, Matlubakhon sells children’s clothing in the local central market. She offers a large variety of clothing items at a reasonable price. Matlubakhon has been in this trade for 13 years and has gained a rich experience in this kind of activity.

Today Matlubakhon is requesting a loan of 2000 Somoni (600 USD) to purchase some inventory wholesale and increase her turnover capital. She promises to repay the loan within 8 months. Her long-term plan is to open another vending facility. Moreover, Matlubakhon is hoping to use generated profit to help her daughter get a good education in a technical school. We believe her enthusiasm, motivation and desire to improve her living standards will guarantee prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchasing new clothing for children for re-sale

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru: Курбонова Кумри  жительница района А.Джоми.Возраст 57 года,вдова,имеет 4 детей.Образование средне-специальное,по специальности  медсестра. Кумри занимается куплей продажей мебели.Она имеет  небольшой магазин на рынке района. Муж клиентки умер,поэтому семью содержит она сама.На кредит хочет закупить  товар для продажи.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Kumri K. lives in the A. Jomi region of Tajikistan. She is 57 years old an is widowed. Kumri has 4 children. She is a nurse by training but she makes a living by buying and selling furniture. She has a small store at the city market. Kumri's husband died, and she is the only breadwinner in her family. She would like to use the loan for purchasing goods for retail and plans to pay off the loan in the next 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Makprang

texts.en:
Mrs. Makprang K., 37, and her husband, Mr. Leangtheng But, 43, live on an island of Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have five daughters. Two of their daughters are medicine sellers in Phnom Penh, the other two daughters study in primary school.

Mrs. Makprang has been a silk weaver for 20 years, a skill she learned from her neighbors. She sells her finished product to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Makprang is requesting a loan of $1000 which she will use for weaving business and some amount for building her house.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving and build her house.

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es: El señor José Leonel, habita en el Km. 11 ½ carretera a Masaya entrada Esquípula, todavía no es casado vive con su mamá y trabaja como Administrador de cybernik, los sueños de don José es llegar a tener su propio negocio y lograr mejorar la casa de su mamá ya que en un futuro piensa casarse y formar una familia .La mayor necesidad que tiene es la falta de financiamiento, ya que lo que el gana aporta parte para la casa y sus propios gastos. El solicita la cantidad de C$ 10.000.00 para comprar materiales de construcción y poder mejor parte de la vivienda para tener mas privacidad ya que su casa es pequeña
texts.en:
Mr. José Leonel lives at kilometer 11.5 on the highway to Masaya at Esquípula. He has not yet married, is living with his mother, and is working as an administrator at Cybernik. His dream is to have his own business and make improvements to his mother's home as he hopes to one day get married and build a family. His greatest need is financial capital, since his earnings are only enough to support the household and his own expenses. He is applying for an amount of $10,000 córdobas to buy construction materials to improve part of the house to create more privacy in their small home.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Carreón, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build an addition to the house

loans.name: Mr. Yong Paen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen people, who all live in Chreaek Village in Kampong Cham Province, make up the village bank loan. They will use the loans they obtain for different purposes. Mr. Yong P. is a village bank president and a fisherman. His catch of fish is now little because he has insufficient fishing tools. In order to increase his catch of fish, he has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets and fish lines. He hopes to catch more fish with better fishing tools. His wife, Mrs. Cheam Dam, is a housewife who cooks delicious food for her family. Mr. Yong P. is 57 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is a sculptor while another one helps him with the family fishing business. The remaining two children attend the local school.

All loans made through this village bank loan are end-of-term loans so recipients are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy more fishnets and fish lines to catch more fish.

loans.name: Thoch

texts.en: Thoch L. and her husband live with their two children in Prey Chor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. Thoch, 39, and her husband work in construction building houses and can make about $4 on an average day. She hopes to use this loan to purchase a horse and cart in order to operate a taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a horse and cart to operate a taxi.

loans.name: Liliam

texts.es:
F. 

Hace cinco años Liliam vendía frutas en un puesto del mercado de su casa. Con la idea de conseguirle un trabajo a su hermana, le dio el encargo de cuidar el puesto de venta de jugos de una compañera (quien se fue de viaje al extranjero) haciendo que el negocio continuara funcionando.

Es así que durante un tiempo, ella se encargo de vender frutas y su hermana de vender en la juguería. No obstante su hermana le dijo que porqué mejor ella se encarga de vender frutas y Liliam atendía en la juguería, pues Liliam tenía mas habilidad en la cocina que su hermana.

Entonces des hace dos años, Liliam atiende en el puesto de jugos todos los días desde la mañana hasta después de almuerzo. Ella es madre de tres menores de trece, seis y cuatro años. El padre de sus hijos no la apoya para nada es así que con la idea de progresar esta pensando abrir en su casa un negocio ya que no sabe hasta cuando tendrá a su disposición el puesto de jugos.
texts.en:
Five years ago, Liliam was selling fruit at a stand in the market near her house. While she looked for work for her sister, she left a friend (who is now out of the country on a trip) in charge of the stand so the business could keep running. So, for a while she sold fruit and her sister sold juices. However, her sister suggested it might be better if she sold the fruit, while Liliam took care of the juice bar, since Liliam was better in the kitchen than her sister. For the past two years, Liliam has worked the juice bar every day from morning until after lunch. She is the mother of three youngsters, who are 13, 6, and 4. The children's father gives Liliam no support at all, so she is thinking about starting a business in her house, as she doesn't know how long she'll have the juice stand at her disposal.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish building her house

loans.name: Nozim

texts.ru: Нозимжон  Вахобов 1970 года рождения женат имеет троих детей. Он занимается откормом скота.   Жена и дети помогают ухаживать за скотом, таким образом они поддерживают его бизнес. В регионе где он живет, основная деятельность это откорм и продажа скота. Первый кредит получил в 2007 году. Кредит потратил на покупку скота и сена для коров. Теперь он развивает свой бизнес и увеличивает скот. Нозимжон планирует в дальнейшем сотрудничать с Микроинвест и продолжить откорм  и продажи скота.
texts.en:
Nozim V., born in 1970, is married and has three children. He raises livestock, a business which his wife and children assist in by helping to care for the animals. Raising and selling livestock is the primary livelihood in the district they live in. Nozim received his first loan in 2007. That was used to buy livestock and hay for cows. Now he is further developing his business and expanding his herd. Nozim plans to continue working with Microinvest in the future as he continues raising and selling cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “La Esperanza”cumple actualmente  su 4to ciclo es decir tiene mas de un año de formacion y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya , retiran un crédito promedio de 500.000 Gs y lo utilizaran para ampliar lo que ya estan realizando como ser: la compra de tela , compra de insumos para la fabricacion de comestibles, compra de leche azucar,yerba,harina,sal panificados y verduras para su posterior venta,compra venta de bebidas como refrescos , gaseosas ,cervezas, vinos etc. Se ezfuerzan el doble para conseguir mas ingresos y asi disminuir las necesidades del hogar.

Lilian F.	Vta de cosméticos
Zulma I.	Vta de frutas y verduras
Maria Irene B. 	Despensa
Petrona R.	Vta de merceria
Maria Isabel A.	Vta de artesanias y merceria
Nilda R.	Vta de comestibles
Teodora D. 	Heladeria
Nelida de B. 	Vta de frutas y verduras
Diana F.	Vta de comestibles
Sindia L.	Vta de mercaderias varias
Susana Faría 	Vta de frutas y verduras
Mirtha F.	Vta de juguetes inflables
Blanca V.	Vta de juguetes
Marlene Bordón	Vta de chipas
Maria C. 	Fca y venta de productos de limpieza
Alicia F.	Vta de cosméticos
Faustina S.	Vta de cosmetibles
Maria Zunilda M.	Vta de dulces
texts.en:
The group “La Esperanza” (Hope) is currently in its 4th loan cycle. The group was formed over a year ago and works with Fundacion Paraguaya. They are asking for a loan of approximately 500.000 Gs [each] and they will use the money to expand the work they are already doing, like: buying fabric, buying ingredients to make prepared food, buying milk, sugar, tea, flour, salt, baked items, and vegetables for resale, buying and selling drinks like soda, beer, wine, etc. They will double their efforts to earn more income and diminish their household needs. Lilian F. sells cosmetics. Zulma I. sells fruits and vegetables Maria Irene B. has a general store. Petrona R. sells general merchandise Maria Isabel A. sells handicrafts and other goods. Nilda R. sells food. Teodora D. has an ice cream shop. Nelida de B. sells fruits and vegetables. Diana F. sells cosmetics. Sindia L. sells general merchandise Susana Faría sells fruits and vegetables Mirtha F. sells inflatable toys. Blanca V. sells toys Marlene Bordón sells chipas (a corn and cheese bread) Maria C. sells cleaning products. Alicia F. sells cosmetics. Faustina S. sells food. Maria Zunilda M. sells sweets and candy.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fabric, food ingredients, general merchandise,cosmetics, etc

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: La señora Maria tiene 43 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua, tiene un hijo que estudia la secundaria, su negocio es la venta de ropa desde hace diez años, la cual inicio con prestamos que Afodenic otorgo para seguir adelante, este es su décimo ciclo y va a invertir en infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer el porche de su casa y poder dar mejores condiciones a su familia. Su meta es poder ampliar el local como su inventario para captar clientes y vender más.
texts.en:
Maria, 43, lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the city of Managua. She has a son who is in high school. She has been selling clothes for ten years. She started her business with a loan from Afodenic to help her get ahead. This is her tenth loan cycle, and she will buy construction materials to build a porch on her house and give her family better living conditions. Her goal is to be able to expand her place of business (increase inventory) to gain new customers and sell more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to build a porch

loans.name: Asuru A Inzikuru Judith Group

texts.en: Mrs. I. Judith, 33, is married with 5 children (4 boys and 1 girl), all in school. She has been in her business of tailoring and selling clothing material for over 4 years. She will use the loan to purchase clothing material for tailoring and also for sale. She is a hard-working woman who wishes to own buses with time.

loans.use: Cloth for tailoring and resale

loans.name: Matida

texts.en: Matida N. is 55 years old and married with six children. She bakes meat pies to sell. She hopes for a loan of 150,000 nairas to purchase more baking materials like flour and baking powder to bake more meat pies to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials

loans.name: Faroq Group

texts.en:
Faroq is the group leader of Faroq group. There are five members in this group and each of them would like to receive money for their business. They have requested a loan of 50,000 Afghani.

Faroq and Aymal want to take a loan for their stationery business. They want to buy books and pens for their shop.

Aleya wants to take a loan for her husband’s general store.

K. D. wants to take a loan for his carpentry business. He wants to buy lumber for his business.

And Mahro Jan wants to take a loan for her bakery business. She wants to buy fuel for her bakery.

They are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan. They want to thank AFSG, Kiva, and all lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy books and pens for their stationery shop

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina S.-Boakye is forty-six years old and married with four children, two sons and two daughters. All are currently in school - senior high, junior high and primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband works at the local government hospital. Augustina manufactures and sells local soap called ‘Alata soap’. She sells from a table top at the market square and also supplies other retailers. She wants a loan to buy ingredients such as soda and palm oil.  Augustina has been in business for ten years and hopes to expand her business and to give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy soda and palm oil

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 30 years old. She is married and the mother of three children. Currently all are schooling.

Rose sells smoked fish at the community market where she lives and started her fish sales two years ago. She buys her stock of fish from Yeji in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She has a high customer base  and her customers travel from other parts of the surrounding communities to buy her fish.

She buys her stock of fish from the fishmongers. She requests the loan to upgrade her stock of fish. She dreams of giving her children a quality education through the proceeds of her business. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy more smoked fish and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Run

texts.en:
Mr. Run K. lives in Orn Daung Samrith village in the Takeo province. He is a house builder who makes a small income to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Mom Kiv, is a farmer. 

Mr. Run K. is 50 years old and the father of five children, three of whom are employed in different positions while the others are attending the local school. Since his children's workplace is far from home, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike for his children to go to work. His wife is on the left side of photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his children to go to work

loans.name: Tura

texts.ru: Болтаев Тура проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст 46 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Тура более 10 лет занимается земледелием. Он в основном выращивает овощи, лук. Собрав урожай он продает его на рынке, но у него также имеются постоянные клиенты. Кредит просит для закупа семян и посева урожая, а собрав продать, т.е. для увеличения товараоборота. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en:
Tura B. lives in the Shahrituz district. He is 46 years old, married and has 4 children. Tura has been involved in agriculture for over 10 years. He primarily grows vegetables and onions. After gathering the harvest, he sells it at a market, but he also has consistent clients. Tura is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, plant the crop and sell the harvest, i.e. for increasing product turnover. He wants to use resulting profits to repair his house.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing product turnover

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom T., age 35, and her husband, Mr. Sok Sot, age 33, were married in 1990 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. All of them are in school. The family lives along National Road Number five about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sreymom has been selling porridge and dessert for 1 year. She buys ingredients to make porridge and dessert by herself and sells in her village. Her husband grows rice; additionally he is a farmer as well. 

Sreymom is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to help purchases motorized hand tiller for her husband to use for farming.

loans.use: To purchase motorized hand tiller.

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
P. Oyun is 57 years old and lives with her husband and 20-year-old son in Arkhangai province in central Mongolia. The family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Oyun's son is currently attending university. 

Oyun operates a clothing business in her town. She buys imported clothes from China, which she transports back home for sale at the local market. Oyun started her clothing business in 2002 with capital of 100,000 MNT. Since then, she has increased her sales and has grown her business' reputation amongst her customers and competitors. Today, her working capital exceeds 800,000 MNT. She attributes her success to her good managerial and accounting skills, and is known by her customers for her polite nature.

In the future, Oyun hopes to further expand her product line to include a wider variety of clothes in an effort to attract new customers. She is requesting a 200,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing items for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing items for her business

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is engaged in charcoal making. Aside from this, she also sells vegetable in the public market of Mallig. With her desire to send her children to school and finish their studies, she wanted to continue her business and ask for business capital from the KIVA lenders amounting to PHP8,000.  She is  hoping that the lenders will approve her loan request for her to improve her charcoal making business and vegetable vending.  

Bernadeth is already a  widow and she only have one child.   “Patience is the key to success” is her guiding principle in life.  She is sending her child to school and dreams to finish her study until college. As she believes that education is the only wealth that she can give to her child.

loans.use: Additional capital for charcoal making and vegetable vending

loans.name: Perla Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo Perla son originarios de la comarca Pilas Orientales zona rural de Masaya donde su principal actividad es la agricultura. 

Denis de Jesús G. desde que era niño aprendió el arte de la agricultura. El cultiva maíz, frijoles, pipián y ayote en una pequeña parcela donde en los tiempos libres le ayudan sus hijos los cuales estudian. 

G. trabaja con Adim a partir del 2001 y ha continuado porque le gusta la forma de trabajo y la ayuda que le brinda. El utilizará el préstamo para adquirir abono, urea, veneno y semillas.

Lucrecia Siles V. de 62 años desde que ella recuerda ha trabajado la tierra y actualmente con la ayuda de su hijo siembra frijoles, maíz, yuca y pipián. Ella trabaja porque es una forma de sentirse útil y para mejorar su vida.

La otra integrante del grupo es Idelia G. ella comenzó asociada con una amiga pero ahora se independizo y cultiva frijoles, maíz, yuca y trigo.
texts.en:
The members of the Perla group are from the Pilas Orientales area, a rural part of Masaya, where their main activity is farming. Denis de Jesús learned farming since he was a child. He farms corn, beans, pipián (a kind of squash or gourd common in Nicaraguan cuisine), and ayote (a squash) on a small plot of land where his children help him on their free time. He has worked with Admin since 2001 and continues because he likes the way they work and the help they offer. He will use the funds to buy fertilizer, urea, insecticide and seed. Lucrecia is 62 years old and she has worked the land for as long as she remembers. With her son's help, she farms beans, corn, yucca and pipián. She works because it is a way to feel useful and to improve her life. The other member of the group is Idelia. She first became associated with a friend but now is independent and she farms beans, corn, yucca and wheat.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: para abono, urea y semillas

loans.name: Diodio

texts.fr:
Diodio N. est une dame qui habite dans la localité de Guediawaye a Daroukhane  une banlieue de Dakar.Elle évolue dans le secteur de la confection.Son activité consiste a acheter des tissus pour confectionner des draps destines a la vente.Elle est mère d’un enfant de deux ans et demi.Son mari est un commerçant immigre en Argentine.Elle capitalise une expérience de11 ans dans son activité.Généralement  elle consacre 11 h de temps par jour dans l’exercice de son activité.Apres ses études elle a eu la passion du métier de tailleur.Elle tire toute sa sa satisfaction sur le fait d’avoir maitrise son métier mais aussi sur le fait qu’il lui génère des revenus.
Ses revenus estimes actuellement a 230 000 frs peuvent être projetés a 330 000 frs après le financement.L’objet de son prêt est d’acquerir  une nouvelle machine qui viendront compléter ses quatre anciennes machines ,ce qui l’aidera a améliorer ses performances.
texts.en:
Diodio N. is a woman who lives in the town of Guediawaye in Daroukhane, a suburb of Dakar. She is in the clothing industry. Her business consists of buying fabric to fashion sheets that she resells. She is the mother of a two and half year-old child. Her husband is a retailer who immigrated to Argentina.

She capitalizes on 11 years of experience in her business. Generally, she devotes 11 hours a day to the practice of her trade. After her schooling she developed a passion for tailoring. She draws all her satisfaction from the fact that she masters her trade but also from the fact that it generates an income.

Her income, currently estimated at 230,000 FR, could be, after the financing, projected at 330,000 FR. The aim of her loan is to purchase a new sewing machine, which will complement her four old ones. This will help her to increase her performance.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 55 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años.
Desde hace 32 años se dedica a la agricultura, todos los días sale a observar y cuidar sus tierras de cultivo, siendo su esposa su principal apoyo. Los productos principales que produce son la papa, el trigo, la cebada y la quinua; pero también se dedica a la crianza de animales (ovejas).
Sus mayores ingresos económicas están dados por la siembra de los granos, por eso cada vez que le es posible incrementa sus cultivos.
Este trabajo suele ser muy agotador, tanto para él como para su familia, pero esto es compensado con las ganancias que les permiten cubrir sus gastos, además de que siempre tiene disponible alimentos para su propio consumo y eso es una ventaja grande para su familia.

Esta es la cuarta oportunidad en que tiene un préstamo con MFP y se siente muy contento de ser parte de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono y medicina para sus animales.
texts.en:
Eugenio, 55, lives with his wife and two children, 12 and 8 years of age. For the last 32 years he has been a farmer. Every day he goes out to inspect and care for his plantings. His wife is his main collaborator. His main crops are: potato, wheat, barley, and quinoa (a main food staple of the Inca civilization, who held the crop to be sacred, quinoa has been cultivated for more than 5,000 years). However, he also raises farm animals (sheep). His main income is generated by his grains so every chance he gets he increases the size of his crops. This can be exhausting work, both for him and his family, but it is compensated for by the profits that allow him to cover costs. Besides, he always has food for his own consumption and this is a very big advantage for his family. This is his fourth loan with MFP and he is very happy to be part of a communal bank. The funding requested will be used to buy sacks of natural fertilizer and medicine for his animals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer.

loans.name: Ermitano

texts.es:
Ermitano es un padre de familia de 27 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de cuatro años de edad en la ciudad de Zaña, ubicada a 50 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace tres años se dedica a la cría de animales. Los compra en los caseríos aledaños para luego engordarlos y venderlos a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona. Adicionalmente trabaja como operario de construcción. Estas actividades son la única fuente de ingreso económico con las que sostiene a su hogar.

El nos cuenta que hace poco ha adquirido dos vacas y las está criando para venderlas en el futuro, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para brindarles una adecuada alimentación. Por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternaiva un crédito de 500 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de alimento balanceado.

Su más grande sueño es brindarle a su hijo una educación de calidad. El es un hombre trabajador y bastante entregado a su familia. En la fotografía aparece trabajando como operario de construcción.
texts.en:
Ermitano, 27, is married and the father of a 4-year-old son. He lives in the city of Zaña, which is 50 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. He has raised animals for sale for the last three years. He buys them in adjacent settlements, fattens them up, sells them to brokers who frequent the area. He also works in construction. These activities are his only sources of income with which he supports his household. He tells us that he acquired two cows recently that he is raising for future sale. However, he lacks the necessary funds to provide them with adequate nutrition. This has brought him to Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to solicit funding in the amount of 500 new soles to invest in the purchase of nutritionally balanced feed. His greatest wish is to provide his son with a quality education. Ermitano is a hard-working man who is wholly dedicated to his family. In the photo, he appears as a construction worker.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy nutritionally balanced feed for cows.

loans.name: Casimira

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo está conformado por mujeres que luchan día a día demostrando que pueden ser más valiosas de lo que muchas personas creen y están dispuestas a salir adelante con sus familias. Este banco se inició en Cuenca,  ciudad hermosa llena de tradiciones y leyendas, dueña de una  belleza natural incomparable.
 

La señora Casimira P. es socia activa del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo desde hace 18 años,  la facilidad de pago y los múltiples beneficios que recibe así como el deseo de superación la incentivaron a formar parte del banco comunal.

Nuestra socia  vive en la comunidad el Paraíso en la parroquia El Valle, tiene 60 años y se encuentra divorciada hace 20 porque  su esposo la maltrataba física y sicológicamente, de ésta relación tormentosa concibió trece  hijos de los cuales tres fallecieron debido al maltrato, no recuerda las edades de sus hijos vivos pero sí que nueve de ellos  ya son casados y tienen su propia familia, sólo le acompaña  su ultima hija que ya está comprometida y  dos nietos  de 15 y 9  debido a que su madre  viajó  al extranjero para cuidar su integridad física puesto su esposo la había amenazado de muerte, viven arrendando porque no tienen casa propia.

Casimira se dedica a la venta de granos tiernos,  verduras y plantas de algunas hortalizas en la feria libre de la ciudad,  también vende animales que los cría  para el sacrificio, su horario de trabajo es de 6am a 6pm, está satisfecha con los logros conseguidos.

Con el nuevo préstamo solicitado va a comprar arveja, fréjol, tomate, cebolla y más verduras así como materiales para la  construcción  de una chanchera  para iniciar con su nuevo negocio de crianza de cerdos para la venta.

Su sueño es poder tener una casa propia.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Floreciendo comunal bank is made up of women who fight every day showing that they can be more valuable than what most people think, and are willing to take their families forward. This bank was started in Cuenca, a beautiful city full of traditions and legends, with an incomparable natural beauty. Miss Casimira P. has been an active member of the Mujeres Floreciendo communal bank for the past 18 years; the easiness of payments and the multiple benefits she receives and her wishes for fulfillment created the incentive to be a part of the communal bank. Our partner lives in the El Paraiso community in the El Valle parish; she is 60 years old and has been divorced for 20 years because her husband abused her physically and psychologically. Out of this tumultuous relationship she conceived 13 children, three of which passed away due to the physical abuses. She doesn't remember the ages of her living children, but she knows that nine of them are married already and have their own families. Her only company is her last daughter who is already engaged, and two grandsons of 15 and 9 because their mother had to go abroad when her husband threatened to kill her. They rent a home because they don't own a house. Casimira is devoted to the sale of grain, vegetables, and plants from some patches in the free market of the city, and also sells animals that are raised for sacrifice. Her work schedule is from 6am to 6pm. She is satisfied with her accomplishments. With this new loan she will purchase peas, beans, tomato, onion and other vegetables as well as construction materials from a pig farm to start with her new pig business. Her dream is to have her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase peas, beans, tomato, onion and other vegetables as well as construction materials from a pig farm

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es: La señora Adriana es casada con el señor Javier Ramírez quien labora para una agencia aduanal. Ellos anteriormente tenían un crédito con nosotros el cual ya quedo liquidado y presentaron siempre una gran puntualidad en sus pagos, su crédito fue para la colocación del vitropiso de su recamara proyecto que ya quedo realizado, pero les falto material para la terminación de la colocación en el resto de la casa y es por ello que están tramitando este nuevo crédito. Y así dar por concluido este objetivo.
texts.en:
Adriana is married to Javier Ramírez, who is employed at a customs broker. They have had a previous loan with us which has been repaid in full; they were always very punctual with their repayments. The loan was to install tile flooring in their bedroom; this project is complete. Now, they need to tile the rest of the house and this is the purpose of this new financing. Thus, this goal will be met.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile flooring in her home.

loans.name: Manuela

texts.es: La señora Manuela C. G. residente actualmente de la Aldea  Xojolá, Municipio de Nahualá, departamento de Sololá, es una señora trabajadora, en su vida  siempre se ha dedicado en la elaboración de servilletas típicos, güipil, fajas y las vende en cualquier comunidad, con el tiempo ha venido superando y quiere  ampliar su negocio debido a que hay mucha demanda y en la cual se vio en la necesidad de acercarse a la Asociación Asdir para hacer un préstamo, ya que ella desea que su negocio sea cada día  mejor porque solo así sus hijos e hijas tendrán una condición de vida aceptable ya que por medio de ello les brindara educación, salud, transporte.
texts.en:
Mrs. Manuela C. G. lives in Xojolá Village, Municipality of Nahuala, and State of Solola. She is a hard working woman and has always been engaged in the elaboration of hand made napkins, belts and traditional embroidered dresses that she sells in different communities.

She wants to expand her business because the demand for the products is high. She is asking the ASDIR Association for a loan because she wants to improve her business and be able to offer acceptable living conditions to her children, provide them education, health and transportation.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Our God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Timothy K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Our God is Able. He is 32 years old, married, a university graduate, and has two children who are 3 and 4 years old.

For five years, Timothy has been selling bags of rice on 12th street in Monrovia. He says that he sells the rice at a good price, which attracts customers.

Timothy plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase more bags of rice. His goal is to grow his business and to be in good health.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Timothy is the one holding the sign.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice.

loans.name: Joseph Wilson

texts.es:
Joseph C. de 27 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento cuenta con agua y luz como servicio básicos. No tiene cargos familiares.

El era estudiante de ensamblaje de computadoras en la universidad, cuando se gradúo empezó con su negocio de reparación de computadoras.  

Ahora Joseph trabaja en su propio local de reparación y venta de equipos de computación, trabaja todos los días desde las 08h00 hasta las 19h00. Uno de los inconvenientes que tiene es la inseguridad del sector.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pantallas para computadoras, CPU, Mouse para su negocio. En el futuro quiere ser distribuidor de computadoras
texts.en:
Joseph C. is 27 years old and lives in a periurban area along the Perimetral Highway of Guayaquil. His home is made of cement and receives water and electricity as its only basic services. He has no family responsibilities. He studied computer assembly at the university. When he graduated, Joseph began his computer repair business. He now works at his own repair shop where he also sells computer equipment. His work schedule every day is from 8am until 7pm. One of the challenges he faces is the uncertainty associated with this type of business. With this loan, he will buy computer monitors, CPUs, and mouse devices for his business. In the future, Joseph wants to become a computer distributor.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase monitors, CPUs, and mouse devices

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rice in bulk.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en:
Solomon is 44 years old, married to Fresia Wambui, and they have four children who attend school. He has operated a general store in Naivasha town for the last five years.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan. He used the first loan of Kshs 50,000 to buy more stock for his shop and has paid the loan. He now plans to add more dry food stuff — bags of rice, sugar, and maize flour which he will sell to his clients in small quantities. The shop is profitable, and to make it even more so he plans to add a variety of  new products — especially products demanded by his customers.

loans.use: To buy dry food stuff to restock his shop

loans.name: Anta Kourane

texts.fr: Anta Kourane M. est une femme de 60 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de DANKH SENE depuis 7 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 15 prêts qu'elle a toujours régulièrement remboursés. Elle fait de l'embouche bovine et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter de l'aliment de bétail et deux bœufs qu'elle engraissera et revendra au bout de 4 à 5 mois. Elle participe à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Anta Kourane M. is a woman of 60 years that is married with 3 children. She has been a member of the Villagers Bank of Dankh Sene for 7 and a half years and has benefited from 15 loans that she has always regularly repaid. She is in the beef feeding trade and her new loan will allow her to buy livestock feed and two cows that she will fatten for around 4 to 5 months. She is helping to improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Colleen Creegan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of two cows to feed/fatten

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer S. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets and dresses at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bedsheets to sell. Amer is 39 years old. She is married to a major in the army. She has 5 children and they all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to purchase a sewing machine.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bedsheets to sell.

loans.name: Badenya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Badenya sont 9 femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, 3 enfants et vivant dans des  familles polygames à Mamassoni un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur septième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de produits alimentaires tels la vente de pomme de terre avec Youma Koné,  des ignames, des condiments alimentaires, de la salade, des  fruits etc.
Youma compte acheter avec son  prêt,  400kg de pomme de terre au grand marché du quartier Médine de la ville de Sikasso et dans les vergers des villages voisins.  Elle les revend au  grand marché de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The members of the Badenya group are nine married women who average 41 years of age, have an average of three children each and live in polygamous families in Mamassoni, one of the districts of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They are on their seventh loan from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso, which they are taking out to satisfy their customers' needs; all their previous loans have been repaid on time. This group of women buy and sell food products, such as potatoes (as is the case for Youma Koné), yams, condiments, lettuces, fruit, etc. With her loan, Youma is planning on buying 400kg of potatoes at the large market in the Médine district of the town of Sikasso as well as in the orchards in neighboring villages. She resells them at the large market in Sikasso and within her family to a customer base made up of men and women, for cash. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 17,500FCFA, of which part will be used to help out her husband with the daily expenses and the rest invested in her business.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase potatoes

loans.name: Janet Del Pilar

texts.es:
Janet es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el caserío La Colorada, una zona rural del distrito de Mórrope, distrito caracterizado por tener a la mayor parte de su población concentrada en zonas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicado a una hora y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la crianza y venta de animales, ella cría animales menores y aves de corral en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio, cuando estos ya ha alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que visitan la zona regularmente. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos, con ellos ayuda a su esposo a sostener la economía de su familia.

Janet desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio de crianza y venta, ella espera aumentar sus ingresos y de esta manera seguir ayudando a su familia a salir adelante, para lograr su meta ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles.

Janet es una joven entregada a las labores de su hogar, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para realizar mejoras en su vivienda y darle a sus hijos una buena educación. En la zona donde vive, sus vecinos la consideran una persona activa y bastante responsable.
texts.en:
Janet, 25, lives with her husband and son in the La Colorada settlement, a rural area of Mórrope district, a district that’s known for having most of its inhabitants in rural areas that are isolated from one another. It is part of Lambayeque province and is located an hour and fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last three years she has been raising small farm animals and barnyard fowl in her back yard. When they reach a proper level of development she puts them up for sale to merchants that visit the area regularly. This business is an important source of income with which she helps her husband support the family. Janet wants to expand her business buying more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them. She hopes to increase her income this way and continue to help her family get ahead. To reach this goal, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for her first, 1700 new sol, loan. Janet is a young woman who is dedicated to her household chores. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman in order to make improvements to her home and provide her children with a good education. She is considered to be an active and quite responsible person by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy small farm animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Judith Adele

texts.fr:
Femme celibataire de 36 ans, ayant en charge 3 personnes ,qui ne sont d'autres que ses neveux , les enfants de son defunt frere, mort durant la guerre ; commercante depuis l'age de 15 ans 
Des qu'elle est arrivee au lycee n'ayant personne pour la soutenir dans ses etudes elle s'est lancee dans la vente des produits divers, apres plusieurs annees d'epargne, elle s'est lancee enfin en 2002 dans la vente des ustensiles de cuisine
 Avec l'octroi de son credit elle a l'intention d'agrandir le stock des marchandises en achetant des ustensiles de cuisine, des marmites,des flutes pour champagne et beaucoup d'autres series de casseroles.Pour accroitre son activite,elle continue toujours a faire l'epargne parceque a la longue elle compte ouvrir une boutique et effectuer des voyages en chine pour s'approvisionner pour pouvoir soutenir ses neveux a faire des longues etudes
texts.en:
A single woman aged 36, with 3 people in her charge, who are none other than her nephews, the children of her late brother who died during the war. She has been a retailer from the age of 15. When she entered high school, having no one to support her with her school fees, she started selling various items. After saving during many years, at last she could start her retail business of kitchen utensils. Once she gets her loan, she intends to increase her stock of goods by purchasing kitchen utensils, pots, champagne flutes, and other sets of saucepans. In order to enlarge her business, she still keeps saving because in time she intends to open a shop and take trips to China to get supplies; this way she will be able to help her nephews to undertake long-term studies.

Translated from French by viviane reignier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wholesale kitchen utensils, pots, glasses and cutlery

loans.name: Lucho Quintin

texts.es:
BB.CC. Taytacha Señor de Ccoyllority de Yungaqui.
Por: Lucho Quintin, tiene 50 años, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. 
Yo nací en la comunidad de Yungaqui y me dedica a la agricultura y otras veces trabajo como obrero en la municipalidad de Anta. Actualmente, trabajo como empleado permanente en la hacienda de la familia “Espejo” que está ubicado en el Valle del Carmen en la comunidad de Yungaqui. Hace 25 años que trabajo con la familia y mis labores son por ejemplo ordeñar vacas, riego de la chacra, sembrar y cosechar papa y elaborar queso.  Yo también cuento en mi casa con unas pequeñas tierras de cultivo donde siembro y cosecho productos de acuerdo a la temporada para lo cual a un inicio se me hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad de pertenecer al banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa el cual nos brindo apoyo con préstamos de dinero y así pudimos muchos de nosotros empezar y así mejorar nuestros negocios.
Desde ese momento nuestra vida comenzó a cambiar ya que contábamos con un capital, y en ese sentido nos pusimos a trabajar mi esposo y yo así como también mis hijos y desde entonces cambio todo para nosotros tanto en lo económico como en lo familiar, porque desde ese momento empezó a crecer mi negocio. Actualmente, requiero el préstamo para comprar abono, semillas y muchas cosas más.  
Por todo ello yo le estoy muy agradecido al banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa, porque no solamente cambio mi vida en lo económico sino también en lo social porque antes de todo esto ninguna institución financiera quiso confiar en nosotros ya que nos pedían muchos requisitos que de repente muchos de nosotros no contamos. Es por ello que le estoy muy agradecida ya que cuento con un capital propio y así puedo manejar mejor mi propio negocio gracias.
texts.en:
Communal Bank: Taytacha Señor de Ccoyllority de Yungaqui For: Lucho Quintin, age 50, married with four children “I was born in the community of Yungaqui and work as a farmer and occasionally as a laborer in the city of Anta. At the moment, I work as a full-time employee on the Espejo Family Estate, which is located in Valle del Carmen in the community of Yungaqui. For 25 years I have worked with the family and my duties include milking the cows, watering the fields, planting and harvesting potatoes, and making cheese. I also live in my own house and have small plots of land on which I plant and harvest seasonal crops. When I started, it was difficult at first because I did not have much capital. At that point, I was presented with the opportunity to join a Communal Bank with Asociación Araiwa and receive support through monetary loans that I could use to start and improve my business.” "From that point, life for myself and my family began to change because we had access to capital. My wife and I, as well as our children, felt we could work toward changing the financial situation of our family. At that moment, I wanted to grow my business. I am currently requesting a loan to buy compost, seeds, and other supplies. For this reason I am extremely grateful to my Communal Bank and Asociación Araiwa because they have changed my life, not only financially, but socially as well. No other financial institution wanted to trust us. Most of them asked for too many requirements and suddenly we did not matter to them. This is why I am very thankful to have my own capital so that I can better manage my own business."

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost, seeds, and other supplies

loans.name: Bushra's Group

texts.en:
Bushra is 30 years old, married, and a mother of two daughters. They all live in a city called Borewala in Pakistan. Borewala City is famous for its shrines.

A very talented lady, Bushra operates an embroidery business. She has the talent for making every kind of embroidery. She not only makes embroidery on shirts but also can embroider shawls, making them more presentable. Her embroidery works are acknowledged in her community and by relatives as well.

Her husband's name is Z. I., and he is involved in a clothes-selling business. He purchased clothes from different cities, Faisalabad and Lahore (famous for its textiles), and sells in the local markets. He has been doing this work for over two years. 

Bushra has applied for a loan for the third time from Asasah for her husband. With the loan amount her husband will buy clothes in bulk and increase his selling. In the last two years Bushra has maintained good credit behavior and never gave reason for any complaints by Asasah, whether it was about attending meetings or repayments.

loans.use: Purchase clothes for selling

loans.name: Katatei  Ene

texts.en:
Katatei Ene K., 36 years old, is married to Leposo K. and a mother of three children. Katatei is a farmer; she has been farming her own piece of land for the last 13 years.

She learned about KADET from other women nearby who are already registered members in KADET. This will be her first loan. She is planning to spend 30000 KES to plant more maize, which normally does well in her area due to good climatic conditions.

She hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand her farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. Katatei's dream is to do large scale farming and attain financial independence.

She is a hard working woman who is determined to achieve her set goals.

loans.use: To prepare her land to plant more maize.

loans.name: Encarnación

texts.es:
