La Sra. Encarnación D. 53 años D. edad, está felizmente casada con el Sr. Julio González quien se desempeña como taxista, juntos tienen 5 hijos ya mayores  tres D. ellos ya se independizaron y formaron sus respectivas familias y dos siguen viviendo con ellos.
DesD. muy joven se dedicó al comercio vendiendo ropas  y mercaderías por cuotas, y sobre pedidos muchos años años trabajó D. esa manera, hasta que le ha tocado una época D. crisis económica, en donD. se resentía la falta D. dinero que hizo que hasta el más puntual D. sus clientes no pudiera cumplir con sus compromisos, y eso le llegó a afectar también a ella.
Y como también le gusta la cocina pronto pensó en dedicarse a elaborar comidas y a realizar pedidos D. bocaditos tanto salados y dulces y así D. esa manera al cambiar D. rubro pudo seguir cumpliendo con puntualidad sus compromisos. Hoy día dice estar muy contenta porque a sus clientes les gusta los productos que hace.
Pero como hoy día hay que trabajar mucho para conseguir lo que uno quiere dice que otra vez le anexa los pedidos D. ropas a su micro empresa, pero ya sobre pedidos y dice que no pueD. quejarse y que le va muy bien.
Las veces que retira un crédito es un desafío para ella porque pueD. demostrar que trabajando se pueden lograr los objetivos y cumplir con los compromisos acordados en esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para la compra D. carnes, aceites, condimentos, verduras y ropas para volver a vender .
texts.en:
Encarnación is 53 years old. She is happily married to Julio González, who works as a taxi driver, and together they have 5 grown-up children; three of them live independently with their own families and the other two are still living with their parents. From an early age she started selling clothes and other goods in installments. She carried on like this for many years until the financial crisis, when the lack of cash maD. even the most reliable of her customers unable to fulfil their commitments. This eventually affected her as well. She also enjoys cooking so she thought that instead she could make food and take orders for sweet and savoury snacks. She changed career and so she was able to fulfil her commitments on time. She says she is happy now because her customers enjoy the food she makes. However, she explains that nowadays it is necessary to work very hard to achieve what one wants, so she has once again started to accept clothing orders through her small business. She says that so far she can't complain as things are going really well. Obtaining a loan is a challenge for her because she has the chance to show that by working hard it is possible to achieve her goals and fulfil any commitments maD.. She is requesting a loan to buy meat, oil, condiments, vegetables and clothes to start selling them again.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw materials such as meat, oil, condiments, vegetables and clothes to resell.

loans.name: Sama

texts.en:
E. was born in 1966. She is married to Sama Aron, and they are blessed with five children. She shares five rooms with her five children and her husband in Musang, a quarter in Bamenda, in the North-West Region of Cameroon.

E. has had great difficulties in life, ranging from ill-health, failure to attain quality education, and inadequate capital to expand her business. Amongst other challenges, she needs more capital to be able to pull ahead with her projects. With this loan, she plans to buy yams seeds, day-old chicks, and piglets, which she will keep and will later on sell to make more profit from them. She thinks her business is an influential one, and she has succeeded over the past years. She, as well, regularly undertakes contracts. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford good yams, chickens, and pigs for affordable prices.

She will plough her profit back into her business and use part to care for her family. She will use a fraction of the profit to pay for her children's education and upgrade her standard of living. She  prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow-up, and the low cost of obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE:
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multifaceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase yams seeds, poultry and pig farming

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru: Азизова Гулрухсор проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 42 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. У мужа дехканское хозяйство. Сама Гулрухсор имеет среднее образование. Более 10 лет занимается растениеводством. Она в основном сеет пшеницу. Кредит берет для закупа семян.
texts.en:
Gulruhsor A. lives in the Yavan district. She is 42 years old, married and has 3 children. Her husband has a dekhan farm. Gulruhsor has a secondary education. She has been involved in agriculture for over 10 years. She primarily sows wheat. Gulruhsor is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seeds

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: El señor Wilfredo  tiene la edad de 45 años vive en la zona de Puerto Rico Barrio San Andres hace 8 años el señor oriundo de  Torrecillas  tiene como Actividad contratista albañil hace 15 años actualmente trabaja en el torno zona barrio Miraflores  su  estado civil concubino hace 20 años con su Sra. esposa Modesta  de edad 34 años que se dedica al servicio de ama de casa los señores cuentan actualmente con 6 hijos a su cargo 3 que se encuentran en el colegio  y 1 en la universidad y 2 que trabajan juntamente con su padre ayudándole ya que tiene un trabajo duro y sacrificado, pero sigue adelante por el bienestar de sus hijos,  Al mismo tiempos ellos están agradecidos con nuestra entidad por apoyarlos y depositarles la confianza para adquirir su crédito. El la foto el Sr. Wilfredo esta acompañada de su esposa.
texts.en: Señor Wilfredo is 45 years old. He has lived in the Puerto Rico zone and the San Andres neighborhood for 8 years, but he is a native of Torrecillas. He  is a mason and has worked as a contractor for 15 years. Now he works near the Miraflores neighborhood. He has had a common law marriage for 20 years with his wife Modesta, who is a housewife. They have 6 children, and are still responsible for 3 who are in school. One is at the university and two work together with their father, helping him, since he has a hard job and has sacrificed, but he continues to work for the well-being of his children. At the same time, they are thankful to Emprender for supporting them and entrusting them with the confidence to acquire their loan. In the photo, Sr. Wilfredo is accompanied by his wife.

loans.use: Buy material to construct latrines.

loans.name: Pem

texts.en: Pem S., 49, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia, an area known for rubber plantations. S. sells groceries and raises pigs at home, earning an income of about 5 USD per day. Her husband is a repairman, earning an income of 4 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. S. has to spend 50 USD on food, 23 USD on electricity and water supplies, and 50 USD on other necessary expenses every month. S. is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase containers to stock pig food. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S. appears in the photograph with her husband.

loans.use: To buy containers to stock pig food

loans.name: Mayra Jahaira

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Jazmines  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Mujer y Fortaleza.

Aquí conocimos a Mayra, ella es una linda señorita que tiene 22 años de edad, está soltera y vive con su hermana y su abuela. Estudia el primer año de Derecho  en la ULEAM. Además trabaja de secretaria en una Notaria de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Este es su primer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y está muy contenta, le gusta  las facilidades para conseguir los créditos.

Además de trabajar como secretaria se dedica al comercio, vende ropa, carteras y accesorios  para damas, aprovecha para venderles a sus compañeras y amigas de la universidad en las noches y también recorre con sus productos los sábados y domingos en las mañanas, deja a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince días. Sus productos se los mandan desde Panamá, una señora que vive allá le envía la mercadería.

Este crédito es para pagar el pedido que va a recibir ya que tiene que pagar adelantado los pedidos. Sus sueños son terminar su carrera y ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
The members of the 'Mujer y Fortaleza' (Woman and Strength) community bank meet every fortnight in Los Jazmines, in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as 'the city of the royal tamarind trees'.

Here we meet Mayra.  She is a pretty young lady who is 22 years old.  She is single and lives with her sister and her grandmother.  She is in her first year of a law degree at ULEAM.  She also works as a secretary in a notary's office in the city of Portoviejo.  This is her first loan cycle with the community bank and she is very happy.  She likes the ease with which she can acquire a loan.

As well as working as a secretary, Mayra is also a saleswoman.  She sells ladies' clothes, purses and accessories.  She sells them to her friends and university classmates in the evenings.  She also sells her products on Saturday and Sunday mornings.  She leaves the goods on credit and collects payment for them every week or every fortnight.  She receives her products from Panama.  A lady who lives there sends them to her.

Mayra will use this loan to pay for the order which she is going to receive since she has to pay for her orders up front.  Her dreams are to finish her university course and work in her chosen profession.

loans.use: To buy ladies' clothes, purses and accessories

loans.name: Orlando Josseel

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 18 años de edad, estudia II año de Ingenieria Agropecuaria, vive en Condega, sus padres le ayudan a pagar los estudios, ayuda a sus padres con la venta de productos lacteos. Siempre le ha gustado todas las actividades agropecuarias.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Cultivar Repollo.

Este credito es importante, porque ayuda a impulsar la siembra de este tipo de productos y sobre todo adquirir experiencia en la carrera. Su meta es tener buenos resultados en los estudios, culminar su carrera y encontrar un trabajo.
texts.en:
Orlando is 18 years old.  He is in his second year of higher education in agricultural engineering.  He lives in Condega.  His parents help him pay for his education, and he helps his parents with the sale of dairy products.  He has always liked farming activities.

He used the loan for supplies for a university project of cultivating cabbage.

This loan is important because it helps drive the planting of these types of products.  Above all, it helps to get career experience.  His goal is to have good results in his studies, finish his education, and to find work.

loans.use: For a student agricultural project of growing cabbage

loans.name: Risueñas De Calimaya Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama RISUEÑAS DE CALIMAYA se encuentra ubicado en Calimaya en México. Está conformado por 10 integrantes entre ellas está la Sra. Teresa S. quien vende tortillas hechas a mano desde hace 2 años, nos comenta que desde que era casi una niña su mamá le enseñó a hacerlas ya que dejó la escuela por problemas económicos. La señora nos comenta que decidió iniciar su negocio porque los ingresos de su esposo muchas veces no le alcanzaba para cubrir las necesidades de su familia, tiene dos hijos que actualmente estudian el bachillerato.El crédito lo quiere para comprar maiz, incrementar sus ingresos y tener la oportunidad de brindarles a sus hijos educación.
texts.en: This group is called "Risueñas de Calimaya" ["Smiles of Calimaya"] and can be found in Calimaya, in Mexico state.  The group is made up of 10 members, among them Ms. Teresa S..  She has been selling hand-made tortillas for more than two years.  She tells us that her mother taught her how to make them almost since she was a baby, and that she left school because of economic problems.  She says that she decided to start her business because her husband's income was often not enough to cover the needs of their family.  She has two children who are currently studying in secondary school.  She will use this loan to buy corn, in order to increase her earnings and have the opportunity to provide for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy corn by the barrel

loans.name: Merceluz Tagama's Group

texts.en:
Merceluz T. is from Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 37 years old, married, and has 5 school-aged children. Merceluz is the leader of a three-member loan group sponsored by PMPC. Although each member receives an individual loan, they are all responsible for repaying the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Merceluz T.’s Group.

To make a living, Merceluz buys and sells ready to wear clothing and other dry goods. She sells to her neighbors and friends. She has been engaged in this business for eight years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Merceluz joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. She is now requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be use to purchase more dry goods to sell. This will be her 4th loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living standards.



About PMPC: 
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more dry goods to sell

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira M. is from the village of Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Elvira is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she plants and harvests flowers to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $71 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Elvira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase seedlings and fertilizers such as manure. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings and fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan is from the village of Miputak. He is 40 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. Allan operates a family member's business in the food sector, running a food stall in the local community. He has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Allan joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Allan is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials for his food vending business. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Allan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions for his family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for food vending business

loans.name: Daysi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Daysi del Carmen E. Venegas, comerciante activa del Mercado Israel Lewite desde hace más de tres años, ella trabaja de lunes a domingo de 7 de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde, es madre soltera de dos hijos y estos se encuentran en el colegio, ella y sus hijos dependen únicamente del negocio.
 El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de mercadería para su negocio, es su primer préstamo con ceprodel y este lo quiere para comprar mercadería para su negocio como: Compra de productos para la elaboración de comida y gaseosa.
texts.en: For more than three years, Daysi del Carmen E. V.has been an active merchant at the Israel Lewite Market.  She works Monday through Sunday, from 7 am to 6 pm.  She is a single mother of two children, both of whom are attending school.  She and her children depend on her business.  This loan is intended for the purchase of merchandise for her business.  It is her first loan with Ceprodel and she wants to use it to purchase items that she needs to make food and drinks with.

loans.use: Purchase products to make food and drinks.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy B. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has  no children. Teddy has a business selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for two years, and she works seven days out of every week. Teddy has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more charcoal. 

The main business challenge for Teddy is seasonality.  Her goal is for her business to expand.    Teddy has access to electricity and to piped water.

loans.use: more charcoal

loans.name: Luz Stella

texts.es:
Luz Stella inicia su negocia en una caja de madera, sin embargo por su buen servicio recibe apoyo de uno de sus proveedores y le da un kiosko para que su negocio pudiera crecer y ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos y así mantener contentos a sus clientes.

Ella necesita comprar mas variedad de productos no solo para incrementar las ventas sino también para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Luz Stella started her business in a wooden box.  However, thanks to the good service she provided she got support from one of her providers who gave her a kiosk so that her business could grow and offer a larger amount of products thus keeping her customers happy.

She needs to buy a wider variety of products not only to increase sales but also to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana C. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 52 years old. Marciana is married and has four children. To make a living, Marciana owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Marciana has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marciana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marciana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Marciana is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products such as canned goods, biscuits, detergent, soap, and sugar. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Marciana from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, biscuits, detergent, soap, and sugar.

loans.name: José María

texts.es: José María V. G. de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive con su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos en San Martin, del departamento de San Salvador. El posee un taller de enderezado y pintura de automóviles en un lugar muy  concurrido de San Martin, es un negocio muy rentable pues ya tiene mucha clientela por su calidad de trabajo y sus buenos precios; pero últimamente José ha tenido más demanda de trabajo y no posee con todo lo necesario para realizarlo, es por eso que se decidió a solicitar a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar más pintura de carro,  de diferentes colores para poder satisfacer a todos sus clientes. José es todo un hombre de familia y espera que en un futuro su negocio le ayude a solventar todas las necesidades de su hogar y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José María V. G. is 43 years old and lives with his life partner and two children in San Martin, department of San Salvador. He has a repair and automobile shop in a heavily trafficked area in San Martin; it is a very profitable business since he has a lot of customers because of the quality of his work and his good prices. Lately though, José has had more demand for his work and does not have the necessary tools to do it all, this is why he went to INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy more car paint in different colors to be able to satisfy all of his customers. José is family man and hopes in the future for his business to help him meet all of his household expenses and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy car paint.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William L. is a videographer who makes wedding videos and commercials.  William started Bella Videography six years ago and has over 25 years of industry experience.  He worked at the Houston Independent School District for 16 years before deciding to open Bella Videography, a decision he has never regretted.  He loves being able to do what he loves and advises prospective entrepreneurs “to take the plunge… if you never do it, you’ll never know.”

Born in Colombia, William came to the United States when he was three years old.  Being fluent in Spanish helps William market to Houston’s Hispanic population, and is especially useful when dealing with older clients who don’t speak English.  Houston’s warm climate makes for a non-traditional, year-round wedding season that keeps William on the run.  A typical week for William has him editing footage during the business week and working events on the weekend.  He hires hourly, part-time employees who help him with events requesting multiple cameras. 
  
When the recession hit a couple of years ago, business slowed as people were forced to shrink their wedding budgets.  William turned what looked to be a bad situation into a positive one for his business by creating a less expensive package that still offered clients a high-quality product.   He says that if your business can’t change with the environment, you won’t stay in business.  In the six years William has been in business, revenues have increased every year.

This is William’s third loan with ACCION Texas-Louisiana.  William is using this loan to purchase a new camera that will increase product quality.  With technology continually improving, it is critical that William’s equipment be up-to-date so that he can provide his customers with the best quality footage.

loans.use: to pay for a new camera

loans.name: Lilliam Esmeralda

texts.es: Lilliam Esmeralda se dedica a una pulpería, tiene 3 años en este negocio pues con mucho empeño y dedicación ha logrado obtener este medio de vida. Inicio con pocos productos ya que ciertos clientes le realizan diferentes pedidos, pero con el paso del tiempo obtuvo la experiencia necesaria para seguir creciendo con su negocio. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, detergentes, golosinas, pan, refrescos entre otros.  Ella sueña con mantener su negocio bien surtido.
texts.en: Lilliam Esmeralda has a convenience store; she has been running this business for three years and with a lot of effort was able to make it into an activity that allows her to earn a living. She started off with just a few products based on the orders from the initial clients, but, as time went by, she was able to gain the necessary experience that allowed her to grow her business. She is seeking a loan in order to purchase staple grains, sweets, bread, detergent, and soft drinks among other items. Her dream is to have a store with a good selection of products.

loans.use: to purchase convenience store inventory

loans.name: Martin

texts.es:
Martín tiene 34 años de edad, él es soltero. Vive con sus abuelos y con su hermano menor, ellos residen en un caserío llamado “Simbila” que pertenece al distrito de Catacaos en una zona  netamente rural. No cuenta con servicios básicos.

Martín se dedica a la elaboración y comercialización de artículos de alfarería como tinajas, jarras, ollas, cantaros, entre otros.  Estos productos son utilizados por las señoras que hacen la chicha de jora.  Esta actividad la realiza desde muy niño y ya lleva más de 10 años que  se independizó en este rubro el cual conoce muy bien.  Cuentan con clientela ya fidelizada, producto de todos los años de experiencia que tiene. Cabe mencionar que también se dedica a la compra venta de chivos y aves de corral, actividad de la cual obtiene ingresos extras para su hogar.
 
Martín esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para invertirlo en su negocio, comprando leña y materia prima para la elaboración de sus productos, también lo necesita para comprar de más animales con sus respectivos alimentos, ello le permitirá captar mayor clientela  y  por ende mejorar su situación económica, mejorando su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martin is 34 years old and is single.  He lives with his grandparents and with his younger brother.  They live in a rural settlement called "Simbila," which is part of the Catacaos district.  This is a purely rural area where the houses lack basic utilities.

Martin has a business making and selling pottery items such as jars, jugs, pots, pitchers and other products.  These products are used by the women who make chicha de jora (a traditional Peruvian beverage made from fermented corn.)  He has been doing this type of work since he was very young.  It has now been 10 years since he began to work independently doing this type of work that he knows so well.  He has an established customer base because of all of his years of experience.   It's worth noting that he also sells goats and barnyard fowl; this activity provides him with extra income for his household.

Martin is requesting a loan of 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in his business.  He will use the loan to buy firewood and raw materials to make his pottery products, and he will also purchase animals and animal feed.  This will allow him to attract more customers, and thereby improve his financial situation and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy firewood and supplies to make his pottery products

loans.name: Vat

texts.en: Vat resides in Kampong Chnang province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. Vat is a farmer, earning an income of 1.5 USD per day to help cover the family expenses. His wife sells groceries, earning an income of 10 USD per day. Each month, the family has to spend 50 USD on food and 40 USD on the other necessary expenses. Vat is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase more groceries to stock the store. This will be his first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Hope

texts.en: Hope is a 42-year-old single mother with three children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been dealing in secondhand clothes for ten years, during which she started with retail and now has a wholesale shop. Her hardship is poor quality clothes that lead to losses, and her vision is a big boutique plus educating her children. Hope needs the loan to buy clothes for resale.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Danson

texts.en:
Danson is a farmer from Nyamira town in western Kenya where he has been farming for six years now. He employs two farmhands and sells his produce of coffee, tea, maize and vegetables locally. He mainly depends on the income from his farm to cater for the basic needs of his family.

He has requested this loan of 45,000 Kes in order to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help him pay school fees for his children. He faces the challenge of diseases which affect his crops and animals. He aspires to have a public service vehicle and expand his dairy business in the next 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nahla

texts.en: Nahla is a 37-year-old young woman, married with two daughters and two sons. She lives with her family in Jabalia Refugee Camp in Gaza Strip. Nahla's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee and that's why she had to take out a $2,000 loan in order to buy furniture for her daughters who are growing up and can't share the room with their two brothers anymore. FATEN's loan helped Nahla purchase the furniture and gave her the flexibility of baying back smaller amounts of money on a monthly basis. Nahla is photographed in FATEN's Branch office.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her daughters' room

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you teachers of a leading secondary school in Makeni. Seventeen out of the 70 staff of this institution have come to SMT to apply for a loan of 15,440,000.00 Sierra Leone leones (SLL). School staff from this institution and indeed, from many other institutions in different walks of life within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. These loans are helpful as they can allow them invest in something that their salaries alone cannot do. For example, some of them may buy a plot of land, others will buy house-building materials, some will buy household furniture, some will use the loan to pay school fees for their children, while others will use the loan to invest in his/her business. At the end of each month, the institution’s bursar deducts the repayment from their salaries and repays SMT on their behalf.

Zainab (third from left) is a senior teacher at the school and leader of this group of teachers. The 47-year-old woman is married and has five children. She has been in the teaching profession for 26 years. A native of Makeni, Zainab backs her teaching profession with some trading. She supplies cosmetics – body sprays, body powders, etc. Zainab has requested this loan in order to buy more goods to add to her business. She will use her share of the loan to buy more cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics in bulk to add to her business.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is 48 years old and is a married man with a 7-year-old child. He is a farmer who tills land in Surallah, South Cotabato, Philippines. Oscar grows rice and pineapples. He sells his harvest at his town's market.

Oscar is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs. He hopes for his business to grow and provide a better income for his family. He also hopes to save for his child's future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James,32 years old, is married to Grace. They have no children. James has been a milk vendor for the past ten years with the monthly income of KES 2,000 which he uses to meet their basic needs. He is applying for his first loan term from KADET after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. James will use the loan to buy a refigerator to store milk. 

With the anticipated profit from the business James will venture into dairy farming. His hopes and dreams are to purchase a piece of land and keep dairy cows which will improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator to store milk

loans.name: Raul

texts.es: Raul de 72 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 23 y 29 años y es el propietario de un taller de confecciones dedicado exclusivamente a fabricar limpiones industriales, llamados wiper, actividad que inició en el año 2007, gracias al apoyo de una iglesia cristiana, donde inició como empleado y finalmente cuando la iglesia desistió del negocio le vendieron toda la infraestructura, con la que hoy genera ingresos independientes. Sus cuentas por cobrar representan un 74% de sus ventas totales y no posee endeudamiento, pero su capital de trabajo es insuficiente ante su decisión de crecer y tiene un gran potencial, tiene una buena rentabilidad, unas cuentas por cobrar coherentes con los plazos de pago que ofrece.  Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y con el cual comprará materias primas para cubrir su creciente demanda de empresas, que cada día utilizan más los wiper en sus tareas productivas industriales y con las cuales iniciaría su potencial crecimiento.
texts.en:
Raul is 72 years old and lives with his wife. They have two children, ages 23 and 29. Raul is the owner of a sewing workshop that exclusively manufactures industrial cleaning cloths called “wipers”. He started this business in 2007 thanks to the support of a Christian church. Raul started out as an employee of the church, but then the decision was made to sell this business and the entire infrastructure. Today he works independently and generates his own income. His accounts receivable make up 74% of his total sales and he has no debt. However, his operating capital is insufficient for growth even though he has great potential. Raul has good profitability because some of his accounts receivable are consistent with the payment terms stated in the agreements.

Raul is requesting a Kiva loan, his first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the money to buy raw materials so that he can keep up with the growing demand from businesses that use these “wipers” for various industrial tasks. This loan should initiate his potential growth.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for making industrial cleaning cloths.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more maize flour and other groceries to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase materials for wedding dresses

loans.name: Sandra Veronica

texts.es:
Sandra, necesita un nuevo crédito para comprar reces (dos novillas) para vender la carne y de esa forma siempre mantener a sus clientes e incrementar en sus ventas. El prestamo anterior lo utilizo para la compra de reces, pues su negocio trata unicamente de la venta de carne, por lo mismo estos prestamos los invierte en el fortalecimiento de él.
El propósito de Sandra es crecer  en su negocio, tener más personas que le ayuden a vender  y poder darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra needs a new loan in order to buy cattle (two new cows) in order to sell the meat and in this way maintain her customer base and increase her sales. 

Her last loan was used to buy cattle, and as her only business is the sale of meat, the loans help her build up her business. 

Sandra’s purpose is to grow her business, to have more people helping her with sales, and to give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle for the butcher

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis vive con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades D. 10 a 22 años en L. ciudad D. BarranquilL.. El para generar ingresos y sostener su hogar tiene su propio negocio D. reciclaje,  actividad que conoce desD. sus 8 años D. edad, cuando ayudaba a su padre quien murió y Luis abandonó sus estudios para dedicarse totalmente a este oficio. El  negocio D. Luis  funciona en un local propio ubicado en uno D. los mercados populares  D. L. ciudad. Gradualmente   ha ido creciendo, pues primero reciclaba plásticos, cartón y vidrios; en L. actualidad solo recicL. empaques plásticos y comercializa productos industriales como papel aluminio que utiliza para empacar al vacío y también rollos D. pitas, aunque planea invertir en envases pláticas industriales. Luis actualmente aplica a su primer credikiva, también primer financiamiento que hace a L. Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el comprará pita en rollos,  bolsas plásticas y papel aluminio, su experiencia garantiza su éxito, porque sabe lo que necesita su mercado D. clientes y justamente es en eso que va a invertir.
texts.en:
Luis lives with his spouse and three children whose ages range from 10 to 22 years in the city of BarranquilL..  To generate income and support his home he has his own recycling business, an activity he’s known since he was 8 years old when he’d help his father.  When his father died, Luis dropped out of school to go into this business full-time. 

Luis’ business functions in a locale he owns located in one of the city’s popular markets.  Gradually it’s been growing because at the beginning he only recycled plastics, cardboard and glass; currently he only recycles plastic containers and he sells industrial products like aluminum foil used for vacuum packaging and also rolls of twine, although he plans to invest in industrial plastic containers.

Luis is applying for his first Kiva loan which is also his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo that he’ll use to buy rolls of twine, plastic bags and aluminum foil.  His experience guarantees success because he knows what his market needs and that’s precisely what he’ll invest in.

loans.use: to buy rolls of twine, plastic bags and aluminum foil.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy larger amounts of raw materials to save on costs.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 28 years old and married with two children who are both in school. She has had a business selling food in a stall in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Betty requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase tomatoes and onions. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a shop for her business extension in the future.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Imani B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Imani B Group in Western Kenya! This group joined Kiva partner One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.
Martin is the facilitator of the Imani B group. He takes care of ten children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Martin had an excellent maize yield harvesting eleven bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Martin was only able to harvest two and a quarter bags of maize on half an acre of land.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Martin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit, and insurance.
With income from maize sales, Martin will educate his children. In 2012, the members of Imani B group will each plant between half and one acre of maize.

loans.use: to source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”HUCHUY QOSQO”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Lamay en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Luisa;  La socia tiene 27 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, la socia tiene 3 hijos de 10, 6, 3 años de edad; la socia se trabaja asistiendo en las obras que realiza el instituto de Cultura en toda la ruta, ella encontró este trabajo y está feliz de poder aportar más en la economía de la familia, la socia también se dedica  a la ganadería y crianza de animales menores, la socia tiene toros y vacas, ella en esta ocasión desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de un torete, ella desea comprar uno para criarlo y que crezca sano y fuerte, de tal modo ella cuando este sea maduro lo puede vender o alquilar para el cruce con otra vaca y ella tener su cría. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de un torete.

La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "HUCHUY QOSQO” communal bank, which is located in the Lamay district in the province of Calca and department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Luisa, she is 27 years old and in a live-in relationship.  The member has three children aged 10, 6, and 3.  She is employed helping out with the works that the Institute of Culture undertakes along its entire route.  She found this employment and is happy to be able to contribute more to her family finances.  

The member also works with livestock and raising small animals.  She has bulls and cows, and on this occasion wants to invest her loan in purchasing a bullock.  She wants to purchase one in order to raise it so that it can grow healthy and strong.  In this way, once it's full-grown, she will be able to sell it or rent it for stud with another cow for breeding.  The member is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of a bullock.

The member is grateful for the loan and agrees to comply with making her repayments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of a bullock.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Rosemarie has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Rosemarie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Rosemarie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Enriqueta Del Rocio

texts.es:
La Señora. Enriqueta es socia del banco comunal Divino Niño Jesús, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde diciembre de 1999 patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, cuenta con una gran belleza, riqueza natural y cultural, su gente es amable, cordial, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Enriqueta tiene 39 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 5 hijos de 18, 17, 15, 12 y 10 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Enriqueta se dedica a la venta de espumillas (plato típico hecho con huevo batido), esta actividad  la realiza hace 2 años, también vende ropa hace 3 años, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en ropa para surtir su mercadería.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Enriqueta is a member of the village bank Divino Niño Jesús. She lives in the city of Cuenca, which in 1999 was declared an UNESCO World Heritage Site. It is beautiful and has rich natural and cultural resources; the people are friendly, polite and maintain the culture and traditions of their town.

Enriqueta, 39, is married and has 5 children, ages 18,17,15,12, and 10 years old. Her oldest three students are in high school and the other two are in middle school in the city. Her husband has a job in the private sector. The rent a house because they don't own their own.

Enriqueta has been selling espumillas (traditional meringues made with beaten eggs) for 2 years. She also has been selling clothing for 3 years, and works every day of the week without a fixed schedule.

This is her third credit with the village bank and she will invest it in clothing to stock her store. 

Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Diomedes Armando

texts.es:
Diomedes, es agricultor y ganadero, vive en casa propia, con tres hijos, él inicio este oficio por iniciativa propia, trabaja en sus propias tierras, no tiene un horario establecido.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para comprar una vaca y un ternero, para aumentar sus crías en el corral, esta compra le ayudara a tener más ganado y con la esperanza de en un futuro recibir mayores ganancias de esta compra.
Él tiene como objeto, pagar este préstamo muy bien, realizar una buena inversión, estar al pendiente de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Diomedes is a farmer and cattle rancher. He lives in his own house with three children. He began this work by his own initiative. He works on his own land. He doesn't have an established schedule.

Currently he is requesting a loan to purchase a cow and a calf in order to expand the offspring in his barnyard. This purchase will help him to have more cattle and hopefully to receive greater earnings in the future from this purchase.

His objectives are to pay this loan very well, make a good investment and to keep an eye on his children.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and a calf.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana sells fish every day to earn a living. She is 57 years old and lives in Tacloban, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married with two adult children. Juana has been in this business for three years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to purchase more fish to sell.

Juana has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year. In the future, Juana hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is 32 years old. He is married with 3 children. 

He has had a motorcycle business for 4 years and it has been profitable. 

He will be using the loan to  complete payment of another motor cycle and hopes this will help him educate his children. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a stable business and a happy family.

loans.use: to complete payment of another motor cycle to help him educate his children

loans.name: José Secundino

texts.en:
Don José is a responsible and hard working man. He launched his own business in response to the need to offer an education and a better quality of life to his children. His business consists of the crafting of handmade items which are sold in the tourist areas and in restaurants. Currently Don José wants to give a push to his business, since the demand for his products has increased. To do this he needs the raw materials to produce more crafted items.

He needs a loan of $925 USD to buy raw materials to increase his capacity of production. Don José doesn´t work alone; he has 3 young men working in the same business. You can help them and give Don José´s business a push to the next level. Support them!

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, a Kiva volunteer.

Don José es un hombre responsable y trabajador, ante la necesidad de ofrecer una educación a sus hijos y una mejor calidad de vida, Don José emprendió su propio negocio. Este consiste en la elaboración de artesanías las cuales son vendidas en las zonas turísticas u restaurantes. Actualmente Don José quiere impulsar su negocio, ya que la demanda por sus productos ha ido en aumento, por lo que necesita de materia prima para producir una mayor cantidad de estas.

El necesita un préstamo de $925 USD para comprar materia prima y tener una mayor capacidad de producción, ya que Don José no trabaja solo, tiene 3 jóvenes varones que trabajan en el mismo negocio. Tu puedes ayudarlos e impulsar el negocio de Don José, apóyalos.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is a 55 year old mother of four children.  She has been selling charcoal in bags for the past seven years, and extends 30 days credit to her customers.  The rainy season is going to be starting soon, and she wants to use the facility to increase her inventory of charcoal so she can meet customers' demand during the major wet season.  She has completed the 'TEACH' sessions of KRABAN.  Hannah wants to use the proceeds of the KIVA loan to increase her supply of charcoal.

loans.use: Increase her inventory of charcoal to meet seasonal demands

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 24 years old. He lives with his big family in the south of Kirkuk. He has six brothers. He is only worker in the house. He has a copy shop in the market. He also has one computer in his shop. He is looking forward to receiving a loan from AL-Aman to purchase a new computer, new scanner, and new printer.

He wants to enhance his standard of living and increase his income .

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase a new computer, scanner, and printer

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
Irma Martínez is finishing her house and she is asking for a loan of $1,000.00 to finish the exterior and to install doors and windows. "I am a single mother and I have three children. I am asking for a loan because I want to finish building my house so that I won't have to pay rent and so that my children will be safer because I work all day and they stay home alone."

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Irma Martínez esta terminando su casa ella esta solicitando un préstamo de $1,000.00 Dlls. Para los acabados y colocación de puertas y ventanas. Soy madre soltera y tengo 3 hijos. Estoy solicitando el préstamo porque quiero terminar ya mi casa para dejar de pagar renta y así estar más seguros mis hijos ya que yo trabajo todo el día y ellos se quedan solos.

loans.use: To finish the exterior of her house and to install doors and windows

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
Felipa Chunquimia, divorced and mother of three children is a partner of the 8 association of the Villa Tejada September in the city of El Alto.

Felipa is a multidisciplinary and entrepreneurial woman. She is the actual owner of a beauty salon that open 8 months ago where she works by herself and practices her profession. At the same time she has dedicated her self to the production of women’s jackets, which she sells in her salon while taking advantage of the space there.

That is not all, at night once she closes her salon she works on the preparation and sale of hamburgers, hot dogs, and other short order food. With all these activities she is trying to get her and her children ahead. She needs capital to be able to furnish her beauty salon in order to better attend to her clients thus increasing her profitability.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer.

Felipa C., divorciada y madre de tres hijos, es socia de la asociación 8 de septiembre de Villa Tejada en la ciudad de El Alto.

Felipa es una mujer muy emprendedora y multidisciplinaria, actualmente es dueña de un Salón de Belleza, que aperturó hace 8 meses, donde trabaja sola y ejerce su profesión. Paralelamente se dedica a la confección de chompas, las que ahora vende aprovechando los ambientes de su Salón.

Eso no es todo, por las noches y una vez cerrando su salón se dedica a la preparación y venta de hamburguesas, salchipapas y comida rápida. Con todas estas actividades, ella intenta salir adelante con sus hijos. Ella precisa de capital para poder amoblar su salón de belleza, de esta manera mejorar la atención de sus clientes y de forma inherente su rentabilidad.

loans.use: She needs capital to be able to furnish her beauty salon in order to better attend to her clients thus increasing her profitability.

loans.name: Sophorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sophorn L. was married in 1979 and has four children, two daughters and two sons. His cousin taught him how to construct and repair wooden houses in 2004, and shortly afterwards he started his own business. His wife works spinning silk which she sells to people in her community. The family earns additional income raising cows and growing vegetables. 

Sophorn L. has received a loan from MAXIMA twice previously. He has applied for this $400 loan because his daughter would like to attend University in Phnom Penh and he needs extra money to pay for her fees.

loans.use: to pay university fees for his daughter

loans.name: Bertha

texts.en:
Bertha is a lady of 33 years and is married with four children. She applied for this loan in order to buy ingredients needed for her ice-cakes (popsicles in a bag), such as sugar, cordials and plastic cups and paper.

She sells them at the village school every day and at her house throughout the whole week. She said this loan will help her run her business, and the business helps cover her family's needs, especially those of her children. She wants to pay off her current loan early and apply for the next loan to buy a big freezer for her business.

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients for her ice-cake business

loans.name: Radojka

texts.en: Radojka is a 52-year-old woman who lives in Lukavica, East Sarajevo. She is married and has a son who is self-employed. Radojka has taken 2 previous loans through MCO WWI, and she used them to buy equipment for her tailoring shop. Her husband works, too, but his income is not enough to help Radojka realize her idea of expanding her tailoring services. By expanding her tailoring services, Radojka will realize her old dream and improve her material situation.

loans.use: Expanding tailor services

loans.name: Molemo Group

texts.en: Anna K. is a married woman. She has three children, ages 21, 17 and 15. She has a timber business. She wants to expand her business.

loans.use: Expand business

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
Even at 74 years old, Alejandrina has the same energy she did when she started her business. For twenty years, she's sold beverages such as colas and mineral water, thanks to a company that presented her with a market stall. She says that before she did a little of everything, selling food, green vegetables and "emoliente" (a hot drink made from barley) that she made herself.

Nothing was an obstacle for Alejandrina who always looked for a way to advance her three children who were then small. Her husband always supported her, happily, in maintaining the household; he also works to this day, as a gardener at a club in Chosica.

What Alejandrina most would like is to stock her small stand with more merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

A sus 74 años, Alejandrina aún conserva las fuerzas con las que empezó su negocio. Hace veinte años que vende bebidas como gaseosas y agua mineral gracias a que una empresa le obsequio el puesto. Antes de esto ella afirma que se dedicaba a todo, vendía comida, verduras y emoliente (una bebida caliente hecha a base de cebada) que ella misma preparaba.

Nada fue un obstáculo para Alejandrina quien siempre buscó en sacar adelante a sus tres hijos que entonces eran aun pequeños. Su esposo felizmente siempre la apoyo en la manutención del hogar; él, hoy en día, trabaja como jardinero en un club de recreación en Chosica también.

Lo que más quisiera Alejandrina es abastecer de más mercadería su pequeño puesto.

loans.use: Buy extra merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Emilda

texts.es:
Emilda belongs to the communal bank Santa Rosa de Lima, located in the neighborhood of San Juan Bautista Mz. b Lt. 14, in the Callería District in the region of Ucayali. She is 58 years old and is a mother of 9 children. Her husband works in a boat providing transportation services. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian Nuevos Soles from the Manuela Ramos organization she decided to invest in a small grocery store.

Currently she is continuing to work in her grocery store with the help of her children, whom share the household work in order to be able help their mother.

With this loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles, which will be paid in 4 months, she will buy 1 bag of rice, 1 bag of sugar, 1 case of milk, 1 case of oil, 2 packages of noodles, 1 bag of detergents, 2 cases of canned foods, toothpaste, shampoo, bleach, etc.

Emilda is very satisfied with all that she is achieving with her business. Her children are in good health and her husband supports her and this fills her with much joy.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Emilda pertenece al Banco Comunal Santa Rosa de Lima, ubicado en el Asentamiento. Humano. San Juan Bautista Mz. A Lt. 14, del Distrito de Calleria del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 58 años es madre de 9 hijos, su esposo es motorista. Emilda con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertirlo en una pequeña bodega.

En la actualidad continua con su bodega que atiende con la ayuda de sus hijos y se reparten las tareas domesticas para poder así ayudar a su mamá.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, comprará 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 caja de leche, 1 caja de aceite, 2 paquetes de fideos, 1 bolsa de detergentes, 2 cajas de conservas, pasta dental, champú, lejía, etc.

Emilda esta muy contenta por todo lo que esta logrando con su negocio sus hijos se encuentran bien de salud su esposo la apoya y todo eso la llena de mucha alegría.

loans.use: Buying merchandise for her grocery store

loans.name: Estrella

texts.es:
Estrella is a tenacious woman and, despite her delicate health after a recent operation, she's kept on working. For some years, she's made a living buying and selling pork and she recently decided to set up a small, permanent sales space in order to increase her earnings and meet the requests of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Estrella, es una mujer muy perseverante y a pesar de su delicado estado de salud tras ser operada no ha detenido sus actividades. Desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la comercialización de carne de cerdo y ha decidido dentro de poco establecerse en un espacio de ventas permanentes para acrecentar sus ganacias y complacer las peticiones de sus clientes.

loans.use: Set up a small space for sales.

loans.name: Kimie

texts.en:
Kimie I. is 40 years old. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Her husband works in the Tajik Aluminum Factory. Kimie is a market vendor. She sells clothing, such as sport shirts and shorts. Her eldest son helps her with the business. Kimie has been in this business for 8 years. During this time, Kimie managed to make her business stable and profitable, generating a stable income for her family. She tries to satisfy the needs of clients with varying tastes and income levels. She works very hard to give her dearest children good educations and to make them happy. 

To cover the higher education expenses of her eldest son, who is going to enter the university, Kimie is planning to increase her working capital in order to purchase new summer clothing to sell. For this purpose, Kimie requests 1600 Somoni ($475 USD) for 4 months. She promises to repay the loan accurately. Kimie is counting on your help. Be an important contributor to the growth of Kimie’s business.

loans.use: To buy new clothing to sell to teenagers

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde started her business from the necessity to contribute to the expenses of the house and of her children. In this way her family could get ahead, now that her husband was not working and she had to cover her own needs and those of her children. For this reason she decided to start her business. She began a few years ago when she decided to do something to generate income and she dedicated herself to the sale of cosmetics.

She needs a loan of $200 US, which will be repaid in 6 months, to re-stock her merchandise and articles for the summer season and to take advantage of the vacation season to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Matilde inició el negocio por la necesidad de contribuir con los gastos de la casa y los de sus hijos así como salir adelante con su familia ya que su esposo no estaba trabajando y ella tenia sus propias necesidades y las de sus hijos por eso decidió iniciar el negocio. Comenzó hace unos años cuando ella decidió hacer actividades para generar ingresos entonces se dedico a la venta de cosméticos.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $200 que pagara en 6 meses para resurtir mercancía y artículos de temporada de verano y aprovechar las vacaciones para aumentar las ventas.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (cosmetics) and summer items for resale.

loans.name: Yagud

texts.en: Yagud B. is a 42-year-old woman who sells dairy products such as milk and yoghurt in the Imishli region. She started her business in 1989. She is married and has 2 sons. As selling dairy products is the only financial resource in her family, Yagud would like to expand her business and purchase three additional calves for an estimated cost of 300 USD each and fodder for the remaining 100 USD.

loans.use: to purchase 3 calves and fodder

loans.name: Mrs Chan Sophal's Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This Village Bank which consists of eight people is located in Dei Edth Kaoh Phos village in Kandal Province and they plan to use the loan for different purposes.

The group leader, Mrs Chan S., owns a small restaurant where she sells food. Since her business is going well, Mrs Chan S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more ingredients in order to cook delicious food for her customers.

Mrs Chan S. is a 51-year-old widow with four children one of whom works abroad while the remaining three are enrolled in the local schoO..

loans.use: To buy more ingredients in order to cook the delicious food for her customers.

loans.name: Maria Sebastián

texts.es: Doña Patricia es propietaria de una tortillería en la ciudad de Nindiri trabaja desde las 6: a.m. hasta el medio día, con el préstamo ella compró materia prima (maíz y leña) piensa que con más créditos de Adim ella trabaje hasta la tarde y  logre abastecer a su barrio con este producto, es madre soltera de 4 hijos, los cuales van a escuela de secundaria de su municipio, son sus aliados en la elaboración del producto de las ganancias ella mantiene el hogar puesto que es jefa de familia , en un futuro piensa  mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio y contratar ayudantes para la elaboración de tortillas,
texts.en:
Mrs. Patricia is the owner of a tortilla store in the city of Nindiri. She works from 6:00 in the morning until the midday. With a previous loan, she bought raw ingredients (corn and firewood). She thinks that with more loans from Adim, she will work until the afternoon and will succeed in supplying her neighborhood with her product. She is a single mother of 4 children, who attend high school in their town. They are her allies in the production of the tortillas. From the earnings, she maintains the home because she is the head of the family. In the future, she wants to improve the facilities of her business and to hire assistants to help her make tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell tortillas and butcher pigs

loans.name: Ansorbeh Group

texts.en:
This is Asiatu K. and Fatu K.. They call their group Ansorbeh, a Temne word for "hard work." They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT and always repay their loans in full. Their previous loan was for Le 500,000 each. This helped them a lot. They were able earn more profit after the loan and solve many of their problems. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 800,000 each to add to their businesses.

Asiatu (pictured on the left) is the leader of this group. She was born in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. She is thirty-two and married with five children. Two of her children are in secondary school, two in primary school, and the last is not yet of school age. She has been a businesswoman for the past fifteen years. She sells market food like rice, palm-oil, salt, and onions.

With this loan of Le 800,000, Asiatu will buy more of the above items to add to her business. She usually buys these items in a business center called Faredugu. To ensure that she always pays her loans on time, Asiatu enrolled into an Osusu. This is an informal savings account wherein each member of the Osusu group (usually made up of eight, ten, or fifteen people, depending on the number of people willing to join) contributes an agreed amount of money to another member on a daily, weekly, or monthly basis. She always ensures that the receipt of her portion of the savings coincides with her monthly repayment schedule. She uses part of this money to repay her loan to SMT and part of it to solve her numerous problems.

loans.use: Tp purchase rice, palm oil, salt, and onions to sell in the market.

loans.name: Pham Thi

texts.en:
Mrs. Pham Thi T., 26 years old and married with children, lives in Gia Khanh Commune, Binh Xuyen District, Vinh Phuc Province. She has been in the TYM Fund since 2003, and her main income is derived from raising and selling pork.

With an increasing income her family’s life is getting more and more stable to the point where Pham has enough money to invest in her children’s education. She is now requesting a loan to invest in her business.

loans.use: To invest in her business.

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria. GDP per capita stands at $749 and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.




Née le 10 décembre 1970 à Dassa-Zoumè dans le département des colines au centre du Bénin, dame T. Aminatou est mariée à AGBAGNIDE Mathias. Ell est mère de quatre enfants et. elle est revendeuse des articles divers dans le Zone des Ambassades. Ayant actuellement des difficultées financières pour raison de cambriolage, elle sollicite son deuxième crédit pour renforcer son capital.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminatou T. was born on the 10th of December, 1970, at Dassa-Zoume in the district of Colines, in the center of Benin. She is married to Mathias Agbagnide and is the mother of 4 children. Aminatou is a reseller of assorted articles in the area called the Embassy Zone. She is now experiencing some financial difficulty due to a robbery and is requesting this, her second loan, to strengthen her working capital.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 2 cartons of sugar, 2 cartons of milk and 1 carton of mayonnaise

loans.name: Pa

texts.en: Pa L. is 43 years old, a house wife, and lives in Kampong Cham with her husband and four of her children. She stays at home doing housework and cooking for her family members. Her husband is a head of family who desires to earn an income to support the family. He runs a small restaurant selling wine, roast beef and pork. On average, he makes about US$6 a day. Two of their children are employed and two others are students. This family would like to use the loan to purchase utensils and more food products to increase the business.

loans.use: To purchase utensils.

loans.name: Ericson

texts.es: Ericson tiene 27 años, es soltero, vive en la casa de sus padres con sus demás hermanos. Tiene la profesión de docente, trabaja en la selva rural del Perú desde el año 2005, esta labor le llena de mucha complacencia por prestar sus servicios a los niños de esta zona tan alejada donde debido a la distancia y las carencias económicas en la que viven no pueden compran en su totalidad los útiles escolares. Entonces él les vende los libros y demás artículos y van pagando poco a poco, para que de ese modo sus hijos puedan tener con qué estudiar.  Ante esta realidad Ericson lleva cuadernos, lápices, gomas, colores, etc; entonces los reparte a sus alumnos y les cobra fraccionadamente, al brindar esta facilidad a sus alumnos se siente muy complacido y le llena de mucha satisfacción, y a la vez le está resultando muy rentable a su economía ingresando algunos soles que muchas veces le cubre sus pasajes. Ericson nos comenta que por su trabajo a veces no asiste a todas sus reuniones del banco comunal, pero deja encargado a su madre para que pueda pagar las cuotas en las fechas programadas, este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y en todo este tiempo ha pagado sus cuotas responsablemente. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de útiles escolares, y de ese modo brindar apoyo a estos niños de la zona rural de la selva peruana.
texts.en:
Ericson is 27, single and lives in his parents' home with his siblings. He is a teacher, working in the jungle of Peru since 2005. This work fills him with satisfaction that he has lent his services to the children of this area, so remote where because of distance and lack of funding they cannot buy all the school supplies they need. Because of this he sells books and other articles and is paid in installments so that his kids can have the tools they need to study. In view of the reality he faces, Ericson brings notebooks, pencils, erasers, crayons and so on. He distributes them to his students and is repaid over time. Providing this service to his students gives him pleasure and fills him with satisfaction. At the same time, it is profitable and is an extra income which often pays for his travel expenses. Ericson tells us that because of his work he sometimes misses community bank meetings but he has entrusted his mother with paying his loan on time. This is his second loan with MFP and in all this time he has proven himself responsible in repaying on time. He will use the loan to buy school supplies and in this way support these children of the Peruvian jungle.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more school supplies to resell

loans.name: Ata Mohammad

texts.en: Ata M. is the son of M. N.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 8 children. He is a farmer and he very much enjoys working and expanding his business. He wants to take an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 12 months to buy essential tools. He admires this process and wants to say many thanks to Kiva lenders and the other lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy farming tools

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en: Aydin A. is an experienced and energetic man who wants to improve his family's living conditions. He is 37 years old and married with two children. He has a retail shop where he sells spare parts for foreign cars. He has been involved in this business for more than six years, helping his father before he opened his own shop. He provides spare parts for cars and provides his family with food and other necessities. There is a great demand for Aydin's spare parts, so he wants to buy more goods to meet his clients' demands. He wants to buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop's inventory. He promises to repay this loan within 15 months. Aydin is happy about this loan and thanks everyone for their trust and support.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and enlarge his shop's inventory

loans.name: Atasse

texts.fr: Atasse A. est un jeune homme de 37 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est propriétaire d’un dépôt des produits FanMilk. Il souhaite avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son magasin en Achetant deux congélateurs pour la conservation de ses marchandises. Ce faisant, il évitera les pertes et tirera et dégagera plus de profits.
texts.en:
Atasse A., age 37, is a young man, married, and the father of two. He is the owner of an outlet for FanMilk products. He would like to use this loan to expand his store by buying two freezers for keeping his merchandise. By doing this, he will avoid losses and will derive more profit.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two freezers

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth C., 36, lives in Dicayas, Dipolog City with her husband and four children, two of whom are still in school. Many are inspired by her dedication and hard work for the benefit of her family.

Elizabeth works as a snack vendor to her neighbors and the neighboring barrios, selling native snacks such as "suman" and bananas. Because of increased demand for her products, she investigated many lending institution for financial assistance. Since joining Paglaum MPC, which extends financial services to the poor, she has been a good member, having already received and repaid two loans. Now, she is seeking a loan of 12,000 PHP to be able to purchase ingredients for her native snack-making. Elizabeth would like to establish a mini-restaurant and snack house in the future.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making native snacks.

location.town: Dipolog - Dicayas, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Nor

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: La señora Isabel Cristina Rodríguez, tiene la edad de 43 años, habita en Km. 10 ½ carretera hacia Masaya, junto a su esposo, el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene una hija de 12 años, la cual estudia actualmente, los planes hacia su familia es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida, ella desde hace tres años se dedica a confeccionar ropa , ya que tiene que estar al pendiente de su hija ya que la pequeña sufre de epilepsia , los sueños de doña Isabel es poder tener una gran taller de costura . El mayor problema que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento, ella inicio este negocio con sus propios esfuerzos, con el préstamo lo invertirá en tela, hilo, bordados  y demás accesorios para confecciones, y poder hacer una costura buena y bonita.
texts.en:
Isabel Cristina Rodríguez, 43, lives with her husband at Km. 10 ½ on the highway to Masaya. Her husband helps with the household expenses. They have a twelve year old daughter who currently goes to school. They family plan is to be able to improve their living conditions. For three years she has been making clothes. She has to devote herself to her daughter since the little one suffers from epilepsy. Isabel’s dream is to be able to have a great seamstress shop. The biggest problem she has is the lack of financing. She started this business with her own efforts. With this loan she will buy fabric, thread, embroidery, and other accessories to be able to make good and pretty clothes.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, embroidery, and other accessories

loans.name: Kalsoom Rafiq Masih Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom baji, wife of R. M., has lived in a mid-sized city named Riwind, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. Her husband works in a factory on monthly wage.

Kalsoom baji is a very hardworking lady. She earns money sewing clothes by taking orders from her neighbors. She uses her money to fulfill needs including the utility expenses. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine so that she is able to sew more clothes and complete the orders on time.

She is the group leader of five other women from her locality:

Bushran baji, Rehana baji and Safia baji each want a loan to repair their tractors.

Mukhtaran baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading.

Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor A. deals in livestock. He buys cattle all the way from northern Ghana. Victor sells to the butchers and restaurant operators in his community. He has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy livestock in bulk. 
Victor is 41 years old, married and has four children – two sons and two daughters. They are in senior high, junior high and primary schools. Victor’s wife is a trader. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in the town of Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Dwenase is a commercial and farming town. Victor is hoping to give his children the best education.

loans.use: To buy livestock

loans.name: Kofi Pierre

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a appris l’activité de la menuserie, il réside dans le quartier d’attiégou. Il est marié et père d’un enfant. Il exerce ce commerce depuis 2000, il fabrique lui-même des meubles qu’il expose et vend. Actuellement il a reçu des commandes de ses clients malheureusement il ne dispose  pas assez de bois pour exécuter la commande. Pour pouvoir satisfaire ses clients il sollicite de wages un crédit pour acheter des bois et des matières indispensables à l’activité de la menuserie.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who learned about wood-working. He has been in this business since 2000. He resides in the Attiégou district. He is married and the father of one child.
