Currently he has orders from customers. Unfortunately, he doesn't have enough wood to fill the orders. To be able to satisfy his customers, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy wood and some indispensable supplies for making cabinets and furniture.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is a natiive of Pililia, Rizal province in the Philippines. She is 46 years old and determined to bring her eight children out of poverty. She is married to Braulio, who is 55 years old.

With her desire to step out from the spiral of poverty, in 2008 she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI and KIVA partner in the Philippines. She is hopeful to have access to capital for her business selling food, such as pork barbeque, grilled hot dogs, fish balls and other similar foods. She uses her tri-bike as a cart in roaming around the village. Her business is a favorite of kids during the afternoon, and the men who are drinking beer buy barbeque.

Alicia is now on her third loan. She proposes to borrow 14,000 pesos to pay for one sidecar, pork, hot dogs, fish balls, frying pans, and a stove. She hopes that through her business, she can reach her dreams of sending her children to school until college and of renovating her house to make it more spacious and durable.

loans.use: To buy a sidecar, pork, hotdogs, fishballs, frying pans, and a stove

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.ru: Иммуратов Равшан проживает  в районе Руми. Возраст 33 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Равшан более 2 лет работал по специальности "кассиром". В данный момент более 3 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. откармливанием и продажей скота. Кредит просит для закупа скота. На полученную прибыль хочет оставить себе несколько поголовье.
texts.en:
Ravshan I. lives in the Rumy district. He is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. Ravshan worked in his profession as a cashier for over 2 years. Now, he has been involved in animal husbandry, i.e. raising and selling livestock, for over 3 years. He is requesting a loan to purchase livestock. He wants to use resulting profits to keep several heads of livestock for himself.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Tutoatasi

texts.en: Tutoatasi T. (0) is a 49-year-old woman living in the town of Samalaeulu Leauvaa. She is widowed and has three adult children. Tutoatasi owns and operates a clothing business, providing general clothing services to local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 350 WST a month. In 2007, Tutoatasi joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. Tutoatasi is now requesting a new loan of 2,000 WST which will be used to invest in expanding her business. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Fatumah's Group

texts.en:
Fatumah is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a determined, hard-working lady with a three-year-old brewing business that she runs from her home. She brews waragi (distilled from bananas, cassava, millet or sugar cane), tonto (green bananas and roasted sorghum) and malwa (millet). She sells her brews mostly to bar owners but also to customers who prefer to take them home. She uses her savings and profits to cover most of her and her children’s needs.

Since she is wholly in charge of paying her children’s school fees, Fatumah is requesting a loan to help pay for these particular costs. She will use her profits from her successful brewing business to pay back her loan.

loans.use: To pay for her children's school fees

loans.name: Khiem

texts.en: Mrs. Khiem S. is 38 years old widow and she lives in Ro Lous village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. She is also a grocer. Now Mrs. Khiem S. is requesting a loan buy fertilizer to support the rice field and grocery products. She hopes to increase income and improve the family living with this loan.

loans.use: To ask for a loan buy fertilizer to support the rice field and grocery products.

loans.name: Santos Javier

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Santos Javier G. le está haciendo falta la barda lateral, ya que la casa que está enseguida de la de él está abandonada y hay muchos animales y gente mala, teme por la seguridad de su familia cuando él no esté en su casa.
Es por eso que está solicitando el préstamo ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y realizar la barda lo más pronto posible. Planea pagarlo con los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo como chofer de camión. 
La persona que aparece en la foto es su esposa la señora Cynthia Aurora Barba ya que el señor Santos Javier se encontraba en su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Javier G.'s house is missing the side wall because the house next to his is abandoned, and there are a lot of animals and wicked people. He is afraid for his family's safety when he is not home. Because of this, he is seeking this loan – because right now he does not have the necessary money to buy the material to build wall as soon as possible. He plans to repay the loan with the funds he gets from his work as a bus driver. The person in the picture is his wife, Mrs. Cynthia Aurora Barba, because Mr. Santos Javier was at work.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kastner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Side wall

loans.name: United Friends Group

texts.en:
Melvin D. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called United Friends. He is 29 years old, married and has two children, aged five and ten. They are in kindergarten and 4th grade respectively. Melvin dropped out of school at 11th grade due to poverty. Melvin and his family live and work on New Port Street, a community in downtown Monrovia that is mixed with both poor and middle-class Liberians.

Melvin buys slippers from wholesalers and sells them retail on a table on New Port Street. He has been running this business for about four years. He started with a small amount saved from his salary as a security guard, and he hopes to improve the business and move to a bigger store in the future. Melvin talks to his customers in a good manner and sells his slippers at affordable prices in order to encourage his customers to continue buying from him.

He needs this loan to purchase more slippers to improve his business. Melvin dreams of giving his children a better education and setting them up in business.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers

loans.name: Virgen Asunta De Racsa Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios, pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACSA”. El banco comunal esta conformado por 11 socios y es nuevo. Los socios radican en la provincia del Cusco. La mayoría de ellos tienen un stand independiente en el mercado “Virgen Asunta” pero con actividades de trabajo similares. El mercado “Virgen Asunta” tiene 3 años de fundación. La reunión de las socias se hace en el stand de la socia Angelica.   

Nuestros socios alternan sus diversas actividades del hogar con la venta de papas, bolsas, granos. La socia Marianela se dedica a la venta de granos como maíz, fréjoles, habas, cebada, trigo, etc.  Las socia Antonia se dedica a venta de bolsas para empaquetar papas. La gran parte de la socias y socios se dedican a la venta de papas al por mayor, ellos distribuyen papas a todos los demás mercados de la cuidad.   

Los socios solicitan el préstamo para que lo utilicen como capital de trabajo y de esta manera incrementar sus productos y aumentar sus ventas, para dar mejor calidad de vida a sus familias.

Los socios valoran y agradecen el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y así mismo se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.

(El socio José no asistió a la reunión por motivos de trabajo y no aparece en la fotografía, pero pidió permiso a la junta directiva del banco comunal).
texts.en:
Our members belong to the “VIRGEN ASUNTA DE RACSA” communal bank. The bank is made up of 11 members and it is new. The members are residents of Cusco province. Most of them have independent stalls in the "Virgen Asunta" market but with similar lines of work. The "Virgen Asunta" market is three years old. The group meetings are held in Angelica's stand. Our members alternate their various domestic chores with sales of potatoes, sacks, and grains. Marianela, for example, sells grains like corn, kidney beans, barley, wheat, etc. Antonia sells potato sacks. Most of the members sell wholesale potatoes; they distribute their potatoes to the other municipal markets. The members are asking for financing to use as working capital so that they can increase their products and sales thereby providing their families with improved quality of life. The members value and appreciate the loan granted and pledge to repay in a timely fashion. (The member José did not attend the meeting due to work obligations so does not appear in the photo. He did, however, ask the governing board of the communal bank for permission to be absent).

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase purchase and sale of potatoes.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.es: Edwin de 34 años es casado hace varios años con la Sra. Eva de 31 años, en cuyo hogar existen dos hijos de 10 y 6 años, gracias al trabajo de ambos lograron contar con casa propia. Edwin se dedica al rubro del transporte con su propia herramienta de trabajo en donde es afiliado a una línea de transporte que tienen gran demanda de pasajeros, su esposa tiene su tienda de barrio en su domicilio particular en donde ofrece variedad de productos. Si bien existe competencia en todos los rubros, Edwin tiene la ventaja de pertenecer a una asociación en la cual realizan servicio único a la zona norte y tiene buena demanda, su esposa gracias a la ubicación de su tienda cuenta con bastante clientela que la visita a diario para comprar los productos que ofrece. El crédito solicitado fue para el mantenimiento general de su vagoneta. Edwin es cliente antiguo en la institución accedió a 4 créditos anteriores, todos con excelente comportamiento en el pago de sus cuotas, Edwin es fiel con la institución por agradecimiento al crecimiento económico que tuvo con los créditos de Agrocapital.
texts.en:
Edwin is 34 years old and has been married for several years to Sra. Eva, who is 31 years old. They have two children, ages 10 and 6. Thanks to both of them working, they have been able to acquire their own home. Edwin works in the transportation business and has his own vehicle. The route he is affiliated with experiences great passenger demand. His wife operates a neighborhood grocery store out of their home where she offers a variety of products. While competition exists everywhere, Edwin has the advantage of belonging to an association that provides the only service in the northern district, which has high demand. Thanks to the location of her store, his wife encounters enough customers who come by each day to buy the products she offers. The loan he is requesting was used for general vehicle maintenance. Edwin is a long-time client of the Institution who has accessed four previous loans, and successfully repaid all of them. He is loyal to the Institution because of the financial growth he has experienced resulting from the loans from Fundación AgroCapital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Cruz

texts.es:
La Señora Cruz Hernández  tiene 48 años, ella vive en Santiago Sacatepequez tiene 7 hijos, es una mujer emprendedora que se dedica a la agricultura. Inició sembrando espinaca, tiempo después hizo planes para sembrar arveja.

Esto le ayudó bastante e hizo crecer su cosecha, actualmente cuenta con una manzana de terreno que utiliza para la siembra y cosecha de la arveja. Ella solicita su crédito ya  que necesita capital para comprar las compras necesarias para sacar adelante la cosecha,  como abono, herbecidas, caña de bambú, pita.   Su experiencia en este tipo de inversión le ayuda ya que su producto lo entrega a una cooperativa agrícola llamada cuatro pinos.  Ella desea a salir adelante con los planes que tiene y  seguir mejorando en la calidad de vida para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Cruz Hernández, 48, lives in Santiago Sacatepequez; she has 7 children. She is an enterprising woman who is a farmer. She began growing spinach but later on began to make plans to plant peas. This was a great help to her and her crops increased. Currently she has a "manzana" (1.7 acres) of land on which she grows peas. She needs financing to buy the items needed to successfully bring her crops to harvest: natural fertilizer, herbicides, bambu stalks, pita (a kind of rope or cord made from agave). This kind of investment helps her because she turns over her crops to an agricultural cooperative called "cuatro pinos." She hopes to get ahead with her plans and to continue to improve her own and her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer, herbicides, and bamboo stalks.

loans.name: Julio

texts.en: Julio has owned a multi-service phone retail store for the last ten years. He believes that having his own business has helped him progress in life - there is so much that he learns from owning his own business that he applies to all aspects of his life. In addition to the success he feels from being able to provide for his family, Julio has felt a huge sense of success being able to provide a service to his community. The extra income that he earns also goes to support his aging parents back home in the Dominican Republic. With the loan from ACCION USA, Julio will use 75% to buy new cell phones and accessories and 25% on promotions. He will need the extra stock in inventory to support all of the clients that will be coming through his doors. Julio is very positive about his business and believes that this loan from ACCION USA will be a big help to his success. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy more cell phones and accessories, and to use for business promotion

loans.name: María Fátima

texts.es:
La señora María Fatima Q. se ha dedicado por 17 años a su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras en el Mercado Mayoreo donde a diario ofrece los productos con el propósito de obtener los ingresos para su desarrollo económico y el de su familia. Ella vende naranjas, sandías, piñas, bananos, jocotes, entre otros.

Ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de limones y mandarinas para ofertarlas. Espera confiadamente que su crédito sea otorgado y así suplir las necesidades de su familia a la que tanto ama.
texts.en:
For 17 years, Mrs. María Fatima Q. has had a business selling fruits and vegetables in the Mayoreo Market, where she sells her merchandise daily with the intention of earning income for the economic development of herself and her family. She sells oranges, watermelons, pineapples, bananas, jocotes (fruit in the mango family), among others. She is asking for a loan to purchase limes and mandarin oranges to sell. She confidently expects that her loan will be granted and provide the necessities for her family, whom she loves very much.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Kurten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Fruits and Vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of a pump

loans.name: Arling Melissa

texts.es:
la joven Arling Melissa M. tiene un año de dedicarse al comercio y su actividad principal es la venta Cosméticos  y desea comprar ropa nueva para vender tambien.
actividad que realiza de manera domiciliar y ambulante en la aldea de Jutiapa, Jamastran.
Arling se a sabido ganar sus clientes, mismos que la prefieren por las facilidades de pago que les ofrece y por la buena calidad de productos que vende, ya que son de marcas reconocidas.
La Joven  Arling M., vive con sus padres y con los ingresos que le genera su negocio cubre a un 100% sus gastos personales y los gastos de estudios universitarios ya que estudia en el sistema de educación distancia. CASUED El Paraíso.
su meta a corto plazo es poder graduarse de la universidad.
texts.en:
Young Arling Melissa M. has been operating her own business for a year, selling cosmetics mostly. She wants to buy new clothing so that she can sell that, as well. She works as a street vendor, sometimes selling from her house, but also around the small Honduran town of Jutiapa. Arling knows how to win over her customers. They like her because of the easy payment terms she offers and because of the quality of the products--all knows brands--that she sells. Arling lives with her parents, but her earnings cover 100% of her personal expenses. She is studying for a long-distance university degree and her earnings cover her education fees, as well. Her short-term goal is to get her university degree.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for resell.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
Teresa D. Jesús Márraga tiene 59 años vive en la ciudadela 20 D. Julio D. Barranquilla tiene 5 hijos en las edades  desD.  30 a 39 años, se dedica a la venta D. mercancía y también D. alimentos,  especialmente almuerzos  y dulces, para lo cual solicita a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, su crédito número 15, por valor D.  $ 2.000.000, con él comprará mercancía como ropa, calzado, prendas y electrodomésticos  para satisfacer la demanda D. su clientela.
Proveniente D. SabanagranD. desD. sus 20 años D. edad , estudio hasta tercer  grado D. primaria y no pudo continuar, porque cuando su padre murió,  cuatro D. sus seis hermanas tuvieron que dedicarse a trabajar D. empleadas del servicio domestico para sostener el hogar; pero un día su madre le propuso hacer un negocio y tomó su experiencia en la preparación D. alimentos e inició la venta D. pasteles y almuerzos  hasta el día D. hoy;  esta actividad y agregándole la venta D. mercancías les ha ayudado a  ella y a su esposo a progresar, porque  dedicados a apoyar la educación D. sus hijos, los llevaron hasta el bachillerato y aun a hacer carreras técnicas, en las que ahora trabajan y les aportan una cantidad D. dinero mensual para su sostenimiento; ella dice,  que con su negocio consiguieron comprar la vivienda  y que su sueño ahora, es que sus hijos siempre tengan un mejor  empleo y ampliar el negocio hasta conseguir que este sea un almacén,  lo cual le generaría mucha  satisfacción personal.  Teresa Vive en el barrio Ciudadela 20 D. Julio, nombre que indica una relación histórica con su país, pues justamente  fue inaugurado el 20 D. julio, día en que se celebra la independencia D. Colombia y donD. se realizan eventos deportivos, culturales D. origen patriótico.
texts.en:
Teresa D. Jesús Márraga, 59, lives in Barranquilla’s La Ciudadela 20 D. Julio neighborhood. She has 5 children that range in ages from 30 to 39. She sells general merchandise and prepared meals, especially breakfasts and candy. She is asking Fundación Mario Santo Domingo for her 15th loan valued at $2.000.000 to buy merchandise such as, clothing, shoes, items, and appliances to meet customer demand. She came from SabanagranD. at the age of 20. She was only able to finish third graD. because, when her father died, four of her six sisters had to go to work as domestic employees to support the household. One day, however, her mother suggested they start a business and, taking her experience cooking started to sell meals and pastries, an activity that continues to this day. This activity, plus the added sales of merchandise, helped her and her husband to progress. They succeeded in educating their children through high school even completing technical careers in which they now work; they contribute certain monthly amounts to help with their support. She says that their business maD. it possible for them to buy a house and that her dream now is that her children always have good jobs and to enlarge the business until it can become a store which would be of great personal satisfaction to her. Teresa lives in the Ciudadela 20 D. Julio neighborhood, a name that points to a historical relationship with her country because it was inaugurated on July 20th, Colombia’s Independence Day. It is here that patriotic athletic and cultural events take place.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing, shoes, items and appliances.

loans.name: C2351 Twiyubake Group

texts.en:
Jaqueline was born in 1980 and is married with four children aged between 3 and 11. Her husband is Macon.

Jaqueline is the group representative of five members. In this group, most of them sell fruits and vegetables. Jaqueline owns a restaurant which is well-known in the region.

Jaqueline and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses.  Jaqueline plans to purchase more foodstuffs to cook in her restaurant.

With this loan, Jaqueline and her group believe they will earn more profits which will help them to sort out some problems in their businesses as well as support their families.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Born in 1954, Theresia N. is a widow with five children. The fact that Theresia N. was a widow with the burden or inability to take care her children and to take care of their health actually motivated her to join GHAPE and she became very hardworking. She says her main aim of joining GHAPE was because of their educational talks and the training they offer before giving out loans. With a loan, she will be able to invest in buying more goats, feed and crop seeds for farming. She will generate more income, which will allow her to cater to her children’s education and their health. She also intend to open an account for herself to be saving her profit, which she will use for constructing a house for herself in the future. 

Theresi’s loan would be provided through the Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE), a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Goats and seedlings

loans.name: Saidia

texts.en:
Saidia S. is currently in the business of selling tea and bread at the street in the evening. She is requesting a loan to stock more sugar and milk to make tea to sell. Saidia is 30 years old, married, and her husband is a driver. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a restaurant at the market.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more sugar and milk to make to sell.

loans.name: Monica's Group

texts.en:
Monica A. is from the village of Magsaysay. She is 59 years old. Monica is the group leader of a three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Monica is married and has seven adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling household items in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately $200 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Monica joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,700 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase rice. Monica is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to provide the needs of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel J. is from the town of Banga. He is 45 years old, married and has two school-aged children.

Joel owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice and corn for sale. He also raises chickens. He has been engaged in these businesses for over eighteen years already.

In 2009, Joel joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI.

Joel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure and also feeds for his chickens. This loan will be his third from CEVI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure plus feed for his chickens

loans.name: Golondrina Group

texts.es:
El grupo Golondrina lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas Carolina P. de 20 años quien inicio vendiendo ropa y  con las ganancias invirtió en  una pulpería en la cual le ayuda su mamá. Ella es madre de dos gemelas de cinco años que son su razón de ser por las cuales desea salir adelante.

Sus compañeras de grupo son Jamileth C. quien tiene una pequeña venta y Rebeca del Rosario Urbina desde hace seis años tiene una tortillería y vende buñuelos postres a base de yuca y queso.
texts.en:
The Golondrina Group consists of three hardworking women. One of them is Carolina P.. At the age of 20, she started selling clothing and used the earnings to invest in a grocery store that her mother helps to manage. Carolina is the mother of five year old twins who are the reason behind her desire to get ahead.

Her fellow group members are Jamileth C., who has a grocery store, and Rebeca del Rosario Urbina, who has been selling tortillas and fritters made of cassava and cheese for the past six years.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grain, meat, yogurt, and other products

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 38 años, es una madre de familia muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 menores hijos y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo María ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papa, alverja y habas, productos que tiene mucha demanda en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, comercializándolas al por mayor. Estos cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 26 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. En lo sucesivo desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su grupo comunal es una compañera muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus tierras.
texts.en:
María, age 38, is a down-to-earth and hard-working mother who lives in her own home with her 4 youngest children. What she most wants is to improve her quality of life. After much effort, María has managed to work her crop fields and make them productive. She cultivates potatoes, peas and broad beans, crops that are in high demand at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. These crops have provided her with the income she needs to support her family, which is why she would like to put all her efforts in helping her business succeed. What she most likes about her job is taking care of her crops. She has been in this field for 26 years and thinks that the most difficult aspect of her job is having to transport her produce all the way to Tarma, since the sacks that she carries are very heavy and wear her out. In the future, she would like to purchase more crop fields so that she can increase production. This is her sixth loan with MFP. She has been very punctual in repaying her previous loans and hopes to continue this way. She is a very active member of the group who is always aware of her fellow group members' agreements. With the 1,000.00 PEN that she is requesting, she will purchase more fertilizer for her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer to improve the quality of her crops

loans.name: Robelinda

texts.en:
Robelinda L. is from the village of Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 41 years old. Robelinda is married and has 7 school-aged children. To make a living, Robelinda owns & operates a fishing business, buying & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Robelinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Robelinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Robelinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Robelinda is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Robelinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Leulele Ole

texts.en:
Leulele has been rearing animals for sale in Naivasha town for 20 years. He is 44 years old and married to Maite K.. They have three children.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the income that he gets after the business has expanded to  improve his standard of living and, at the same time, to sustain the business.

He hopes to grow this animal-rearing business to large-scale farming, in that he will be able to supply the entire Naivasha town with animals for sale.

loans.use: To add more sheep and goats to his stock

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda S. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Tan-awan, Oslob, Cebu. She earns her living by operating a fish-vending business. Her husband Emiliano S., who is 52 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living. They have seven children who range from 6 to 31 years old. Erlinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erlinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 17,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,200, thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her seventh loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for their future and send her children to college. Erlinda S. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Harold

texts.es: Harold, de 24 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposa Lisbeth de 21 años y su único hijo Junior de 10 meses, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En la comodidad de su hogar Harold tiene su horno, desde entonces todos los días se levanta muy temprano para cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Él trabaja con su esposa Lisbeth y juntos realizan pan, ya que el horno les pertenece a ambos. Disfruta mucho de su labor, como hornear pasteles, es así que tiene 15 años trabajando en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es elaborar los panes, ya que tiene que tener mucho cuidado para que no se quemen. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera poner una tienda donde pueda vender él mismo sus panes. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querido por el resto de sus socias. Los mil nuevos soles que solicita, los invertirá en comprar ingredientes, para preparar sus deliciosos panes.
texts.en:
Harold is 24 years old. He is a very unpretentious and hard working young man. He lives in a rented house together with his wife Lisbeth, 21 years old, and their only son, Junior who is 10 months old. They are the reason for all of his efforts. In the comfort of his home Harold has an oven. He starts baking very early in the morning to fill all the orders he has received from his clients. He works together with his wife Lisbeth and together they bake breads. The oven belongs to them both. He very much enjoys his work, especially baking cakes. He has 15 years' experience in the field. The most difficult part of the work is baking breads because he always has to give special care to not over bake them. In the future he hopes to set up a store from where they can sell their baked goods themselves. This is the first loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He knows that if he pays his loan back on time he will have access to future loans and not bring any difficulties to his community bank. He is very well liked by the other members of the group. The one thousand nuevos soles that he requests will be invested in the purchase of ingredients to bake more delicious breads.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for his bakery.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en:
Amer is a 34-year-old married man from Chtoura and is the father of three children. Amer has been creating stone sculpture pieces since 2000, and he's very brave in his work. His work is like art itself, and its creation requires good taste and a calm space in which to work. Amer loves his family a lot and seeks the best for them; he hopes he can help in giving them the education they deserve.

This is the first time Amer is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, and he's asking for it in order to buy some things necessary to his business and to use what's left for school tuition fees. Amer hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: To buy things necessary for his business and pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Los Atlantes Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Los Atlantes, y tiene este nombre por que es en honor a la cultura Tolteca que surgió en Tula.  Está ubicado en la Tula de Allende Hidalgo, Estado de México.  El grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes.
La Sra. María Virginia C. es la Tesorera del grupo.  Tiene 41 años, estudió hasta la secundaria, es de clase baja, y no tiene hijos.  Ella se dedica a la costura, que inicio hace 15 años.  Solicita el préstamo para comprar otra máquina, una de mejor tecnología para aumentar su producción.  Sus clientes la buscan mucho ya que cose muy bonito. Sus compañeras mencionan que la señora María Virginia es muy responsable en todos los aspectos de la vida, es muy ordenada y honesta, por tal motivo fue que la eligieron como tesorera. Al momento de solicitar este préstamo se encuentra muy entusiasmada pues tendrá la nueva máquina que dará mejores acabados a sus costuras.

La Sra. Alicia Alcántara es otra integrante de este grupo.  Tiene 33 años, estudió hasta la secundaria, es de clase media baja y tiene dos hijos de 8 y 4 años.  Ella se dedica a la venta de tamales desde hace 4 años y utilizo su préstamo para comprar los insumos para sus tamales ya que son muy aceptados entre sus clientes.  Al momento de solicitar el crédito se encuentra muy contenta ya que podrá dar más variedad de sabor a sus tamales.
texts.en:
This group is called "Los Atlantes," and they have this name because it is in honor of the Toltec culture that arose in Tula.  This group is located in Tula de Allende Hidalgo, México.  The group is made up of 9 members. 

Mrs.. María Virginia C. is the Treasurer for the group. She is 41 years old, and studied up to high school. She is from the lower class and has no children. She is a seamstress, a profession she began 15 years ago.  She is requesting a loan to buy another sewing machine, one with better technology to increase production. Her clients seek her out because she sews beautifully. Her companions mention that Mrs. María Virginia is very responsible in all aspects of her life, saying that she is very organized and honest, and for that reason they selected her as treasurer. At the time of this loan request, she is very enthusiastic about having a new machine that will give her better results with all she sews. 

Mrs. Alicia Alcántara is another member of this group. She is 33 years old, studied up until high school, is from the middle class and has two children ages 8 and 4.  For the past for years she's been selling tamales. She used this loan to buy ingredients for her tamales, which are very appreciated among her clients. At the time of this loan request, she is very happy because this will enable her to add more flavorful choices to her tamales.

loans.use: To invest in their clothing business

loans.name: Cham

texts.en: Cham R., 26, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. R.'s husband appears in the photograph because R. is not available. R. and her husband sell rice, earning an income of $5 each per day. R. has to spend $25 on food, $2 on electricity and water supplies, and $5 on other necessary expenses every month. She is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase more rice to resell and a motorbike for family use. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy more rice and a motorbike

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with a 3-year-old son. He is a small farmer from Kamenka. Alexander grows early spring vegetables. He owns a nice big greenhouse where he grows his vegetables and a smaller one for seedlings. Alexander has been in this business for four years. He has already invested about 40,000 UAH in this business. 

Alexander is planning to invest a loan of 10,000 UAH in the purchase and installation of a heating unit for his greenhouse. A nice heating system, properly chosen and installed, will help maintain uniform temperatures and positively affect the micro-climate for the plants Alexander grows in his greenhouse. Besides vegetables, Alexander also grows fruit, such as plums, cherries, etc. He owns a small van to transport his produce to the marketplaces in his region.

loans.use: to install a heating unit in his greenhouse

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis tiene 19 años de edad, estudia II año de Ingenieria Agropecuaria, vive en Condega, Se motivo a estudiar esta carrera porque su familia trabaja en la Agricultura y le gusta mucho el trabajo de campo. Su familia lo apoya en su carrera, su Papá se dedica a la siembra de Tabaco, y en las vacaciones lo ayuda mucho.

El realizó este préstamo para invertir en compra de Insumos, para un Proyecto de la Universidad para Cultivar Repollo.

Este proyecto ha sido muy importante porque le ha ayudado a afianzar sus conocimientos con la practica. Le gustaria tener su propio negocio relacionado con la agricultura. Desea culminar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Luis, 19, is a second year Agriculture and Cattle Raising student.  He lives in Condega.  The reason why he's studying this subject is that his family works in agriculture and he enjoys working in the fields very much.  His family supports him in his career.  His father is a tobacco farmer and during vacation periods he helps him a lot.

He negotiated this loan to buy supplies for a university project: to grow cabbage.

This project has been very important because it helps him connect theory to practice.  He'd like to have a business of his own related to agriculture.  He wants to finish his studies.

loans.use: Agronomy Student Project: Vegetable (Cabbage) Farming.

loans.name: Sara Maritza

texts.es:
Sara de 45 años, tiene un taller de confección y costura en su casa. Vive en una zona urbana llamada suburbio caracterizada porque la mayoría de sus habitantes son comerciantes informales. 

Le comenzó a gustar la costura desde que tenía 18 años cuando su papa le regalo una máquina de coser. Cuando tuvo sus hijos ella comenzó a ofrecer sus servicios como costurera, poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo tener una clientela fija y trabajar desde su casa. En la actualidad tiene un espacio en su casa donde tiene un pequeño taller de costura y unas maquinas de coser que ha podido comprar durante estos años. 

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar con el préstamo cemento, bloques, arena para readecuar su casa y ubicar en un mejor lugar su taller de confección. En el futuro quiere tener maquinas industriales para su taller.
texts.en:
Sara, 45 years old, has a tailoring and sewing shop in her house.  She lives in an urban area called Suburbio, where the majority of the people are informal merchants.

She began to enjoy sewing at 18 years old, when her father gave her a sewing machine.  When she had her children, she began to offer her services as a seamstress, and little by little, with effort, she was able to gain a stable clientele and work from her home.  Currently she has a space in her house where she has a small sewing shop and some sewing machines that she has been able to buy during these years.

In order to move forward with her business, she wants to use the loan to buy cement, blocks, and sand to renovate her home and put her sewing shop in a better location.  In the future, she wants to have industrial machines for her shop.

loans.use: Cement, blocks

loans.name: Ni

texts.en:
Mr. Ni M. is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few laborers to help him provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. He has another partner in his wife, who works as a garment worker in the garment industry. This couple has been married for a few years, but have not yet had children. 

Currently, Mr. Ni M.’s house is comfortable to live in, but the hedge of his house is getting old and most of it are broken down.  Mr. Ni M. would like to request a loan to mend his broken hedge.

loans.use: To mend broken hedge around home

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the main part of 43-year-old Sen M.'s daily duty at a garment factory in Cambodia. Sen M. has been engaged in her job since 2002 and earns a fixed salary. She has a life partner in her husband who also works in the garment factory. The couple helps each other earn money to increase their standard of living to that of other familes in the Phnom Penh. 

Sen M. says that she has difficulty traveling to her work place. She and her husband always travel to work by hiring a taxi because they don't have their own vehicle. In order to solve this problem and cut costs, Sen M. is seeking a loan in the amount of $1000 to buy a used motor to provide transportation without hiring a taxi.

loans.use: To buy a used motor to provide transportation without hiring a taxi

loans.name: Tumenbayar

texts.en:
Tumenbayar is 38 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Uvurhangai province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house which was built after obtaining a loan from Xacbank. His wife operates a clothes making and repair service in a rented space to supplement the family's income. 

Tumenbayar operates an iron crafting business in his town.  From his shop inside a shipping container at the local market, he produces a variety of chimney and household iron products. He started his business in 2005 after working as a welder since 2002. He graduated from a construction institute as a welder in 1992. 

After years of operation, Tumenbayar has grown his business into a stable operation and has gained significant experience as a skilled ironsmith. Tumenbayar is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary materials and supplies for both his and his wife's businesses.

loans.use: To purchase materials and supplies

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana vive en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. Juana se dedica a la venta de leña, ella nos cuenta que a dispuesto un lugar en su domicilio para el negocio pues es donde se encuentra la mercadería, ella vende la arroba de leña a S/. 3 nuevos soles y se la puede encontrar desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 todos los días en su negocio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a la venta de leña y le va muy bien. Juana requiere el préstamo para comprar más leña. 

Juana pertenece al banco comunal “Hijas de María” de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien.
texts.en:
Juana lives in the historic city of Cusco in the Department of Cusco, Peru. She sells firewood and says that she has a place set aside in her home for her business, which is where she keeps her merchandise. Juana sells the wood for 3 PEN and can be found working at her business every day between 8am and 5pm. She has been selling firewood for several years and has done very well. Juana needs a loan to buy more firewood.

Juana belongs to the Communal Bank “Hijas de María” (Daughters of Mary), which is part of Asociación Araiwa, in Cusco, Peru. The Communal Bank is its third year of operation and all of the members have done very well.

loans.use: Purchase more firewood to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose N. lives in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has  five children, all of whom are in school. Rose has a business selling locally made gin, called "walagi".  She has been in this business for five years, and she works seven days out of every week. 

Rose has requested a loan of 1,200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more "walagi". She also generates additional income through running a small restaurant.

The main business challenges for Rose include thieves and seasonality.  Her goal is to make enough money to have a good standard of living. Rose has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: buying locally made gin, "walagi"

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es: María de Los Ángeles C. V. reside en Amoros en el departamento de La Unión. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable quien vela día y noche por el bienestar de sus dos hijas de 15 y 3 años de edad, por quienes debe trabajar muy duro por brindarles todo lo mejor. María posee una venta de ropa para hombres y mujeres, y así mismo venta de ropa interior, el negocio está ubicado en el centro de Amoros, frente a la parroquia de dicho municipio, en donde María debe dividirse entre sus clientes y el cuido de su hija menor la cual aún no se dedica a estudiar a diferencia de su hija mayor. Con todas las esperanzas de mejorar sus ganancias y poder vivir mejor junto a su familia, María solicita un préstamo a Integral, por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de ropa y de esta forma surtir el negocio con más prendas de vestir, lo que le permita crecer aún más y salir adelante junto a sus hijas.
texts.en:
María de Los Ángeles C. V. resides in Amoros in the Department of La Unión. She is a hardworking and responsible person who looks out day and night for the welfare of her two daughters, ages 15 and 3. María works very hard so that she can provide her children all the best. She has a business where she sells clothing for men and women. In addition, she sells undergarments. Her business is located in central Amoros in front of the local church. María divides her time between attending to her customers and taking care of her youngest daughter who is not yet in school, unlike her firstborn.

With every hope of improving her income and having a better life for her family, María is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral so that she can buy a large quantity of clothing in order to restock her business with more garments. This will allow her to grow even more and move forward with her daughters.

loans.use: Purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Mr. Nelson Q. is from the village of Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. He is 50 years old, married, blessed with one child who is now school-aged. To make a living, he is presently engaged in ministerial work as a church pastor. He’s been engaged in this kind of ministerial work for 15 years already. He’s receiving an average love gift from the congregation in amount of not less than Php 10,000 a month for his ministerial activity. 

In July 2009, Nelson joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation.  As an active member of Paglaum MPC under the Regular Loan Program, Nelson has successfully repaid a loan amount of Php 10,000. He is now requesting a loan of Php 15,000 as his 3rd loan which will be used for traveling expenses for his church conference in Manila. He also joined Paglaum MPC because of the other services offered, especially savings and insurance.

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for traveling expenses for their church conference in Manila.

loans.name: Jeanelyn

texts.en:
Jeanelyn A., 39, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Roel A., a businessman, the couple is blessed with four children. Jeanelyn makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.
Jeanelyn has operated a variety store for four years now. In the Philippines, a variety store is a place to go to buy 5-PHP worth of cooking oil, a sachet of shampoo or an egg. What Jeanelyn basically does is purchase these items at wholesale prices and retails them with minimum mark-up. She finds the store easy to manage since it is located adjacent to her house. Monthly, she earns an estimated net income of around 10,000 PHP.
Now with your help, she would like to apply for a loan of 8,000 PHP. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding business by buying products to replenish her inventory. Jeanelyn expects an increase in earnings through the use of this loan. She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can have a good and comfortable life with her family. She also prays for good health and that she will be able to send her children all the way through college. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her store

loans.name: Emercinda

texts.es: Emercinda, de 46 años, es una mujer luchadora; pues cuidó sola de sus 2 hijos: Ronal y Franklin con los que vive en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Casacoto. La razón del trabajo arduo que realiza, son sus hijos. Pues ellos efectúan estudios universitarios en la capital del país, donde tiene que mandar una pensión mensual para sus gastos. Todo esto la motiva para continuar su labor diaria en la agricultura, donde siembra desde hace 20 años papa, arveja y maíz, los cuales desde las primera horas del día comienza a cuidar con mucho esmero, vendiendo sus cosechas integras al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde le pagan un buen precio. Paralelo a su actividad diaria, cuida de animales menores como: cerdos, carneros y cuyes, los cuales después de ensebarlos los comercializa a los carniceros que llegan a su casa, obteniendo así mejores ganancias. Para el futuro desea continuar con la siembra, pero en mayores cantidades y de buena calidad. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Sembradoras de Casacoto”, y este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP, donde aprende cada día a salir adelante para el bienestar de los suyos. Emercinda, tiene sembrado avena en sus terrenos agrícolas, por ello con el dinero que solicita comprará 5 toros medianos, para hacerlos crecer, engordarlos con avena y después venderlos a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Emercinda is 46 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who cares for her two children, Ronal and Franklin, on her own.  She lives in her own home which is located in the village of Casacoto.

Emercinda's children are the reason for all her hard work.  They are studying at university in the country's capital city and she has to send them a monthly allowance to cover their expenses.  This motivates her to continue with her daily work farming.  Emercinda has been growing potatoes, peas and corn for 20 years.  She starts caring for her crops from the first hours of the day.  She sells her harvests at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma where they pay her a good price. 

Alongside her daily business farming, Emercinda also raises animals such as pigs, rams and guinea pigs which she feeds up and then sells to butchers who visit her home.  This makes her better profits.  In the future, she would like to continue growing crops but she would like to grow them in larger quantities and would like them to be better quality.

Emercinda is a member of the "Sembradoras de Casacoto" (Casacoto Growers) community bank and this is her third loan from MFP.  Through her community bank, she learns every day to get ahead for the benefit of her family.  Emercinda has sown oats on her land and she will use the loan she has requested to buy 5 medium-sized bulls to grow and fatten with oats, and then sell at a higher price.

loans.use: to buy 5 bulls

loans.name: Rosa Nelida

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 4 hijos. Cuenta con casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Éten a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Se dedica a la confección de  gorros y venta de artículos varios, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 15 años y por la antigüedad conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona que le ayuda y la respalda en las actividades que emprende. Con los ingresos que obtiene logra cubrir sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Rosa desea adquirir más mercadería para así aumentar su stock y poder venderlo, de esta manera poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente adquirir un préstamo de 900 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa. Para este rubro no hay mayor competencia en la zona ya que el titular cuenta con clientela ya establecida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 37, single, and has 4 children. She has her own home, located in the Eten district, half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She makes hats and sells various articles. She has been doing this for 15 years, and knows the job very well. She has an established customer base in the region, which supports her in her activities. With her income, she is able to cover her personal costs and those of her family.

Rosa wants to acquire more merchandise in order to increase her stock to sell. This way she will be able to improve her quality of life and that of her family. For this reason she has decided to take out a loan of 900 soles from Edpyme Alternativa. There is no one better than her in her line of work in the area, and she already has an established customer base.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Incapability is an obstacle to optimum performance. That is why Zenaida works hard to make sure she doesn't get behind because of the lack of ability to perform well--be it in business or in her family life. At 60, she is a persevering micro entrepreneur, a loving life partner and mother, and a dedicated community partner in CCT*. She co-heads a family with Salvador. They reside in General Mariano Alvarez (GMA), Cavite, south of Manila.

Zenaida currently runs her own sari-sari (variety) store. Aside from handpicking brands and products that suit the tastes of her customers, Zenaida also sells fresh fish for her fellow community members. She makes sure she delivers only the best food for them. Her space is located in the community market in GMA. Also, she rents out an apartment to workers who choose to live independently. Monthly she is able to earn PHP 11,900.

To help her continue operation of her business, she has applied for a loan of PHP 17,000. This she will use to purchase more stocks of products like canned goods and soft drinks, sugar and coffee and liters of cooking oil. She also intends to make fresh fish available for her customers on a regular basis. According to Zenaida, this loan will help her earn more and thus save more for the schooling of her children.

Zenaida admits that there are times when the sales are so low she doesn't seem to make any profit at all. She also confesses that it's hard to do business alone since her husband had a stroke. But Zenaida does not want any incapability to hinder her from receiving God's best for her. She aims to make up for what is lost and make her store grow even more. Aside from building her own apartment, she also hopes to have her own vehicle for delivery, which the family can also use to attend activities at church. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more fresh fish for selling and also additional grocery items for her variety store.

loans.name: Tserendorj

texts.en:
Tserendorj, 39, is a skillful craftsman. He lives with his daughter and wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family lives in a ger, a traditional Mongolian felt tent, in his brother’s yard. His daughter attends primary school and his wife works at a local kindergarten.

When he first began his business in 2000, Tserendorj made golden and silver jewelry at home. In 2008, he and his brother built his own small workshop with his business earnings. In the past eleven years, he has gained a lot of experience and today he makes various fine works of arts on order.  He was thus able to buy a used car with his business earnings a few months ago.   

Tserendorj is applying for a loan of 2,300,000 MNT to buy silver to make a custom saddle with silver jewelry to sell to his customer. His plan for 2011 is to build his own small house with his business earnings.

loans.use: buy silver needed to make a custom saddle

loans.name: Yuly Karina

texts.es: Yuly es socia del Banco Comunal Amaqella, tiene 29 años, conviviente, tiene 2 hijos. Yuly se dedica a la venta de repuestos por pedidos. Yuly y su pareja tienen una mecánica de carros es especialista en turbo y Yuly vende repuestos. Ingreso a FINCA Perú, por la invitación de una socia, le gusta por la facilidad de los créditos y les dan la oportunidad de trabajar, se puede ahorrar. Su sueño es poder abrir una tienda de repuestos.
texts.en:
Yuly is a member of the Amaqella community bank.  She is 29 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children.  Yuly's business is selling spare parts to order.  Yuly and her partner have a car maintenance business.  They are specialists in turbo-charged cars.  Yuly sells spare parts.

Yuly joined FINCA Peru through an invitation from an existing member.  She likes it because of the ease of obtaining loans, the fact that they are given an opportunity to work and the fact that they can save.  Yuly's dream is to open a store where she can sell spare parts.

loans.use: to buy vehicle parts

loans.name: Konoweka Zibba Womens Group

texts.en:
39-year-old Hadijah's confidence has always been sky high. The level-headed mother of five says the fact that she believes in her own worth means she does almost everything with gusto and optimism. The last 15 years' success in her retail business can bear testimony to that. 

This business which was begun with savings from her farming business grew by leaps and bounds. This growth was not only as a result of the afore-mentioned factors but also her diligence and persistence in the face of adversity. At her retail outlet, she sells a variety of general goods such as beans, soap, maize flour, cooking oil, etc. Weekly her profits total shillings 80,000. 

Hadijah says she is requesting this loan to purchase more retail goods like soap, sugar, cooking oil, jerrycans, rice, etc. to resell.

In the group photo, Hadijah  is the first lady standing on the left in the back row. By mistake, Harriet, the lady standing next to her, also raised her hand.

loans.use: to purchase more retail goods like rice, sugar, cooking oil, etc. to resell

loans.name: Leang

texts.en:
Mrs. Leang has been in the farming business for many years. She learned this skill from her parents, since she was single till the present time. She can plant her crops at least twice per year, the rainy season and dry season. She has a life partner in her husband, who is a natural medicine maker. Her husband always combines different kinds of tree roots for natural medicines and sells them in a mobile place. 

They are blessed with two children who study in public school in the Ornlong Vegn district of Siem Reap Province. Mrs. Leang will use the loan that she requests toward purchasing more natural roots for her husband to make natural medicines for selling, so her husband’s business runs smoothly and brings more net income.

loans.use: to purchase more natural roots for her husband to make natural medicines for selling.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es:
La señora Nora es socia del banco comunal Lideres Triunfadoras del Distrito Calleria, Departamento De Ucayali, tiene 54 años de edad, es viuda y tiene cinco hijos mayores de edad.
Con su primer préstamo de Manuela Ramos compró su primera máquina de coser.
Lleva cinco años trabajando con Manuela Ramos y se dedica a la confección de vestidos a medida, cuenta con un pequeño taller instalado en su casa y dos máquinas que le ayudan a dar un buen acabado a las prendas que confecciona.
Con su nuevo préstamo de S/. 2,500.00 nuevos soles comprará: 8 cortes de tela, 5 metros de tela para toallas, 4 metros de tela para pantalón, ¼ de ciento de cierres, botones diferentes tamaños y modelos.
Solo uno de sus hijos esta a su cargo, se da tiempo para atender los quehaceres del hogar y a su hijo, solo cuando tiene mucho trabajo esta todo el día en su máquina y tiene que ir a comer a la calle para poder cumplir con sus clientes.
Para ayudar a su hijo seguirá trabajando hasta que su hijo pueda terminar una carrera.  Está muy agradecida con Manuela Ramos por darle la oportunidad de mejorar su vida y la de su hijo que en estos momentos 
tanto la necesita.
texts.en:
Nora is a member of the “Lideres Triunfadoras” (Triumphant Leaders) Communal Bank of the Calleria district in Ucayali department. She is 54 years old, a widow, and has 5 adult children.

With her 1st loan from Manuela Ramos she bought her 1st sewing machine. Nora has collaborated with Manuela Ramos for 5 years, sewing custom-made dresses. She has a small shop installed in her house and 2 machines to help her give a good finish to the items of clothing she makes.

With her new loan of 2,500 new sols, she will buy 8 bales of cloth, 5 meters of towel cloth, 4 meters of cloth for pants, ¼ of a hundred of zippers, and buttons of different sizes and models.

Only 1 of Nora's children is still under her care, and she needs time to attend to household matters and her son. Only when she has a lot of work does she spend all day at her machine and goes out into the street to eat, to manage to complete her customer's orders.

To help her son, she will continue working until he finishes his career education. Nora is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for providing this opportunity to improve her life and that of her son, which in these moments she greatly needs.

loans.use: to buy cloth and other supplies at wholesale for dressmaking.

loans.name: Dirisa

texts.en:
Dirisa is 27 years old, married, and has three children, all living in a rented house in Masindi, Uganda. Dirisa's family's goal is to build a residential house and a commercial house for business. 

He has been a motorcyclist for six years, starting as a hired driver but later buying his own motorcycle from the meager income he got. Now he has two motorcycles. His hardships include high fuel prices and competition, nonetheless he wishes to own five motorcycles in the next six years.

Dirisa intends to buy a motorcycle with this loan since the sector is very profitable.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to boost his business

loans.name: Villa Dolores F Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VILLA DOLORES F” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Santiago II, está compuesta por diez integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Ruth. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de comida, comerciante de prendas de vestir, tienda, costura de ropa, carnicería, venta de muebles, pollereria, joyería, venta de calzados.

La señora Ruth, indica que este es el primer ciclo que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de amigas para formar un grupo. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio, que viene trabajando hace dos años atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de aceite, , conservas, cerveza), que comprara de la distribuidora de la Ceja y lo comercializará en el establecimiento de su zona. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la visita ala consultorio y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
The “Villa Dolores F” communal bank will start its first cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Santiago II Center.  It has ten members led by a governing board headed by Ruth.  The communal bank members carry out a variety of businesses.  Among them we have: food sales, clothing sales, store, dressmaking, butcher shop, furniture making, chicken shop, jewelry sales and shoe sales.

Ruth indicates that this is the first time she’s worked with Pro Mujer having joined thanks to an invitation from friends to start a group.  Currently, she has a neighborhood store that she’s been running for the past two years.

The loan she’ll take out now is to increase working capital (to buy oil, canned goods, beer).  She will make her purchases at the La Ceja distributor and will sell in her local establishment.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family in whatever way she can because she’s married and has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health center visits and the training.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos de 38 años de edad vive en Barranquilla, lugar donde tiene el negocio de distribución de pollos, iniciado desde hace dos año, cuando su padre le cedió un enfriador pensado como ayudarlo para generar ingresos, Su primer paso fue hacer un estudio de mercado, y visitas de preventas en restaurantes para iniciar su aventura de negocios; con su distribuidora de pollo ha logrado ganar un mercado pues su estratégica ubicación es su mayor fortaleza. Carlos está muy entusiasmado con el crecimiento de su negocio y todo los días trabaja esmerándose por aumentar su clientela como lo ha logrado, pero su mayor desafío es que su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para responder al mercado como el planea. Esta es justamente la necesidad que resolvería con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual comprara carne, huevos, para complementar su actividad y ampliar su cobertura de productos que sus clientes sienten como su mayor necesidad. Su sueño es lograr ampliar su negocio y mantenerlo surtido permanentemente con productos cárnicos variados, mientras esto ocurre, Carlos trabaja incansablemente manejando una rápida rotación de cuentas por cobrar y de sus inventarios con las que logra invertir pero no en las cantidades en las cuales el aspira.
texts.en:
Carlos is 38 and lives in Barranquilla, where he has a chicken distribution business. He started the business two years ago, when his father let him have a freezer as a way of helping him generate income. His first step was to study the market, and make pre-sales visits to restaurants in order to start his business venture. He has managed to secure a market for his chickens, as his strategic location is his greatest strength.  

Carlos is very enthusiastic about the growth of his business. He works every day, doing his best to increase his clientele; and he has managed to do so. His greatest challenge is that his working capital is insufficient to meet his projected market demand. 

This is precisely the need he would resolve with his credikiva loan, his first with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use it to buy meat and eggs, to supplement his business, and have a greater range of products to meet his customers' greatest needs. 

His dream is to succeed in expanding his business, and keep it stocked at all times with a variety of meat products. While this is happening, he works tirelessly managing a rapid turnover of accounts receivable and of his stock, which he is managing to invest in, though not in the quantities he aims to.

loans.use: To buy meat and eggs to supplement his business.

loans.name: Mohamed C.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured above are a group of teachers from the eastern city of Koidu/Kono. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org based in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone to apply for a loan of 7,800,000 SLL. With the help of this loan, they will be able to solve their immediate financial needs and then gradually repay the loan, using their monthly salaries. These teachers are among the lucky few to be among the first set of applicants to receive a loan from SMT/Kiva in Koidu city. 

Their leader is Mohamed. Born in Kono, the 55-year-old is married and has five children – one in primary school and four in secondary school. Mohamed has been a professional teacher for 36 years now. He has applied for this loan in order to complete the construction of a house he is building for his family. He will use the loan to buy house building materials like iron corrugate zincs, pay workers, etc.

loans.use: to buy house building materials and to pay workers

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman with seven children; five attend school, while two are still too young for school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family.

For the past five years, Riziki has been selling charcoal and firewood to local residents in her area. She faces a major challenge of price fluctuations in her business. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers’ needs in the future.

With this 100,000 Kenyan shilling loan, she wants to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood and charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Danelia del Carmen tiene la edad de 47 años y posee su negocio de elaboración de bellas hamacas. Cabe señalar que con la ayuda de sus trabajadores y familia ha echado a andar su negocio, y también con la ayuda de Ceprodel por medio de los créditos.

Nuevamente se acerca para solicitar un crédito y comprar la materia prima como manila y madera para las hamacas para así cubrir los pedidos que tiene.

Esto le ayudará a seguir mejorando e incrementar más su actividad económica, de igual manera le ayudará a dar mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Danelia del Carmen is 47 years old and owns a manufacturing business making beautiful hammocks. It is worth noting that she started her business with the help of her workers and family, and also with CEPRODEL's help through loans.

She is requesting a loan again to buy raw materials such as twine and wood for hammocks to fulfill her orders.

This will help her to keep improving and increasing her economic activity and to make her family more comfortable.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as twine and wood for hammocks.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal Suni,tiene 55 años y 2 hijos, es socia de FINCA Peru desde hace 15 años.
Teresa tiene una tienda de abarrotes y vende frutas en el mercado, agradece la facilidad de los préstamos gracias a eso pudo terminar de construir su casa, aumentar su negocio, recuerda que antes vendía fruta y verdura en una esquina del mercado, las capacitaciones le ayudan a poder mejorar su negocio y su vida familiar. Con este préstamo que esta solicitando lo invertirá en la compra de azúcar y fruta.
texts.en: Teresa, 55, is a member of the “Suni” communal bank.  She has two children.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for 15 years.  Teresa has a grocery store and sells fruit in the market.  She appreciates the ease of the loans. Thanks to them she was able to finish building her house and increase business.
