She remembers that she used to sell fruit and vegetables in one of the corners of the market.  The training helped her improve the business and her personal life.  With this loan she’s requesting she will buy sugar and fruit.

loans.use: to buy sugar and fruit.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Eulalia es socia del Banco Comunal “Santa Rosa de Lima” del distrito Juli, provincia Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene  32  años de edad, estado civil casada con tres hijos, con estudios de educación secundaria.

La señora trabaja con Movimiento Manuela Ramos más de once años, su primer préstamo fue por la suma de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio venta de artículos artesanales como manta, bordados en bayeta, venta de golosinas.

Solicitará un nuevo préstamo por la suma de S/. 1200.00 nuevo soles, comprará golosinas, gaseosas, galletas, chocolates, etc, para venderlos en su kiosco escolar, trabaja sola en su negocio, su esposo trabaja de chofer.

Su sueño de la señora es tener una empresa de carros para servicio y tener su tienda grande de golosinas, le gusta del Banco Comunal las reuniones, la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Eulalia, 32, is a member of the Santa Rosa de Lima community bank in Juli, a district of the Peruvian "departamento" of Puno.  She is married and has three children, all in school.

Eulalia has worked with Movimiento Manuela Ramos for more than eleven years.  She used her first loan, for S/.300.00 new soles, to support her retail business.  She sells traditional crafts, e.g., bed coverings and embroidered cloth, as well as food snacks.  

Eulalia is applying for a S/.1200 new soles loan that she will use to buy snacks, soft drinks, cookies, chocolates, etc. for the kiosk business she operates at a local school.  She operates the business by herself.  Her husband is a cab driver.

She wants to start a new business servicing ["carros"--could be cars or wheeled carts] and expand her snacks business.  What she most likes about the community bank are the meetings.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her kiosk business.

loans.name: Khatuna

texts.en:
Khatuna is from the village Supsa, Guria Region, West Georgia. She is 37 years old, married, and lives with her family: husband Avtandil, their 20 year old daughter, and parents in law. Avtandil is musician. He works in a local restaurant. All other family members are involved in the family agricultural business. 

They own a tangerine garden on their family owned plot with total area of 0.15 hectare. They sell harvested tangerines at the local market. Also the family has 4 milk cows and 4 pigs. Khatuna produces dairy products and sells them at the local market as well. Also the family sells piglets locally. Along with the abovementioned they sell nuts, harvested from family owned 400 nut trees. Total average monthly income of the family, including the pensions of Khatuna’s parents in law, is 800 Laris. 

Khatuna requested credit for the development of their family business. In particular, she will use the credit for enclosing the nut garden and renovation of the pig-house. Enclosing of the nut trees is very important, in order to protect the harvest from stealing. The pig house needs renovation in order to create needed conditions for domestic animals for the winter months. Also, a small part of the credit will be used for financing harvesting of maize. All above listed activities will strengthen the business of the family and contribute to increasing their profitability. It will be positively reflected on family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for enclosing the nut garden, pig-house renovation, and harvesting of maize

loans.name: Diara

texts.fr:
DIARA AGE DE 46 ANS HABITE DANS UN DEPARTEMENT DE LA REGION DU SUD. MARIEE AVEC 9 ENFANTS.5 ENFANTS SONT A L'ECOLE AINE FAIT LE BAC 2em FAIT LE SECONDE LE 3em FAIT BFEM ,LES 2AUTRES FONT L'ECOLE PRIMAIRE.
DIARA FAIT SES ACHAT A KAFFOUTINE ZONE POISSONNEUSE DE LA LOCALITE POUR REVENDRE DANS LE MARCHE LOCAL.DEPUIS 8 ANS ELLE TRAVAIL DANS CE DOMAINE POUR ASSURER SES DEPENSES ET LES FRAIS SCOLAIRE DES ENFANTS CAR SON MARI NE TRAVAIL PAS.DIARA A UN TERRAIN DONT ELLE VEUT CONSTRUIRE DANS LE FUTURE AVEC SON BENEFICE CAR CE COMMERCE MARCHE TRES BIEN AVEC ELLE.
texts.en:
Diara is 46 years old and lives in a department from the Southern region. She is married with nine children, of whom five attend school:
[list]
[li]The eldest is preparing for the 'bac' (or baccalauréat, the final certification process giving access to schools of higher learning);[/li]
[li]the second child is in the 'Seconde' (first of the three high school years, the following years being the 'Première' and the 'Terminale');[/li]
[li]the third child is preparing for the BFEM (completion of middle school);[/li]
[li]and the other two are still in grade school.[/li][/list]

Diara resupplies in Kaffoutine (a nearby locality where fish are abundant), and resells in her local market. She has been working at this occupation for the past eight years to manage her expenses and the children's tuition fees, as her husband is out of work.

Diara owns a plot of land where she plans to use her profits in future construction work, because her business activity suits her and is doing well.

loans.use: Buy fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for a tortilla making business.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a 45-year-old married woman with three children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Yei, South Sudan for four years.

Charity is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. In the future, she plans to use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma, 47 years old, is married and has two children. She lives in Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Gemma has been a teacher for 1 year, earning PHP 8,000 monthly. Gemma is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to pay for house renovations. In 2011, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation. In the future, Gemma hopes to financially support immediate members of her family and to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to pay for house renovations

loans.name: Jeissell Yumar

texts.es:
Jeisell, una joven de 26 años quien es originaria del departamento de Jinotega se vino a vivir a Granada hace dos años en busca de un futuro mejor, ella es madre soltera tiene un hijo de 4 años de edad, es comerciante se dedica a la venta de  leña desde hace 4 años , estudia para ser maestra los días sábados  lleva segundo año de su carrera. Ella inicio con este negocio por medio de su padre quien era el que se dedicaba a la venta de leña pero debido a su avanzada edad ya no podía seguir entonces comenzó hacerse cargo del negocio ella , esta actividad le ha sido de mucha ayuda pues de ahí saca dinero para sus estudios ya que quiere en un futuro dedicarse a dar clases para cambiar de estilo de vida y darle un futuro mejor a su hijos.
Ella realizo el crédito para comprar leña. Producto que distribuye en la as pulperías de manera ambulante o en los hogares cercanos a su vecindario. A ella le gustaría comprar un camión en el que se pueda movilizar para cubrir más clientes y poder vender mas. Por lo pronto quiere logra graduarse de maestra y salir adelante con su negocio y familia
texts.en:
Jeisell is a young woman of 26 from Jinotega department, who came to live in Granada two years ago, in search of a better future. She is a single mother, and has a four year-old son. She has had a small business selling firewood for four years. 

She is studying to be a teacher on Saturdays, and is in the second year of her program.

She began this business through her father, who was the one who sold firewood. But due to his advanced age, he wasn't able to continue, so she began to take charge of the business.

This activity has been a big help, since that's where she gets money for her studies. Also, in the future she wants to work giving classes, in order to change her way of life, and provide her children with a better future.

She is taking out the loan in order to buy firewood. She distributes this product to small general stores as a street vendor, or to homes near her neighborhood. She would like to buy a truck, which would enable to get around in order to serve more customers, and sell more.

In the meantime, she wants to succeed in graduating as a teacher, and more forward with her business and family.

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Franklin Alcides

texts.es: El cliente es de la ciudad de Libertad.  Ha estudiado para llegar a ser electricista profesional y posteriormente ha instalado su propio negocio.  Trabaja solo en su casa, donde ha adecuado su pequeño taller.  Es casado y su esposa se dedica a la venta de cosméticos.  Tiene 3 hijos de 10, 4 y 9 años de edad y estudian en la escuela fiscal de su zona.  Desea en un futuro cercano, poder ampliar su negocio e para poder atender a más personas.  Por el momento desea invertir el dinero del préstamo en la compra de materiales y repuestos eléctricos necesarios para su labor.

loans.use: Compra de materiales eléctricos

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.fr:
Joceline a 43 ans. Elle habite dans une zone rurale et est mariée à un gardien. Le couple a 2 enfants. Dont l’ainé est le seul à étudier. 
Elle est dans la culture de tomate depuis juin 2014, Elle cultivait sur une petite surface de champs de 1 are. Le manque d’argent lui a été un blocage car elle en avait besoin pour pouvoir s’acheter de l’engrais et payer les laboureurs. Donc, le prêt servira à acheter des semences de tomate, de l’engrais de zébu, de l’engrais de volailles, de l’engrais faites à base d’urée, de l’engrais faite d’azote-potatium-(NPK), et aussi pour rémunérer les travailleurs pour leur main-d’œuvre.
Son objectif est de pouvoir cultiver sur des champs un peu plus vaste c'est à dire environ 3 ares, c'est à dire étendre et développer l'activité.

loans.use: acheter des sémences de tomates, des engrais bio et chimiques, et payer les salaires des laboureurs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Yiai would like to buy 3 steers for her project

loans.name: Petrona De Jesus

texts.en:
Choluteca is located in the southern part of Honduras, the hottest region of the country. So I have dedicated myself to selling sweetened cold drinks made from all kinds of fruits. The kids especially enjoy the chocolate milk that I sell. I started my business two years ago. It keeps me quite busy, but helps me to provide for my family. The income is getting better, and aside from that, I enjoy serving my clients, espeically the kids.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Choluteca esta ubicada en la parte sur de Honduras, y esta zona es la mas caliente del pais, por eso me dedico a vender charamuscas de toda clase de frutas, a los niños les gustas especialmente las de coco con leche. Mi negocio lo inicie hace dos años, aunque es bastante trabajoso pero me ayuda a sostener a mi familia, los ingresos son buenos y aparte de eso me gusta atender a mis clientes especialmente a los niños.

loans.use: Buy fruit, sugar, water, bags.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: A dedicated client of LAPO who specializes in the sale of palm cannel to her community, Rosemary O. hails from Uromi in Edo State, Nigeria. She wishes that the above amount specified come to her for business expansion.

loans.use: To buy more palm cannel for sale

loans.name: Filomena

texts.es:
Filomena C. is a part of the Fe y Alegria Association of Pro Mujer. She is married with 5 children. She is a manufacturer of skirts (women's dresses), and sells them at the 16th of July and Tiawanacu fairs in the city of El Alto. She started helping her mother, from whom she learned this trade, at a young age. Seven years ago, she solicited her first loan, with which she increased her capital to start her own business. Currently, Filomena desires to open her own skirt stand in the Garita de Lima zone in the city of La Paz. This would help her improve her own way of life, especially since she currently lives with her 5 children and her husband in her grandfather's house.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Filomena C. pertenece a la Asociación Fe y Alegría de Pro Mujer, casada y con 5 hijos se dedica a la confección artesanal de polleras (vestidos de chola) y deambula por las ferias 16 de Julio y Tiawanacu de la ciudad de El Alto. Comenzó muy joven, ayudando a su madre, de quien aprendió todo el arte de la confección. Hace 7 años solicitó su primer crédito, con el cual incrementó su capital para iniciar ella su propio negocio. En la actualidad, Filomena quiere abrir su propia tienda de venta de polleras en la zona Garita de Lima de la ciudad de La Paz para de esta forma poder mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que en la actualidad ella vive con sus 5 hijos y su esposo en casa de su abuelo.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of a stand/booth in the Garita de Lima zone in the city of La Paz

loans.name: Siti Aminah

texts.id:
With such tough economy situation, Siti had to ask her mum to her raise one of child, but this doesn't mean Siti is not working, but rather her income from her food stall is not sufficient enough. They need to work hard to finance their child's education and as well pay for their business's expenses. However with the help from DInari, they manage to get a profit of 50.000 rupiah a day with the help of her husband who is also doing batik.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Keadaan ekonomi yang sulit membuat ibu dari dua orang anak ini harus rela menitipkan salah satu anaknya pada neneknya, bukan berarti Siti Aminah tidak bekerja, penghasilan dari usahanya membuka warung nasi belum mampu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Usaha terus dilakukan dengan bekerja keras bersama sang suami untuk bisa menyekolahkan anaknya dan membayar kontrak rumah yang mereka tempati. Usaha mereka semakin berkembang ketika mereka mendapat pinjaman modal dari yayasan DINARI, keuntungan yang didapat adalah 50.000 rupiah perhari yang didukung oleh suami yang mempunyai usaha batik.

loans.use: Membeli bahan-bahan makanan - Stocking up food

loans.name: Fumilayo

texts.en: Fumilayo O. lives in Lagos,is 50 years old, and a mother of five. She sells food and other items such as plantains and yam flour. LAPO has lifted her above poverty level by strengthening Fumilayo financially. She has been in business since 1987 and needs a loan of $400 to buy more food and elubo to help increase sales.

loans.use: To buy more Foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Olevia

texts.en: Olevia is one of the new members of the programme. Olevia prefers to run her popcorn business because her house is next to the school compound and she thinks this is a good location to earn money for her and her family. She is young and very active and she is planning to sell her goods five days a week and earn $80 a day. Her husband is a bus driver and he will help her with the payments in times of bad weather and school breaks.

loans.use: To buy plastic bags, a kerosene oven and other supplies for her popcorn business.

loans.name: Lailah

texts.en: Lailah, 40, is a mother of 7 children. Her husband, R., has been unemployed for a long time, so she has to earn income for the family by herself. She sells small potatoes, earning USD4 a day. She requests a loan of USD 75 to expand her business. As a member of MBK she agrees to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike O., 47-years-old, is married with five children.  She hails from Mushin in Lagos State. Mrs. O. has been in business since 1985, selling kerosene, drinks and food products. She is requesting a loan of $450 to purchase additional inventory for her store.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene, drinks and food products for resale

loans.name: Feliza

texts.es:
Mrs. Felisa is a hardworking person, has worked with loans in solidarity groups, and currently needs an individual loan. Her guaranty is her husband, who works elaborating artisanal hats. They are humble people of middle low class with a tremendous desire to work. They have an impeccable loan history. They live in a popular zone in El Alto, and she sells books, fables, and novels in a famous fair which is attended by people of little resources. With this income she helps her husband to support their 5 children.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Felisa es una persona trabajadora, trabajo con crédito en grupos solidarios, actualmente necesita un credito individual. La garantia es la de su esposo el cual elabora sombreros artesanales, son personas humildes de clase media baja y con muchas ganas de trabajar presentan un historial crediticio impecable, viven en una zona popular de El Alto y vende libros, fabulas y novelas en una famosa feria donde acude gente de escasos recursos, con este ingreso ella ayuda a su esposo para sacar adelante a sus 5 hijos.

loans.use: Investing in books for the back-to-school season (Invertira por temporada de comienzo de clases en libros)

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mrs. Channa V. and her husband married in 1987. They have six children; three sons and three daughters. One of their children is a factory worker. The other three children are in school and the two youngest stay at home. The family is a bout seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Channa and her husband have been selling groceries for six years. They bought grocery items from the market in Phnom Penh for resale at the front of their house.

Channa is requesting a loan in the amount of $700 to purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en: Yeabu runs a local restaurant in the town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  She re-started her business seven years ago after the civil war, but at a very small scale. She sells rice, with cassava and potato leaves, peanut soup and fish.   With her previous loan from SMT, she purchased new plates, cups and cooking pots but continue purchasing the ingredients in retail, which is very expensive.  Yeabu would like to expand her business to earn better income.  She is therefore requesting a loan of $250 to purchase the ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients (rice, peanuts, beans, spices etc.)

loans.name: Abla Tina

texts.fr:
Mademoiselle Abla Tina A. was born on December 31, 1969 in Zanguéra in the Golfe prefecture. She is single with five people in her care. She learned to sew in 1987 and set up an atelier called “Atelier Dieu Donné” in the residential district of Agoè. She has six dressmaking apprentices who are learning to sew in her atelier. Mademoiselle A. used her first loan to buy a sewing machine.

Taking into account the number of apprentices she has, Mademoiselle A. is requesting this loan to buy another new sewing machine and 22 lengths of cotton fabric (pagne) of medium quality.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva volunteer.

Mademoiselle A. Abla Tina est née le 31 décembre 1969 à Zanguéra dans la préfecture de Golfe. Elle est célibataire avec 5 personnes à charge. Depuis 1987, elle a appris la couture et a crée son atelier dénommé « Atelier Dieu Donné » dans son quartier de résidence Agoè. Elle a 6 apprenties couturières qui apprennent la couture chez elle. Le premier crédit qu’elle avait obtenu lui a permis d’acquérir une machine à coudre.

Compte tenu de l’effectif de ses apprenties, elle sollicite ce crédit pour acquérir encore une nouvelle machine à coudre et 22 pièces de pagnes de qualité intermédiaires.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine and 22 lengths of cotton fabric (pagne)

loans.name: Khieu Thi

texts.vi:
Mrs. P. is 61 years old. When she joined the Fund in 1998, her family’s financial conditions encountered many difficulties. Her husband had died early, when all children were still young and there was not enough capital to make a living. After joining the Fund, she borrowed money to buy and resell scrap. Over her 10 years of participation to the Fund, she managed to raise all the children thanks to her assiduous work and thriftiness. The 3 eldest children are now grown up and her family’s economy has improved significantly. The children currently work in the family’s carpentry business. For the next round, she would like to borrow 10.000.000 đ for the children to purchase a new sawing machine, and use the remainder of the loan to buy scrap. The average income is 3.000.000đ per month.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh, Kiva volunteer

Chị P. năm nay 61 tuổi.Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1998. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị gặp rất nhiều khó khăn do chồng chị không may mất sớn, các con còn nhỏ, thiếu vốn làm ăn. Sau khi tham gia vào quỹ tình thương được vay vốn chị đã sử dụng vốn để đi thu mua phế liệu. Đến nay qua 10 năm sửd dụng vốn, nhờ chăm chỉ và tiết kiệm chị đã nuôi được các con khôn lớn, cả 3 người con của chị đến nay đều đã trưởng thành, kinh tế gia đình chị đã dần ổn định hơn. Các con của chị hiện đang làm nghề thợ mộc tại gia đình. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 10.000.000 đ để đầu tư cho các con mua một chiếc máy cưa mới phục vụ cho nghề mộc, số tiền còn lại chị sẽ sử dụng để đi thu mua phế liệu. Thu nhập bình quân 3.000.000đ/ tháng

loans.use: Purchase a new sawing machine

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Tabitha is a thirty-six-year-old married woman with three children between the ages of five and fourteen. She lives in Dar es Salaam, the commercial capital of Tanzania, where she opened a clothing store called Tabby Designs in 2006. She runs the store with one employee and the assistance of her children, all of whom are also enrolled in school. Tabitha sells traditional African cloth (called boutque), unique handcrafted accessories, and handicrafts to locals and tourists. The outfit you see Tabitha wearing in this picture is one she has made herself from boutque cloth! She has been making a monthly profit of approximately 500 USD from her store that she uses to supplement her husband's income and contribute to the family. Tabitha is requesting a first-time loan of 450 USD to purchase cloth and dyes to customize the traditional clothing that she sells. Tabitha is an exceptionally hard worker who spends eleven hours per day at her store for six days a week. In the future, with increased profits earned as a result of anticipated increased sales of her unique goods, Tabitha hopes to improve the quantity and range of products offered at her store.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her clothing business

loans.name: Zahira's Tusaidiane Group

texts.en:
Zahira is 24 years old. She is married with 1 child, 2 years old. She has owned and run her own shop and restaurant since 2003. Everyday she works from 6am to 8pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Zahira is now looking for a loan to expand her business by increasing her current stock. She will share this loan with her subgroup member Asha, who also has a business selling bites (snacks).

loans.use: To expand her business by increasing her current stock.

loans.name: Merci Seigneur Group

texts.en:
"Merci Seigneur" is a group of very excited people, all feeling that things are about to change in their lives. The members of this group live in extreme poverty and are hoping to receive a loan to try to better their lives. Marie P., a very dedicated mother of one child, is the representative of this group, chosen for her personality and hard work. Her plan is to use her loan to start a small business selling flowers, hoping to someday expand it into a flourishing business. Her dream is to have a nice clean house for her family and maybe even a car.

On behalf of Marie, the group, and Esperanza International---- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: To become a flower vendor

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Jamila Q. is a 44-year-old married woman with 2 sons. Jamila sells cosmetics, such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, and perfumes. She started her business in 2002. The idea of starting her own business came to her when she realized that there is unemployment everywhere and no other way to feed her family. Jamila is not alone in her business.Her husband helps her by purchasing and bringing goods from other cities. 

Now Jamila would like to expand her business and purchase more goods to sell. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of $1200. Jamila would like to count on you for your help.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda P., 63 years old and the mother of two children who were already married, is from Bunawan Agusan del Sur and farms a family-owned rice field. She bought a small parcel of land for her family as a source of living. Until now she has never stopped tilling the land to have enough food to share. Despite her age, Erlinda and her husband still manage the farm. Together, they have worked industriously and are happy to cultivate the land under the heat of the sun for a good yield.

She is requesting a loan of Php 7,000 to purchase 4 sacks of fertilizer to be used this planting season. She also aspires to purchase farm implements, which she can use when tilling the land. “I am happy about being part of CEV. I meet other people who really have dreams like me,” she said. Now, Erlinda enjoys receiving credit assistance, training as well as insurance coverage that CEV offers to its clients.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr:
Alidé means “another path always exists for the most poor” in Fon, the principal tribal language of Cotonou, Benin. Benin is a small country in West Africa sandwiched between Togo and Nigeria that has been a multiparty democracy since 1991. GDP per capita stands at $749 (2007 est.) and poverty is endemic to the capital city of Cotonou. Alidé operates seven different locations in and around Cotonou to ensure that those who need help can help themselves through small loans.
 



Dame Y. Jeanne est née le 20 mars 1970, marieé et  mére de deux enfants tous scolarisés, elle vend des poissons frais. Tot  les matins dame Jeanne Y. va à la poissonnerie du carrefour le belier pour s'approvisonner ou chez les pecheurs  puis passe à la vente ambulante de ses produits. Sa clientèle devenant de plus en plus importante, elle a sollicité un pret  pour couvrir toutes les demandes de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Mrs. Jeanne Y. was born March 20, 1970. She is married, the mother of two children who attend school and she is a seller of fresh fish. Every morning Mrs.Y. travels to the fish market at Carefour le Belier to purchase her stock from fishermen and then resell her products, travelling door to door. Her clientele has increased and she is requesting this loan to meet all the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies of fish for resale

loans.name: Ramzana M. Rasheed Group

texts.en:
My name is Ramzana and I am a 45-year-old married woman. I have lived in Arifwala, Pakistan for 21 years. I am married to M. R., and he has run a grocery shop near our community for the past 5 years. I am a mother of four children: two sons and two daughters. None of the children go to school. 

Ramzana baji belongs to a family of farmers, so she knows how to take care of animals. Presently, she has one buffalo and, from her, she collects milk and sells in the milk shop. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.  

She is a the leader of a group of women in her locality. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to resell. Kaniz baji wants a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil and spices for her food business. Bashiran baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). Zainab baji wants a loan to rent land on contract to grow vegetables to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: 'Baji,' which means 'older sister,' is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her grocery shop

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda C. is 42 years old and married to Romeo, a farmer by day and a fisherman by night. The couple has four children: Rommel – 21 years old, high school graduate; Jayson – 17 years old, high school student; Rochel – 12 years old, grade six, and Roy – 7 years old, grade one. Imelda and her husband are doing their best in order to meet the needs of their family and send their children to school. They are living in Barangay Pilitan, Tumauini, Isabela where farming is one of the major sources of income for most of the residents, aside from fishing.

Imelda used to work as a hired farm laborer in their village. They are doing their best in providing a better life for their children, so they will not have to experience what their parents have been through. Because of the struggles they had, Imelda was motivated to maintain her hog-raising business for them to have an alternative source of income. At present, she is seeking financial assistance amounting to PHP 3,000 that she will use to buy feed supplies and hopefully expand the business. The financial assistance would be a great opportunity for Imelda to improve their living conditions. Sometimes, she still works as a farm laborer when not fully occupied in her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed supplies for their pigs

loans.name: Rose Atieno

texts.en: Rose Atieno O. was born in Nairobi, but she has lived and worked in Kisumu, Kenya as a hairdresser since 2001. She admits that she likes Nairobi more, but her husband is from Kisumu. She has two children, Mike and Stephanie, and lives with her husband who also works as a businessman. Her customers are all women and she enjoys working on them.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for hair

loans.name: Lidia Mercedes

texts.en:
Lidia Mercedes is a happily married, 43-year old micro-business entrepreneur. She has two children, ages ten and twenty, both of whom are in various stages of education. They live at home with the family.

Lidia operates a small store that sells clothing products of all types and sizes, specializing in shoe products as well. She would like to diversify her inventory of products, and for this primary reason, Lidia seeks a loan from Fundación León 2000 and the network of Kiva lenders.

She has received loans from Fundación León in the past, and each has helped her maintain some semblance of financial security and increase the store’s monthly revenue. One day, Lidia would like to purchase her own business space, as the current one is being shared with her mother, who operates a separate business.

Lidia Mercedes would like to thank all Kiva lenders for their support in helping her improve her life through micro-business development and poverty alleviation.

loans.use: Buy more clothing products to sell.

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: Yao A. est un cordonnier à Lomé. Agé de 38 ans, il est marié et père d’un enfant. Yao exerce ce métier depuis 3 ans et ses œuvres sont de haute qualité. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, Yao souhaite avec ce crédit, acheter des peaux de bêtes et des boîtes de colle pour la confection des chaussures. cette chance lui permettra d'augmenter son chiffre d'affaires et par conséquent dégager des profits pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en:
Yao A., age 38, is a shoemaker in Lomé. He's married and the father of one child. Yao has been in this business for 3 years, and he makes high quality shoes. To answer the needs of his clientele, he wishes to use this loan to buy animal skins and boxes of shoemaking glue. This opportunity will enable him to increase his revenue and, as a consequence, to turn a profit to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animal skins and shoemaking glue

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina es una luchadora mujer de 52 años de edad. Está casada hace 30 años con Daniel que tiene 57 años de edad. De la unión de ambos nacieron 5 hijos, todos son mayores de edad, están casados y viven en forma independiente.

Saturnina comenta que solamente pudo cursar hasta el segundo año de la secundaria, al igual que su esposo, por motivos económicos y que se vio forzada a trabajar desde muy joven también por la misma razón.  Su esposo es constructor de obras y se dedica a tal actividad desde hace 20 años aproximadamente.  Saturnina se desempeñaba únicamente como ama de casa hasta que hace 6 años decidió montar una pequeña despensa en su propio hogar.

Hoy día, cuenta orgullosa, que la misma está bien surtida y le genera muy buenas ganancias.  Tiene como proyecto montar alguna vez una heladería con el fin de ampliar su negocio.  En esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercaderías como: harina, azúcar, arroz, fideo, panificados, etc. con las cuales surtir mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Saturnina is a 52 year old woman who strives. She has been married for thirty years to Daniel who is 57 years old. Five children were born from their union, all of whom are married adults who live independently. Saturnina comments that she was able to study only up until the second year of high school, the same as her husband, due to financial reasons. She was forced to work from a young age for the same reason. Her husband is a construction worked and has been dedicated to that work for approximately twenty years. Saturnina worked solely has a homemaker up until six years ago when she decided to start a small shop in her own home. Today, she is proud that her shop is well stocked and generates good earnings. She has a new project which is to start an ice cream shop, with the aim to grow her business. At this time, she is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise such as flour, sugar, rice, noodles, baked goods, etc. with which she may better stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, sugar, rice, noodles, baked goods, etc.

loans.name: Khady

texts.fr: Khady C., 24 ans est mariée et membre de banc villageois à Vélingara depuis 05 ans. Son activité est la vente de tissus et de pâte d’arachide. Elle veut renforcer son commerce pour améliorer ses revenus.
texts.en:
Khady C., age 24, is married and has been a member of the village lending group in Vélingara for five years. Her work involves selling cloth and peanut butter. She wants to bolster her business to improve her income.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell cloth and peanut butter

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en: Remedios O. is from the city of Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 68 years old, married, and has four adult children. Remedios owns and operates a business raising crops, primarily planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Remedios is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will also be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support the needs of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort C. is 45 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, one boy and two girls. All are currently in the senior high, junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. Her husband is a trader. Comfort is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells on a tabletop by the roadside from morning to evening. She wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. Comfort buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr:
Ce monsieur a appris la soudure, en 1999 il a ouvert son propre atelier de soudure. Il fabrique des portes de maisons et des fourneaux qu’il expose pour attirer le regard des passants. Une partie des matériaux indispensables  à l’activité de la soudure est épuisée, il veut en acheter d’autres c’est pour cette raison qu’il demande son premier crédit à wages.
 Il est marié et père d’un enfant.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who learned how to weld. In 1999, he opened his own welding shop. He makes doors and gates for houses, and he makes stoves that he displays to attract those passing by. Some of his indispensable supplies are exhausted. He wants to buy some more, so he is asking WAGES for his first loan. He is married and the father of a child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for welding

loans.name: Thi

texts.en: Thi N. is thirty-two years old and works at raising pigs to sell, earning about $3 a day. She is married with two children, both of whom are students and live at home. Her husband, Mr. Hay Hang, is thirty-five years old and sells wood for carving that he finds in the forest. He has trouble picking up and moving his firewood, because he doesn’t have laborers to help. Therefore, Thi N. has decided to seek a loan to buy a water buffalo to help with transporting her husband’s firewood. She will also use this buffalo to help plow their farmland.

loans.use: To buy a water buffalo to help transport her husband’s firewood

loans.name: Khodor Karim

texts.en: Khodor K. is a 51-year-old married man and father of 7 children. He has been working as a taxi driver since 1979. After this long experience in the field, Khodor K. is requesting to borrow $1,000 to perform maintenance for his car after bad circumstances to be able to provide, alone, better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: perform maintenance for his car

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa I.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. She is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Leloto Leauvaa. She is widowed and has six adult children. Rosa has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 200 WST a month.

In 2006, Rosa (0) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase harvesting equipment. Rosa is now requesting a new loan of 750 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. This will be her fourth loan from SPBD. Rosa plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 48 and married with two children ages 10 and 18. Both her children go to school. Betty rents a two roomed house where she is staying with five people. Also, Betty takes care of additional family members The family gets three meals a day. There is electricity but no piped water at her home.

Betty resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala. She works seven days a week and receives 15 customers a day. Betty sells clothes to women only. She incurs extra transport costs to and from shopping. The major challenges she faces in her business are the rainy season and monthly market dues.

Betty has been with MCDT for seven years and is servicing her eighteenth loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bales of second-hand clothing. Betty aspires to seeing her business grow bigger and owning a permanent business structure; she now works from an open-air place.

loans.use: To buy more bales of clothes

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
40-year-old Rosalie C. is a newly recognized member of ASHI, the Kiva field partner in the Philippines. She wants to put up her own business to be able to augment her husband’s income from his job as an office utility worker.

Through her membership in ASHI, Rosalie requested a loan which will be used to pay for the purchases needed for her planned variety store business. By having a business of her own, Rosalie believes that the life of her family will be changed and improved. Profits she will make out of her business will be spent wisely for the necessary things her family needs, especially the needs of her four children whose ages range from 10 to 17 years old.

Through future loans with larger amounts that she can request after repaying this one, she believes that her business will grow and that she will be able to earn a bigger profit.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her variety store

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
La señora MARGARITA R. B. , tiene 35 años, vive en el distrito de Trujillo, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad – Perú. La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal SAN LUIS  y presenta estudios hasta 6to de Primaria. Se casó a la edad de 17 años y tiene 4 hijos todos menores y se encuentran estudiando por lo cual dependen económicamente de ella. MARGARITA se dedica a la venta de productos alimenticios como: arroz, azúcar, aceite, papas, gaseosas, jugos, cerveza, menestras, golosinas, etc, su negocio lo tiene instalado en su casa. Con su  primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró aceite, arroz, azúcar, fideos, papas al por mayor.
Con este crédito de 300  nuevos soles comprará sacos de arroz, azúcar, cajas de galletas, jugos, gaseosas, etc. La socia sueña con aumentar sus ventas para poder así obtener dinero y poder otorgarle a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida y educación.
texts.en:
Señora MARGARITA R. B. is 35 years old, and lives in the Trujillo district of Trujillo province in the La Libertad region of Peru. She belongs to the communal bank "San Luis," and has completed 6 years of primary education. She was married at the age of 17 and has 4 minor children who are in school and depend on her economically. Margarita is engaged in the business of selling food products such as: rice, sugar, cooking oil, potatoes, soft drinks, juices, beer, dried beans, candy, etc.; her business is located in her house. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles she bought cooking oil, rice, sugar, noodles and potatoes wholesale. With this loan of 300 nuevos soles she will buy sacks of rice, sugar, boxes of crackers, juices, soft drinks, etc. She dreams of increasing her sales in order to be able to make more money and to provide her children with an education and a good quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: she will buy bags of rice, sugar, boxes of crackers, juices, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Susan M.'s Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of a primary school in Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 4,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leones to supplement their monthly salaries. With this loan, some of them can invest in their businesses, or pay school fees for their children. Some will buy a piece of land or house-building materials, while others will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, like a bed, chairs, table or a television set. At the end of each month, the school’s bursar will deduct the total repayment amount owed SMT out of their salaries and repay SMT on their behalf.

Susan M. S. (right) is a teacher in charge at the school and the leader of this group. She is thirty-six, married to a teacher, and they have three children together. One of Susan’s children is attending Junior Secondary School III (JSS III), another is in Primary school VI and the last is not of school-going age. Susan has been a teacher for over fifteen years now. She will use this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila A.'s main source of income comes from raising pigs for sale. She is 41 years old, married and has two grown-up children. She is from the village of Mantik, Tangub City. Leonila has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Leonila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Leonila has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Leonila is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase piglets to raise and sell and to buy feed and other supplies. This will be her second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family and for future needs.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and to buy feed and other supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy maize and rice

loans.name: Rodine Group

texts.en:
These are members of the 'Rodine' group. They are small-scale businesspeople in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They have formed themselves into a group of four to apply for a loan from SMT/Kiva lenders. With a loan, they can expand their business, making more sales and better profit. Consequently, their living standard will improve.

The leader of this group is Ibrahim C. on the right in the photo. Ibrahim was born in Magburaka town about thirty-five years ago. He is married to a businesswoman and they have three children – two in secondary schools and one in primary school.

Ibrahim sells cosmetics, cigarettes, medicine, biscuits, mints, chewing gum, and many more items. He has been a businessman for approximately fifteen years now. With his share of the loan, he will buy cosmetics, cigarettes, biscuits, mints, chewing gum, and medicines.

loans.use: Buy cosmetics, cigarettes, biscuits, mints, chewing gum, and medicines

loans.name: María Luisa

texts.es:
En el departamento de Managua, específicamente en el Mercado Mayoreo, la señora María Luisa F. se dedica arduamente a la actividad de elaboración y venta de alimentos siendo preparados por ella misma en su establecimiento donde atiende a sus clientes a diario buscando la manera de satisfacer sus necesidades.

La razón por la que ella solicita el crédito es porque requiere la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los deliciosos alimentos. Ella comprará carne de res, carne de pollo, arroz, frijoles, aceite, entre otros. Espera que su crédito sea otorgado y de esta manera continuar llevando el sustento a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
María Luisa F. makes and sells prepared meals every day in Managua's Mayoreo Market in order to serve her customers and earn profits to meet her needs. She requests funding because she needs to buy ingredients to prepare her delicious meals. She will buy beef, chicken, rice, beans and cooking oil, among other items. She hopes her loan will be granted so that she can continue to support her household.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for prepared meals.

loans.name: Santos Ruben

texts.es: Don Santos Rubén Gutiérrez T.  cuenta con 31  años de edad  casado vive con su esposa e hija reside en el lugar conocido como Paraje Pajumujuyup, del Cantón Chuisuc, del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala el es graduado en la carrera de perito contador actualmente presta sus servicios profesionales ejerciendo su profesión pero su sueldo mensual no son suficiente para poder sufragar algunos gastos con su familia por tal motivo se acerco a las oficinas de la asociación Asdir para adquirir un préstamo, así poder comprar una estufa eléctrica para mejorar la preparación de sus alimento ayudándole ahorrar mas tiempo para poder mejorar su trabajo mejorando sus ingresos así poder darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Gutiérrez is 31 years old, married, and lives with his wife and daughter. He resides in a place called Paraje Pajumujuyup. Chuisuc Canton, in the municipality and department of Totonicapán. He is a graduate in the career of auditing accountant, and currently provides professional services in his profession. But the salary is insufficient to be able to afford some family expenses. For that reason, he approached the offices of the Asdir Association to request a loan. Santos wishes to buy an electric stove, to improve meal preparation and save time. This will enable him to improve his work, increase his income, and thus give his family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY AN ELECTRIC STOVE

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a 4-year-old son, Slava. She lives in the town of Gladkovka, Kherson region. Tatyana owns a greenhouse and grows early spring vegetables for retail sale. She built her greenhouse next to her house which facilitates her business activity. Tatyana has been in this trade for seven years. She has 20,000 UAH invested in inventory. Her income amounts to 10,000 UAH. 

Tatyana is seeking a 15,000 UAH loan to purchase seeds for the upcoming sowing season, as well as to buy supplies to reconstruct her greenhouse. She is a very disciplined and determined entrepreneur. Tatyana invests much time and effort in her venture. Her main desire is to see it grow and expand, bringing her stable income as a result.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and supplies to reconstruct her greenhouse

loans.name: Jorge Ruben

texts.es:
EL SEÑOR JORGE RUBEN J. S. Y SU ESPOSA LA SEÑORA MARINA JANETH ALTAMIRANO SANDOVAL SON PERSONAS HUMILDES QUE DESDE HACE 25 AÑOS SE DEDICAN A LA AGRICULTURA Y LA CRIANZA DE GANADO VACUNO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE SANTA ANA LA NUEVA. MEDIANTE ESTA ACTIVIDAD MANTIENEN A SUS DOS HIJOS  DE 18 Y 12 AÑOS.

AHORA SOLICITAN UN CREDITO PARA LA COMPRA DE  UN VEHICULO EL CUAL  AYUDARA AL TRANSPORTE DE LA FAMILIA DE ESA FORMA ALIVIANAR LOS GASTOS FAMILIARES  Y  LAS GRANDES DISTANCIAS QUE TIENEN QUE RECORRER PARA TRASLADARSE DE UN LUGAR A OTRO.
texts.en:
Senor Jorge Ruben J. S. and his wife, Senora Marina Janeth Altamirano Sandoval are humble people that for more than 25 years have worked in agriculture and raising cattle in the community of Santa Ana la Nueva. Through this activity they support their two children of ages 18 and 12. Now they are seeking a loan to buy a vehicle that will help them transport the family and lessen family expenses and the long distances that they have to travel to get from one place to another.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a vehicle

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.es:
María Margarita R. M. tiene 65 años y cuatro hijos que ya no dependen de ella. Su negocio consiste en la venta de flores en su puesto en una plazoleta al frente del Cementerio Universal de Barranquilla. Se vinculó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 11 años cuando fue promocionada por un asesor que la observaba y veía su desempeño. Con el crédito de $1.600.000 que ahora solicita, quiere surtirse con flores artificiales y naturales  como anturios, rosas, capullos, claveles y orquídeas que consigue más económicamente en Maicao, una ciudad fronteriza cerca de Venezuela.
El negocio de María en la venta flores surgió después de que abandonó la venta de mercancías que tenía en Maicao, municipio de donde vino a Barranquilla por cuestiones de seguridad. Inició su negocio de vender flores con una amiga que era la capitalista y obtenían iguales utilidades después de la venta. Como esto la favorecía, decidió independizarse y durante sus once años con la Fundación ha tenido mucho éxito en su negocio. Dice que su mayor desafío es la competencia que le hacen otras personas a quienes las ha enseñado María cómo vender flores. Antes se sentaba en su carpa esperando que la gente la fuera a buscar, pero ahora busca a sus clientes alrededor del cementerio, hecho que la ha ayudado conservarlos y a promover bien su negocio; el resultado es que se le acerca gente, incluso de otros departamentos de Colombia, que tiene sus seres queridos en otros cementerios pero le tienen mucha confianza, pues sabe cómo conservar  las flores. Sus éxitos la ayudan a realizar sus sueños, de los cuales el principal es el de tener un mayor capital para surtir el negocio, sobre todo con flores naturales.
texts.en:
María Margarita R. M. is 65 years old and has four children who no longer depend on her. She sells flowers at her stall in the square in front of the Universal Cemetery of Barranquilla. She began to work with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo 11 years ago when a consultant observed her and saw her performance. With the loan of 1,600 Colombian pesos she is asking for, she wants to stock up with artificial and fresh flowers like anthuriums, roses, flower buds, carnations and orchids, which she can get more economically in Maicao, a border city near Venezuela. María's flower sales business came into being after she abandoned the merchandise sales she had done in Maicao and moved to Barranquilla for security reasons. She began her business selling flowers with a friend who had the capital, and they got equal profits after the sale. As this went well for her, she decided to become independent, and during her eleven years with the Fundación she has had much success with her business. She says that her greatest challenge is the competition she gets from other people whom María has taught how to sell flowers. She used to sit in her tent waiting for people to come look for her, but now she looks for her customers around the cemetery, which has helped her to keep those customers and promote her business; the result is that people come to her, even people from other departments in Colombia whose loved ones are in other cemeteries. They have a lot of confidence in her since she know how to preserve flowers Her successes help her to make her dreams come true, and her main dream is to have more capital to supply her business, especially with fresh flowers.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock artificial and fresh flowers like anthuriums, roses, flower buds, carnations and orchids

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en: Naseem, a resident of of the Pakistani city of Borewala, famous for its shrines, is the wife of I., who has operated a vegetable-selling business  for over 25 years. Purchasing his produce from the vegetable market, he sells it to various places from his cart. Naseem supports him by operating her  clothes-sewing business. They use both of their incomes to meet the financial expenses of their family. Naseen is now applying for a loan to buy seasonal vegetables in bulk so that her husband can expand his business.

loans.use: To buy seasonal vegetables to sell

loans.name: Augustine M.a.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured are teachers from a primary school in Malong village, which is located about five miles away from Magburaka town. This school was established by the Roman Catholics in 1966 to promote education in Sierra Leone. Currently, the school has 10 teachers on its payroll list and 2 unpaid teachers with 285 pupils.  

This is the first loan this school is accessing from Kiva through SMT. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Sixty-two-year-old Augustine M.A. F. (pictured on the right) is the headmaster at the school, and has been a teacher for 43 years. He was born in Magburaka town, and is married with four children – two of his children are in secondary school and two are in college. Augustine will use his loan to buy house-building materials like bags of cement, stones and iron corrugated zinc. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy house building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Adam

texts.en: Adam A., thirty-eight years old, is a popular businessman. He is married with four children. Adam owns a furniture business that he has been running for over three years. He is requesting a loan to purchase more timber and equipment. Adam is a very hardworking businessman whose dream is to have a well equipped furniture shop that will allow him to work faster and be more productive.

loans.use: To purchase more timber and equipment to speed up work.

loans.name: Tej Kumari

texts.en:
Mrs. Tej Kumari D. lives in Chappagaun Village, Lalitpur district. It is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur and most of the people in this region are engaged in agricultural farming.
Mrs. Tej Kumari D. lives with her husband and three children – two sons and one daughter. All of her children are now studying in higher secondary school.
Both Mrs. Tej Kumari and her husband are engaged in mushroom farming. They started this business more than five years ago. They sell mushrooms in the local market in the morning and evening. Now, due to increasing customer demand for mushrooms, Mrs. Tej Kumari D. is requesting a loan of 25,000 NPR to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Primitivo Baudillo

texts.es:
Primitivo de 56 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (la originalidad de este lugar fue un campo con muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. El tiene 6 hijos y tiene un taller de muebles. 

Hace 15 años atrás el tiene el taller de mueble, trabaja con 9 trabajadores haciendo muebles en su casa. No tiene un lugar fijo para su taller pero durante los 15 años a trabajado en el portal de su casa el hace mesas, sillas, sillones etc. 

Pero para hacer mas muebles el quiere comprar madera para su negocio. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa porque es actualmente de caña y ladrillos.
texts.en:
Primitivo is 56 years old and lives in the urban neighborhood of Las Orquídeas (“The Orchids”—the neighborhood was originally a field with many orchid flowers) in Guayaquil. He has 6 children and owns a furniture making business. Primitivo has had his furniture making business for 15 years. He and his 9 employees build furniture in Primitivo’s house. Primitivo does not have a permanent place for his workshop, but for the past 15 years has worked in the entrance hall of his home making tables, chairs, armchairs, etc. Now Primitivo wants to purchase wood so he can build more furniture for his business. In the future he wants to finish constructing his house, as it is currently made of bricks and reeds.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing wood for his furniture making business

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
BB.CC. Taytacha Señor D. Ccoyllority D. Yungaqui.
Maxima, tiene 64 años, es viuda y tiene seis hijos. 
Yo nací en la provincia D. Anta departamento del Cusco y actualmente vivo en la comunidad D. Yungaqui. Mi actividad económica es la elaboración D. y venta D. queso para lo cual a un inicio se me hacia un poco difícil ya que no contaba con mucho capital, fue entonces que se me presento la oportunidad D. pertenecer al banco comunal D. la Asociación Arariwa el cual me brindo apoyo con préstamos D. dinero y así puD. empezar y así mejorar mi negocio. En esta oportunidad necesito el préstamo para comprar más insumos como leche, sal y otros materiales. La comunidad D. Yungaqui se encuentra ubicado no menos D. 45 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco y a 10 minutos D. la ciudad D. Izcuchaca.
texts.en:
Loan Group Taytacha Señor D. Ccoyllority D. Yungaqui. Maxima is 64 years old. She is a widow and has 6 children. I was born in the Anta province in the department of Cusco and currently live in Yungaqui. I make and sell cheese. It was a bit difficult to begin with because I did not own much capital. Then I had the chance to become part of the Asociación Arariwa, which provided me with support and lent me money, and that's how I was able to start and grow my own business. This time I am in need of a loan to buy more raw materials such as milk, cheese and other. The community of Yungaqui is at least 45 minutes away from the city of Cusco and 10 minutes away from the city of Izcuchaca.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more raw materials including milk, salt and other.

loans.name: Scolastica Makokha

texts.en:
Scolastica Makokha M. is a widow, age 45, and a proud mother of two children. She started a mini shop business in Nambale Busia in 2008, in order to generate income. 

Before this venture, she used to practice farming for commercial purposes, but owing to the death of her husband, she could not get substantial income to support the needs of her family. She often travels three times per week to Nambale for additional inventory. Having heard about KIVA/KMET loans and how it has changed the lives of many, she decided to apply for a loan Kshs. 10,000 to enable her to boost her business and revive her farming activities, so that she gets enough income that will enable her to meet her future goal of educating her children.

loans.use: To boost her business and be able to revive her farming business

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Hace 12 años Luz María M. Benítez se vino  desde el Carmen de Bolívar, con su conyugue y sus tres hijos a Barranquilla buscando paz y estabilidad en los ingresos; ellos llegaron  inicialmente donde un pariente que les tendió la mano y cuando posteriormente su esposo consiguió un trabajo de celador  en un remolcador donde se mudaron, logrando que después de un tiempo el propietario de este,  le cediera una pieza donde  ampliaron gradualmente  e iniciaron su negocio de criar animales y vender su carne;  hoy se dedican a ello y matan 60 cerdos , actividad  de la que se encarga  Luz María,  mientras su esposo trabaja en un astillero, lugar donde ella  consiguió el negocio de vender  almuerzos a un promedio de 35 empleados diariamente  y cada día adquiere mayores proporciones en cuanto a sus clientes se refiere . Este es su cuarto crédito con la Fundación y solicita su credikiva por valor de $1.000.000 COP,  para comprar cerdos para la cría, engorde y venta de su carne y también,  adquirir en mayor volumen materias primas e insumos, para la preparación de los almuerzos que vende.
Con sus créditos ha conseguido aumentar sus utilidades y con ello comprar un carro que utiliza  para  el negocio. Su sueño ahora está enfocado en comprar una casa y este es su gran desafío el ahorro constante para hacerlo, pero ella ya aprendió a solucionar sus desafíos, desde que llegó a Barranquilla solo con deseos de salir adelante,  impulsada por ofrecerles seguridad y un mejor bienestar a sus hijos, que entonces eran pequeños y en la actualidad están estudiando y ya organizados.
texts.en:
Twelve years ago Luz María M. Benítez came from El Carmen de Bolívar to Barranquilla with her spouse and three children seeking peace and economic stability. At first they arrived at a relative’s who helped them out. Later, when her husband got a job as a watchman at a towing site, they moved. In time, her husband’s boss gave them a room that they gradually enlarged and they started their business of raising animals to sell their meat. Today, they are in this line of work and they butcher 60 pigs. Luz María is in charge of this particular task while her husband works at a saw mill where she secured the business of preparing daily lunches there for 35 employees and daily her business grows. This is the 4th loan with the Foundation and she’s asking for a Kiva loan in the amount of $1.000.000 COP to buy pigs to raise for subsequent pork sales as well as to acquire larger amounts of raw materials and ingredients to prepare the lunches she sells. The loans have made it possible for her to increase profits and buy a car that she uses in the business. Her dream is focused on buying a house and this is the great challenge she faces: the constant need to save in order to reach it. However, she learned how to overcome her challenges since she arrived in Barranquilla with only the wish to get ahead, pushed by the need to provide security and wellbeing for her children who were then little. Currently, they are studying and well organized.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs to raise in order to sell pork and to acquire larger amounts of ingredients and raw ingredients for the lunches she sells.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bags of rice to cook for sale

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Florentina; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es madre soltera y  tiene 2 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de  tienda de abarrotes, ella vende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, ella saca sola adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes mas grande. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  mercadería  como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Florentina, age 43, is a member of the “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco” Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Wanchaq district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Florentina is a single mother, and she has two children. She alternates between her daily activities and her business, which is a grocery store. She sells from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. She alone gets her children ahead. She wants to have a larger grocery store. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She is grateful to those people, who through these means, are part of her dream. She pledges to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies

loans.name: Janat

texts.en:
Janat N. is 21 years old, married and has three children. All of her children are currently in school. She lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. Janat makes bricks, which she has done for over ten years. She also sells vegetables.

To help expand her business, Janat has requested a loan of 200,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase firewood for burning the bricks. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Janat hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.

In the future, Janat hopes to see her children prosper through education. Janat is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save.

loans.use: To buy firewood

loans.name: Giomara Cecilia

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo en el sector conocido como Las Piedras, encontramos el Banco Comunal Caminantes de Cristo, que se reúnen cada quince días.
 
La señora Giomara es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y se desempeña como fiscal de pago del Banco,  le encantan las reuniones ya que aprende mucho y comparte con sus amigas. Tiene 22 años, mantiene una relación de unión libre y tiene un hijo de 4 años, su marido es taxista.

Se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, perfumería y accesorios) ya lleva cuatro años que se dedica a esta labor y dice que tiene muchos  clientes que le realizan sus pedidos. Trabaja de lunes a viernes  de dos a tres horas, solamente los sábados trabaja desde las 12h00 hasta las 19h00 cuando realiza los cobros de sus productos.

Este crédito lo va a ocupar para comprar sus productos y productos que estén en ofertas los cuales después que pasa la promoción los vende al precio normal y le deja buenas ganancias. 

Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que viven en la casa de su madre.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, in an area known as Las Piedras, one will find the Caminantes de Cristo communal bank. They have meetings every 15 days. Giomara is a founding member of the group and carries out the duties of payments auditor. She loves the meetings where she learns a lot and shares with her friends. 

Giomara is 22 years old, lives in a civil union, and has a four-year-old son. Her husband works as a taxi driver. For four years, Giomara has operated a business selling the Yanbal line of beauty products, perfumes, and accessories. She has many regular clients making orders. She works two or three hours a day from Monday through Friday. On Saturday, she works from noon to 7:00 PM collecting money for the sales.

With this loan, Giomara will buy products to sell. When she can, she buys the products on sale, to increase her earnings. Her dream is to have her own house, as she currently lives with her mother.

loans.use: Buy beauty products, perfumes, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Nou

texts.en:
Nou K., 33, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for palm products. K. is a housewife while her husband is employed at a factory, earning an income of 3 USD per day. One of her children is a factory worker, earning an income of 2 USD per day. K. has to spend 50 USD on food and 5 USD on other necessary expenses every month.

K. is requesting a loan of 700 USD to build a place for farmers to thresh their rice. In the future, she would like to use any additional profits to repair her house.

loans.use: To build a place for farmers to thresh their rice

loans.name: Jessica Tatiana

texts.es:
La Señora Jessica H. es socia del banco comunal El Arenal, vive en el centro de la  ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por la belleza de sus calles, su centro histórico el que fue nombrado en diciembre de 1999 como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente es muy amable y cordial quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones.
 
La Señora. Jessica tiene 19 años, vive en unión libre y está muy contenta ya que tiene 8 meses de embarazo, su esposo es supervisor de un restaurante, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Jessica tiene un puesto de comida rápida actividad en donde labora hace 2 años, trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche.

Este es su segundo crédito y fue  invitada por su hermana a formar parte de la banca comunal. Su nuevo crédito lo va  a invertir en el arreglo de su local y para la compra de frutas para realizar jugos. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Señora Jessica H. is a member of the community bank El Arenal.  She lives in the center of the city Cuenca.  This city is known for the beauty of its streets, its historic center was named in December 1999 as a cultural heritage site.  Its people are very nice and warm, and want to maintain their culture and traditions.

Señora Jessica is 19 years old.  She lives in a common-law marriage and is very happy as she is currently 8 months pregnant.  Her husband is the manager at a restaurant, they don't have their own home, and so they live in a rental.  

Doña Jessica has a fast foot stall, where she has worked for 2 years.  She works from Monday to Saturday from 7am until 10pm at night.
This is her second loan, and she was invited by her sister to form part of the community bank.  Her new loan will go to invest in the improvement of her business site and for the purchase of fruits to make juices.  Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: To buy fruit and improve Jessica's business location

loans.name: Irma Janet

texts.es:
Irma tiene 26 años de edad y reside en el caserío La Pilca del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayos.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella realiza sus ventas por pedidos, a más pedidos realizados logra obtener mayores ganancias, por ello siempre trata de brindar lo mejor de si y busca nuevos clientes, los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades le sirven para solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia con el sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Irma desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo productos por su cuenta para contar con un stock permanente que le permita satisfacer la demanda que posee de mejor manera, por ello ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.

Irma es una mujer bastante responsable y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona tranquila y confiable.
texts.en:
Irma is 26 years old.  She lives in the town of La Pilca, in Olmos district, a farming area in Lambayeque province, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Irma sells beauty products from a catalog.  She makes her sales through orders.  The more orders she receives, the more profits she makes.  For this reason, she always tries her hardest and is always looking for new customers.  The income that she makes from these activities helps her to cover her personal expenses and helps her support her family financially.

Irma would like to expand her business, acquiring products so that she can have a permanent stock which will allow her to better satisfy the demand which she has.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Irma is quite a responsible woman who has a great desire to get ahead.  People who know her consider her to be a calm and trustworthy person.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to expand her catalog sales business

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
Angelica S. Q., con 3 hijos; es la presidenta del grupo: "Mujeres Emprendedoras" del distrito D. Chilca en Huancayo. (En la foto Angelica, es la persona que està sentada, viste D. jean azul y casaca color gris)
Angelica se separó D. su esposo cuando nació su última hija que ahora ya tiene 05 años, ella empezó a trabajar en tiendas como vendedora y su mamá la apoyaba cuidando a sus niñas, pero recientemente tuvo problemas familiares debido a que se ausentaba mucho tiempo D. casa; su niña mayor D. 13 años dejò influenciarse por las malas amistades y la niña se volvió rebelD. al extremo D. que ya no obedecìa a nadie, y empezó a saliir por las noches a discotecas y no llegaba a dormir a casa; la desesperaciòn D. esta pobre madre la llevo a dejar el trabajo y dedicarse D. lleno a sus hijas. Pero lamentablemente la realidad D. su situaciòn economica era complicada sin la ayuda del padre; Angelica tenìa que ver por sus 03 niñas, por sacar adelante su familia ella sola; asì optó por iniciarse en el negocio D. vender papas peladas y picadas para freir a las pollerias. Ahora Angelica està màs tiempo en casa,  dedicando y brindando calidad D. tiempo a sus hijas, como tambièn a su negocio, ademàs cuenta con el apoyo D. sus niñas en esta actividad. 
Uso del crédito:Incremento D. capital D. trabajo por fiestas naviD.ñas.
texts.en:
Angelica S. Q. has 3 children.  She is the president of the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) group from Childa district in Huancayo (in the photo, Angelica is the person who is sitting down, wearing blue jeans and a gray jacket).

Angelica separated from her husband when her youngest daughter was born 5 years ago.  She started to work in stores as a saleswoman and her mother supported her by looking after her daughters.  However, recently she had family problems because she was away from her home for a lot of time
