texts.es: El señor Roger Espinosa García tiene la edad de 58 años, habita en el barrio santa Rosa ubicado en la ciudad de Masaya, junto a su esposa y hijos la señora trabaja para poder compartir los gastos del hogar ; ya que tiene a su cargo un hijo que actualmente estudia su secundaria y se gasta mucho, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar su negocio para poder brindarle el apoyo a su hijo que pronto ira a la universidad , él trabaja como artesano y a la vez elabora zapatos desde hace treinta años , con sus propios esfuerzos ha logrado mantener esta pequeña mico- empresa la cual carece de materia prima para poder elaborar producción . El solicita el apoyo de Afodenic para poder crecer en su empresa y comprar materia prima para seguir elaborando bonitos y variados zapatos.
texts.en:
Mr. Roger Espinosa García is 58 years old, lives in the neighborhood Santa Rosa, located in the city of Masaya, together with his wife and sons. His wife works to help share the household expenses because they have a son dependent on them who is currently studying in secondary school and costs them a lot. His family plans to improve his business to provide support to his son who will go soon to university. He works as an artesan and has produced shoes for 30 years; with his efforts he has maintained this small microenterprise which lacks raw material for production. He asks for support from Afodenic to grow his business and purchase raw material to continue producing varied and beautiful shoes.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw material to make shoes

loans.name: Elizabeth Adhiambo

texts.en:
Elizabeth Adhiambo A. rents a workshop in the Likoni area of Mombasa, Kenya where she has a woodworking business. Elizabeth buys timber from local shops to make chapatti boards for rolling chapatti (a local flat bread), chopping boards, mug hanging stands, bottle openers, and mortar and pestles. She started this business in 1997 so that she could pay for her children’s school fees. 

Elizabeth takes large orders from local supermarkets, as well as supplying smaller shops. From large supermarket orders, Elizabeth might make a 7,000 KSH profit from each order – she receives about 2 orders of this kind a month, as well as smaller orders from the small shops. 

Elizabeth has applied for a loan in order to buy more timber and a blade for carving the wood.

Elizabeth is married with 7 dependent children. She dreams of building her own house, so that she and her family no longer have to rent living space above her current workshop.

loans.use: To purchase timber and a carving blade.

loans.name: José Guillermo

texts.es: José Guillermo R. P. vive en Soyapango , departamento de San Salvador. El no contar con educación formal nunca ha sido impedimento para buscar trabajo, y desde hace ya varios años se dedica a la albañilería por contrato.  El negocio de la albañilería  es muchas veces inestable, pues Jose Guillermo  trabajo por proyectos, y no siempre logra obtener contrataciones continuas. Esto no desanima a Jose, quien siempre busca la manera de aprender nuevas cosas que le permitan lograr mas contratos, en este momento, solicita un préstamo para adquirir nuevos materiales y herramientas de albañilería que le permitan acceder a nuevos y más proyectos.
texts.en:
José Guillermo R. P. lives in Soyapango, a district of San Salvador. Although he doesn't have a formal education this has never been an impediment in looking for work, and he has worked for a number of years as a contract bricklayer. The bricklaying business is often unstable, and as Jose Guillermo works on a project basis he is not always able to obtain continuous work. This doesn't deter Jose, who always looks for ways to learn new skills which will allow him to obtain more contracts. He is currently seeking a loan to buy new bricklaying tools and materials which will give him access to new projects.

Translated from Spanish by Sally Bolton, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bricklaying tools and materials

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa Y., a 50-year-old food vendor and member of a village bank called ‘Cynthia,’ lives in the village of Wasa Simpa in the western part of Ghana with her husband, who is a farmer, and their five children, one of whom has finished senior high school, while the others are still in school.  

Adwoa has been in business for the past six years selling kenkey as well as maize. Kenkey, prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish, is enjoyed by many Ghanaians for breakfast, lunch and supper. Adwoa therefore has a good base of customers and is now requesting a loan to buy more raw materials including bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood, hoping to thereby increase her savings to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials including bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Justina

texts.en:
Justina M. is married with five dependent children. She has received schooling through junior high. Justina has sold groceries, soft drinks and building materials at Agona, near Elmina, since 2001.

Her husband is employed as an auto mechanic. Justina uses her income to support her husband in paying rent, utility bills and other basic expenses of the family.

Justina will use the loan to increase her stock, to sell more groceries, soft drinks and building materials to meet the increase in demand by her costumers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Justina plans to reinvest to promote the expansion of her trade.

loans.use: Purchase more groceries and supplies to sell.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam de 49 años, vive junto a su esposo y su única hija en casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de artículos de ferretería (pintura, clavos, lijas, etc) en forma ambulatoria, llevando a vender sus productos por los diferentes lugares de su zona. En esta labor lleva un periodo de 2 años y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien se encarga de movilizarla en su motocarro. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que conoce muchos lugares y se relaciona con varias personas, quienes se ganaron su confianza y ahora son sus clientes regulares, además le es rentable porque sus productos tienen mucha demanda y se venden muy fácilmente, porque bien son comprados al contado o cambiados por alimentos o animales que valoricen el monto. Para el futuro, Miriam desea tener un local para instalar una ferretería con todo lo necesario. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque sus compañeros de grupo son unidos y respetuosos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo invertirá en la compra de más materiales de ferretería para aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Miriam is 49 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and only daughter. She sells hardware (paint, nails, files, etc) from door to door in the various places in her zone. She has been doing this for the past 2 years with the help of her husband who drives her from place to place. What she likes about her job is that she gets to know many places and meet a lot of people who trust her and become her regular clientele. Additionally, her business is profitable because her products are in high demand and they sell easily at good prices either for cash or in exchange for food or animals with the same value. For the future, Miriam would like to have a well-stocked store from which to sell her hardware. This is her third loan with MFP and she likes to work with her comunal bank because the members of her group are united and respectful. The money she is asking for on this occasion is to buy more inventory to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Jose Marcial

texts.es:
el sr. Jose G. tiene 63 años de edad, el vive en union libre con su compañera de hogar la Sra. Maria Carbajal, tienen 5 hijos de los cuales. el vive en Coyolito y se dedica a la venta de Refrescos y Molino de Quebrar Maiz esta es su actividad principal, todos los dias se levanta a las 4 de la mañana para moler maiz, ya que mucha gente le gusta moler el maiz para hacer tortillas temprano para el desayuno.
el necesita el credito para poder comprar repuestos para el molino que es su unica fuente fuerte de ingresos que tiene, la venta de refrescos le genera ganancias pero no muchas.
su deseo es que sus hijos sean hombres de bien y que todos se graduen de la universidad y asi tengan una mejor condicion de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose G., 63, lives with his common law wife, Mrs. Maria Carbajal. They have 5 children. He lives in Coyolito. He sells soft drinks, however grinding corn is his primary business. Every day he gets up at 4 in the morning to grind corn. Lots of people like ground corn to make tortillas for breakfast. He needs a loan to be able to buy replacement parts for his mill. The mill is his only strong source of income. Soft drink sales generate some income, but not much. His hope is that his children become good people, and that they all graduate from the university. That way they will have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy parts for mill and soft drinks

loans.name: Dominga Zoraida

texts.es:
La señora Dominga pertenece al Banco Comunal “Micaela Bastidas” ubicado  del  distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; Tiene 53 años de edad, estado civil viuda, tiene 5 hijos.  Tiene estudios de secundaria completa. Vive en el Barrio San Miguel.

Ella trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 02 años.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/.  300.00 nuevos soles.  La señora Dominga se dedica a la compra-venta de golosinas.

En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder comprar cajas de galletas, chocolates, caramelos, gaseosas, jugos, etc. y así poder surtir su negocio.
Su sueño es poner una tienda grande bien surtida o en todo caso poner una librería.
 
A ella le gusta el ahorro y los encuentros organizados por La institución Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Dominga belongs to the "Micaela Bastidas" communal bank, which is located in the district of Ilave, province of El Collao, department of Puno. She is 53 years old, a widow and has 5 children. She completed her secondary school education and lives in the San Miguel neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the past 2 years. Her first loan was for S/. 300,00 new soles. Dominga buys and sells sweets. She currently needs a loan for S/. 1000.00 new soles to buy boxes of cookies, chocolates, candies, soft drinks, juices, etc. so she can restock her business. Her dream is to have large, well-stocked store or at any rate to start a bookshop. She likes saving and she likes the meetings organized by the Manuela Ramos organization.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cookies, chocolates, candies, soft drinks and juices.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica O. is from the city of Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro. She is 27 years old. Jessica is married and has 5 small children. To make a living, Jessica owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector, operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling used clothing to local community member. Jessica has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Jessica joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jessica has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Jessica is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Jessica from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children and the needs of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her business

location.town: Baikingon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Hope Sisters Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are Fatu J., Saidu B., Alamatu B. and Bilkisu K. of the Hope Sisters group. They are local entrepreneurs based in Makeni city, located in northern Sierra Leone. To date, these entrepreneurs have received several loans from SMT/Kiva. With those loans, they have been able to expand their businesses. As a result of this, they have been able to provide their children with three meals a day, send them to school and solve most of their daily financial challenges. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are again requesting a new loan of Le 1,200,000 so that each of them can further improve her businesses. 

Fatu J. (second from left) is the leader of the group. Fatu was born in Makeni and is now 46 years old. She is a widow with seven children. Four are grown-ups and three are attending secondary schools. Fatu sells market food and has been in this business for over 35 years now. With this loan, she will be able to further expand her business.

loans.use: Invest in her business selling food in order to further expand her business

loans.name: Afia

texts.fr:
B. Afia est née le 08 Janvier 1960 à BOPA dans le département du Mono. Elle est mariée et mère de deux enfants qui sont actuellement aux Etats-Unis. Afia vend principalement des boissions, comme les jus de citron et bissup, jus très sucré qui vient de Bénin. Elle mène son activité à son domicile.  

Bénéficiaire dynamique et crédible, Afia est à son troisième crédit d’Alidé.  Elle sollicite un nouveau crédit pour s'approvisionner plus de lait en poudre, des citrons, du sucre, des boîtes de canettes.  Elle a le souci de bien rembourser le montant emprunté.
texts.en:
B. Afia was born on January 8, 1960 in BOPA in Mono county. He is married and the mother of two children who are currently in the United States. Afia sells mainly beverages, such as lemon juice and bissap juice, which is a very sweet drink from Benin. She operates her business in her home. An energetic and credible beneficiary, Afia is on her third loan with Alidé. She is requesting a new loan to stock up on powdered milk, lemons, sugar, and cans. She has the care to repay properly the amount borrowed.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cans, lemons, sugar, powdered milk

loans.name: Cerela

texts.en:
Cerela D. is from the city of Dapitan. She is 57 years old. Cerela is married and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, Cerela owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector selling home products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling kitchen supplies and products to local community members. Cerela is just starting this business.

In 2007, Cerela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cerela successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Cerela is requesting a new loan of 14,500 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Cerela from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura M. is from the village of Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 63-years old, married with one adult child. Laura owns and operates a sari-sari or general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of revenue for the business comes from selling everyday use products such as shampoo, soap, toothpaste etc., in the local community. Laura has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Laura joined Kiva partner GDMPC in order to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laura has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Laura is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Laura from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase everyday use products

loans.name: Yetunde

texts.en: Yetunde sells provisions and drinks to make a living. She is very determined to expand her business and to maximize her profits. Yetunde is 43 years old and married with 6 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100, 000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
la sra. Josefa F. vive en union libre con el sr. Oscar Armando Ortiz, no tienen hijos por los momentos, Josefa se dedica a la compra/venta de refrescos de cola al por mayor y tambien al detalle, este tipo de prodcuto es muy vendido en esta zona, ya que las personas toman mucho refrescos de cola, es una costumbre para muchas personas ingerir sus alimentos del almuerzo y comprar un refresco de cola.
tambien ella elabora pan casero y tamales los fines de semana, Josefa necesita el credito para comprar mas refrescos al por mayor. 
nos comento que le va muy bien y que esta muy agradecida con Dios porque todo le esta saliendo bien, con su compañero de hogar estan planeando el año que viene tener un hijo.

loans.use: compra de refrescos de cola

loans.name: Zakiya's Group

texts.en:
N. Zakiya is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is 24 years old and the single mother of two children aged 3 years and one and a half years and both of them are not yet in school.

Zakiya is a business lady involved in the sale of fish, mostly dried fish, in Tongolo. Since we are in a rainy season, it takes a lot of time for her to dry her fish and hence most of them rot. In a good season, she is able to make 100,000/= as profits and this is attributed to her good customer care.

She has the aim of expanding her business to ensure that she can earn more money and be able to educate her children to the highest level. Zakiya needs a loan to help buy more fish for resale. She is such a hardworking and determined lady with a strong drive to succeed.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean S. is a mother of five children and a loving wife to Mr. Procopio S.. She is 45 years of age and from the village of Marcos, Roxas, Isabela. Jean operates a frozen food retailing business. Though her work is laborious as she processes her products herself, Jean really loves her business because it serves as her source of income. While Jean is busy processing her products, her husband, Procopio, is busy farming their field.

For Jean to earn more income, she sells her frozen foods in the different villages near their home. She dreams of improving her small business and being able to process more frozen foods to supply the needs of her customers. With this in mind, Jean is asking for the amount of 10,000 PHP from Kiva lenders as additional capital for her business. She is very optimistic that her loan will be granted.

loans.use: As additional capital for her frozen food business

loans.name: Ekuka

texts.en: Ekuka G. sells food supplies such as canned tomatoes, fresh ginger, locally made spices and so on at Elmina fish pot.  Ekuka has received a senior high education.  She is single and has four children. Ekuka has been selling food supplies since 1979. She is responsible for the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to invest.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies for sale.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en: Adelaida B. is 47 years old and already a widow. “Prayer accompanied by hard work” is Adelaida's guiding principle. The couple together with their children are happily living in the village of Anquiray Amulung,Cagayan. Their children are: George, 28 years old and a college undergraduate; Jennifer, 25 years old, and a college undergraduate; Jennifer, 23 years, a college graduate who is working in Manila; and Janice 12 years old, and a  freshman high school student.  Adelaida says that through her business she tries to support her family. But due to the high cost of commodities, the income that she generates from her general store is insufficient for their daily needs. Thus, she is requesting a loan of PHP5,000, allowing her to make the general store progress. This amount will be a big help in expanding her business and fulfilling her dreams.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en:
Ryan A. is from the village of Gud, San Isidro. He is 23 years old. Ryan is single. To make a living, Ryan owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from motorcycle transport. Ryan has been engaged in his business for almost a year and earns approximately 300 PHP a day for these activities.

In 2009, Ryan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ryan is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ryan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Lucila Berta

texts.es: Lucila Berta tiene 49 años de edad, su actividad económica es ofrecer el  brindar el servicio de costura. Hace más de 7 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que inicio como un medio de vida para su familia. Además tiene 1 hija de 10 años, de la que se hace cargo pues ella tiene la enfermedad de síndrome de Down y ella la baña, la viste y está pendiente al cuido de su hija. Asimismo se dedica a impartir clases en un colegio llamado Asunción, en donde labora como docente desde hace 30 años, ella está muy orgullosa de ser una mujer muy emprendedora y luchadora. Su deseo es ampliar su taller y establecer boutiques en donde sus prendas de vestir sean las mejores.
texts.en:
Lucila Berta is a 49-year-old tailor, something she has been doing for more than seven years. In addition, she takes care of a 10-year-old daughter with Down Syndrome. She bathes her, dresses her, and is key to her care. At the same time, she gives classes at Asunción high school, where she's worked as a teacher since she was 30. She is very proud to be an enterprising and motivated woman. Her wish is to expand her workshop and establish boutiques where her garments will be the best.

Translated from Spanish by Laurie Paguio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda M. is from the village of Mangidkid Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Erlinda is widowed and has three adult children. To make a living, Erlinda owns & operates a retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue the main source of income comes primarily from selling daily use products such as sugar, salt, shampoo, soap (bath and laundry) & toothpaste in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Erlinda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz A. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old. Luz is single. To make a living, Luz owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products like beverages in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Luz is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Luisa Amada

texts.es:
El banco comunal Alianza Unida se formó en la ciudad de Cuenca ubicada en el centro sur del país, esta ciudad es una fusión de tres culturas ricas en simbolismo tradición y arte como Cañari, Inca y Española los integrantes de éste banco son mujeres  luchadoras cabezas de hogar  en busca del bienestar de sus familias, son un grupo muy alegre y solidario que siempre están dispuestas a colaborar  entre ellas para que todas salgan adelante tanto familiar como económicamente. 

Luisa F.  tiene 49 años vive  en una casa arrendada en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca con  tres de sus seis hijos,  los tres primeros ya son casados y viven independientes,  sus hijos de 16 y 13 estudian en un colegio nocturno para  trabajar y ayudar a su madre en casa ya que no tienen papá.

Luisa trabaja como cocinera en el  restaurante Pio Pio  hace 15 años y sus horarios son rotativos de 8 a.m. a 4 p.m. y el otro  de 3 p.m. a 11 p.m. y cuando falta alguno de sus compañeros tiene que doblar el turno,  además de ésta actividad  se dedica a la cría de pollos pero más sólo para entretenerse en casa  y no para negocio.

La señora Luisa se integró al banco comunal Alianza Unida  hace  cinco  años motivada por una vecina que es miembro del mismo, los créditos le han ayudado a salir adelante con sus hijos y tener hábito de ahorro, el dinero del préstamo solicitado  va a invertir en la educación de sus hijos pagando pensiones y  en la compra de nuevos uniformes y si le queda algo comprará  mas pollos.

Su meta es  comprarse un terreno para poco a poco ir construyendo su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Alianza Unida" was formed in the city of Cuenca, located in the central southern part of the country. This city is a fusion of 3 rich cultures in its traditional symbolism and art, the Cañari, Inca and Spanish. The members of this bank are women who are heads of their households, and who struggle to provide for their families. They are a happy and supportive group; they are always ready to work together so that they all see their families advance economically. Luisa F. is 49 years old and lives in a rented house in the suburb of the city of Cuenca with 3 of her 6 children. The three oldest of her children are already married and live independently. Her children who are 16 and 13 years old study at a night school so they can work and help their mother at home, since they have no father. Luisa has worked as a cook in the restaurant Pio Pio for 15 years, and her schedule rotates from 8am to 4pm, to 3pm to 11pm. When one of her co-workers does not show up, she has to double her shift. In addition to this activity she raises chickens, but only to enjoy at home and not for a business. Luisa joined the communal bank "Alianza Unida" 5 years ago; she was encouraged by a neighbor who is also a member. The loans have helped her to get ahead with her children, and to have the habit of saving. The money from the loan she requests will be invested in the education of her children, paying school fees and buying new uniforms. If there is any money left she will also buy more chickens. Her goal is to buy herself some land so that, little by little, she can start building her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay school fees and buy new uniforms for her children, and also to buy chickens

loans.name: Rachele Ann

texts.en:
Rachele Ann M. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro City. She is 24 years old. Rachele Ann is married and has 3 pre-school children. Rachele Ann owns and operates a specialized retail business selling dried seafood products, such as fish and shrimp, in the local community. Rachele Ann has been involved in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Rachele Ann joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rachele Ann is requesting her first loan, for 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.es:
La señora Clotilde es una mujer emprendedora, tiene 42 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, de 21 (casado), 15 y de un año y cuatro meses, se dedica a la venta diaria de ropa, (como ambulante), en la estación de verano a la venta de refrescos de fruta (chicha, maracuyá) y por las noches a la venta de pollo brosther, desde hace 20 años.
Clotilde nos cuenta que los préstamos le han sido de mucha ayuda, ya que ha logrado mejorar su vivienda, ha comprado artefactos y una moto taxi, sus ingresos cubren los gastos de pago de servicios, y el capital que resta lo invierte en su negocio. El gran sueño de Clotilde es tener una tienda de ropa. El reciente préstamo otorgado será invertido para comprar accesorios de moto taxi (puertas, kit de retroceso). Clotilde agradece toda la ayuda que le han dado porque gracias a eso ha salido adelante, por eso es responsable con sus créditos, ha crecido y sigue creciendo junto con su familia y también  como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Clotilde is an enterprising woman. She is 42 years old, is married, and has three children; ages 21 (married), 15, and 1 year, four months. She sells clothing daily (on foot). In the summer station she also sells fruit drinks (chicha, and maracuyá) and in the evenings she sells roast chicken. She’s been doing this for 20 years. Clotilde tells us that the loans have helped her make improvements to her home, helped her buy artifacts, and buy a moto taxi. Her income is enough to cover her service payments. Whatever capital is left over, she reinvests in her business. Cliotilde would like to have a clothing store some day. The money from this loan will be used to buy mototaxi accessories (doors, backup kit). She appreciates all the help that she has been given. Thanks to it, she has come out ahead. This is why she is responsible with her loans. She has grown and continues to grow, along with her family and as a small business woman.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mototaxi parts

loans.name: Perlas Group

texts.es: El grupo D. Mujeres Perlas  Acuden a la Asociaciòn ASDIR para poder ayudarles en el incremento D. capital ya que ellas venden ropa tipica   en otros municipios y lugares para poder salir avante ya que con este trabajo  han logrado salir en la vida, ya que tiene 8 años atras  D. realizar dicha ventas y por ello piden esta ayuda y asi surtir la mercaderia y tener buenas ganancias y tener otro nivel D. vida.
texts.en:
The Perlas (Pearls) group of women have come to the ASDIR association to request assistance to raise capital. They sell traditional clothing in other municipalities and places in order to get ahead. With this work they have been able to get ahead in life. They have been selling clothes for 8 years. They are requesting this loan to add inventory, have strong earnings, and have a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raise capital
